original: @153b rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @153b rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya ta th'a ga ta ma h'a ka ru na nir de sha n'a ma mah'a y'a na s'u tra; bod skad du /
analyzed: a'arya ta th'a ga ta ma h'a ka ru na nir de sha n'a ma mah'a y'a na s'u tra; bod skad du /
translated: Ārya-tathāgata-mahākaruṇānirdeśa-nāma-mahāyāna-sūtra🔽In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po nges par bstan pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
analyzed: 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po nges par bstan pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
translated: The Noble Great Vehicle Sūtra called The Teaching of the Tathāgata's Great Compassion

original: bam po dang po /🔽sangs rgyas dang / @154a *//
analyzed: bam po dang po / sangs rgyas dang / @154a *//
translated: Part One🔽Homage to the Buddha

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: and all Bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time.

original: rgyal po'i khab na bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri sngon rgyal ba bzhugs bzhugs pa'i mchod rten chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis brlabs pa /
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab na bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri sngon rgyal ba bzhugs bzhugs pa'i mchod rten chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis brlabs pa /
translated: In Rājagṛha, on the Vulture Peak, in the great stūpa blessed by the Tathāgata,

original: sa'i snying po byang chub sems dpas mngon par bstod pa /
analyzed: sa'i snying po byang chub sems dpas mngon par bstod pa /
translated: praised by the bodhisattva Kṣitigarbha,

original: chos kyi gdan /
analyzed: chos kyi gdan /
translated: the seat of Dharma,

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin gyis phyag byas pa'i sa phyogs /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin gyis phyag byas pa'i sa phyogs /
translated: the place where devas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, and asuras pay homage.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par skul ba /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par skul ba /
translated: the roots of virtue that are encouraged,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba /
translated: the appearance of the tathāgatas,

original: chos kyi sgo mngon par brjod pa /
analyzed: chos kyi sgo mngon par brjod pa /
translated: the expression of the Dharma gateway,

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'byung ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'byung ba /
translated: the appearance of bodhisattvas,

original: yon tan tshad med pa las yang dag par byung ba /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul na bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid ni /
analyzed: yon tan tshad med pa las yang dag par byung ba / de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul na bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid ni /
translated: the arising of immeasurable qualities,🔽and the domain of the tathāgatas.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas /🔽chos kyi 'khor lo ni /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas / chos kyi 'khor lo ni /
translated: The Blessed One has fully awakened to the sameness of all phenomena.

original: shin tu bskor /
analyzed: shin tu bskor /
translated: He has turned the wheel of the Dharma.

original: slob ma shin tu dul ba mtha' yas pa'i tshogs ni /
analyzed: slob ma shin tu dul ba mtha' yas pa'i tshogs ni /
translated: He has a retinue of infinite well-disciplined disciples.

original: mnga'/ chos thams cad la mnga' dbang ni /🔽brnyes / sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa sgrub pa ni /
analyzed: mnga'/ chos thams cad la mnga' dbang ni / brnyes / sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa sgrub pa ni /
translated: He has mastered all phenomena.

original: legs par mkhyen /
analyzed: legs par mkhyen /
translated: He knows well how to fulfill the wishes of all beings.

original: dbang po dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: He has attained the perfection of the highest faculties.

original: brnyes / sems can thams cad kyi bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba legs par 'joms pa la ni /
analyzed: brnyes / sems can thams cad kyi bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba legs par 'joms pa la ni /
translated: He has well destroyed the habitual tendencies of all beings.

original: mkhas / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa @154b ni; rgyun mi chad cing dge slong stong phrag drug cu'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs te /
analyzed: mkhas / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa @154b ni; rgyun mi chad cing dge slong stong phrag drug cu'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs te /
translated: The Buddha was staying in the Jeta Grove in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park in Śrāvastī, together with a great saṅgha of six thousand monks.

original: thams cad kyang cang shes pa /
analyzed: thams cad kyang cang shes pa /
translated: All of them were worthy ones,

original: glang po chen po //🔽bya ba byas pa /
analyzed: glang po chen po // bya ba byas pa /
translated: great elephants,🔽who had done what had to be done,

original: byed pa byas pa /
analyzed: byed pa byas pa /
translated: done what had to be done,

original: khur bor ba /
analyzed: khur bor ba /
translated: laid down the burden,

original: bdag gi don rjes su thob pa /
analyzed: bdag gi don rjes su thob pa /
translated: attained their own goal,

original: srid par kun tu sbyor ba yongs su zad pa /
analyzed: srid par kun tu sbyor ba yongs su zad pa /
translated: exhausted the fetters of existence,

original: yang dag pa'i shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
translated: with their minds completely liberated by right knowledge,

original: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba /
translated: with their wisdom completely liberated,

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad legs par bcom pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad legs par bcom pa /
translated: and who had well destroyed all the bonds of the latent tendencies of afflictions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi rgyal po'i sras /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi rgyal po'i sras /
translated: They were the sons of the Tathāgata, the Dharma King,

original: chos zab mo la gnas par mkhas pa /
analyzed: chos zab mo la gnas par mkhas pa /
translated: skilled in abiding in the profound Dharma,

original: dmigs pa med pa'i chos kyis nges par byung ba /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i chos kyis nges par byung ba /
translated: who had emerged through the Dharma of non-apprehension,

original: spyod lam mdzes pa phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: spyod lam mdzes pa phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: with perfect and beautiful conduct.

original: sbyin pa'i gnas chen por gyur pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gnas chen por gyur pa /
translated: They were all great fields of generosity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' la shin tu zhugs pa sha stag go /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' la shin tu zhugs pa sha stag go /
translated: They were all completely devoted to the teachings of the Tathāgata.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dpag tu med pa dang yang thabs cig ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dpag tu med pa dang yang thabs cig ste /
translated: He was also together with an immeasurable saṅgha of bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen pa chags pa med pa'i spyod yul gyis nges par byung ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen pa chags pa med pa'i spyod yul gyis nges par byung ba /
translated: bodhisattva mahāsattvas who had emerged through the conduct of the unobstructed omniscience of the buddhas,

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'i chos kyi sprin las lhag mthong dang / rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i glog phyung zhing bdud rtsi'i chu'i rgyun gyi char 'bebs pas 'gro ba thams cad tshim par byed pa /🔽sems can thams cad la sems @155a *//
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'i chos kyi sprin las lhag mthong dang / rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i glog phyung zhing bdud rtsi'i chu'i rgyun gyi char 'bebs pas 'gro ba thams cad tshim par byed pa / sems can thams cad la sems @155a *//
translated: who had the cloud of the Dharma of great love and great compassion, who had the lightning of vipaśyanā and knowledge and the rain of the stream of the water of immortality, who satisfied all beings,🔽who had a mind that was equal to the earth

original: sa dang mnyam pa /
analyzed: sa dang mnyam pa /
translated: with regard to all beings,

original: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang bral ba /
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang bral ba /
translated: who were free from attachment and anger,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sna tshogs kyi lo thog yang dag par 'phel bar byed pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sna tshogs kyi lo thog yang dag par 'phel bar byed pa /
translated: and who caused the crops of the various dharmas of the aspects of enlightenment to grow.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bas lhag pa'i shes rab kyi 'od zer rab tu gtong bas gti mug gi mun pa sel ba'i lam gyi snang ba thob pa kun tu ston pa dang / sems can gyi padma kha 'byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bas lhag pa'i shes rab kyi 'od zer rab tu gtong bas gti mug gi mun pa sel ba'i lam gyi snang ba thob pa kun tu ston pa dang / sems can gyi padma kha 'byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par byed pa dang /
translated: They open the lotuses of sentient beings, ripen their roots of virtue,🔽dry up the swamp of craving, and establish them in the activity of wisdom.

original: sred pa'i chu skem pa dang / shes pa'i las kyi mtha' la rab tu 'jog pa la mngon par shes pa chen po dang / zhi gnas kyis rgyu ba /
analyzed: sred pa'i chu skem pa dang / shes pa'i las kyi mtha' la rab tu 'jog pa la mngon par shes pa chen po dang / zhi gnas kyis rgyu ba /
translated: They have great supernormal knowledge and move with tranquility.

original: zla ba lta bur 'gro ba thams cad la sems mnyam pas mngon par zhi bar bya ba'i bsam pa tshim par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pas 'grib pa dang 'phel ba kun tu ston pa /
analyzed: zla ba lta bur 'gro ba thams cad la sems mnyam pas mngon par zhi bar bya ba'i bsam pa tshim par bya ba'i thabs la mkhas pas 'grib pa dang 'phel ba kun tu ston pa /
translated: Like the moon, they have a peaceful attitude toward all beings and, through their skill in methods, they manifest waning and waxing.

original: ri rab lta bu'i lhag pa'i bsam bas tshangs pa'i gnas pa'i rin po che shin tu brtan te /
analyzed: ri rab lta bu'i lhag pa'i bsam bas tshangs pa'i gnas pa'i rin po che shin tu brtan te /
translated: Like Mount Meru, they are steadfast in the precious states of Brahmā due to their superior motivation.

original: ngos bzhi nas yul gyi rlung thams cad kyis mi sgul cing 'jig rten gyi chos las mngon par 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kun tu bstan pa snang bar gyur pa /
analyzed: ngos bzhi nas yul gyi rlung thams cad kyis mi sgul cing 'jig rten gyi chos las mngon par 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kun tu bstan pa snang bar gyur pa /
translated: It was unmoved by the winds of the four directions, and it revealed all the buddha realms that are superior to the world.

original: rgya mtsho chen po ltar gzungs dang dran pa'i snod rgya chen po chos kyi chus yongs su gang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rin po /🔽@155b ches 'gro ba thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po ltar gzungs dang dran pa'i snod rgya chen po chos kyi chus yongs su gang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rin po / @155b ches 'gro ba thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba /
translated: It was like the great ocean, a vast vessel of memory and retention filled with the water of the Dharma, and it was the source of the jewels of bodhisattva conduct.

original: ri dvags kyi rgyal po ltar bden pa'i rkang pa dang / byams pa rab tu 'phel ba'i mjug ma dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi mig dang ldan zhing chos zab mo la skrag pa med pas pha rol rgol ba thams cad 'joms pa /
analyzed: ri dvags kyi rgyal po ltar bden pa'i rkang pa dang / byams pa rab tu 'phel ba'i mjug ma dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi mig dang ldan zhing chos zab mo la skrag pa med pas pha rol rgol ba thams cad 'joms pa /
translated: It was like the king of beasts, with the legs of the truth, the tail of increasing love, the eyes of śamatha and vipaśyanā, and the fearlessness of the profound Dharma, and it conquered all opponents.

original: bskal pa brgya stong phrag dpag tu med cing mtha' yas thug pa med par byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgyun ma bcad pas yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa sha stag dang thabs cig pa la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bskal pa brgya stong phrag dpag tu med cing mtha' yas thug pa med par byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgyun ma bcad pas yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa sha stag dang thabs cig pa la 'di lta ste /
translated: He was together with a great gathering of bodhisattvas who were all endowed with every good quality, having practiced the conduct of bodhisattvas for countless, limitless, and endless hundreds of thousands of eons. They were:🔽the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samanta­avabhāsa­anāvaraṇa­dṛṣṭi,🔽the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­kṣetra­vyūha­saṃdarśana,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun nas snang zhing sgrib pa med par lta ba zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhing thams cad kyi rgyan bkod pa kun tu ston pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs las byung ba'i spyod pa'i blo gros zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun nas snang zhing sgrib pa med par lta ba zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhing thams cad kyi rgyan bkod pa kun tu ston pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs las byung ba'i spyod pa'i blo gros zhes bya ba dang /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva Tathāgata-kula-saṃbhava-cāritra-mati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyod lam thams cad kyis 'dul ba mi 'khrugs pa kun tu ston pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spobs pa mtha' yas pa'i tog gi rgyal mtshan rnam par sprul pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba dang /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sems dpa' chen po gser bzang po bsags pa'i @156a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spyod lam thams cad kyis 'dul ba mi 'khrugs pa kun tu ston pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spobs pa mtha' yas pa'i tog gi rgyal mtshan rnam par sprul pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sems dpa' chen po gser bzang po bsags pa'i @156a *//
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­śīla­samucchraya­akṣobhya­saṃdarśana, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Anantapratibhāna­ketudhvaja­nirmita­nirghoṣa,

original: 'od kyi gzi brjid kyi 'od zer zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyis rnam par nges pa'i tshig la spobs pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pas brtan pas bsags pa zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'od kyi gzi brjid kyi 'od zer zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyis rnam par nges pa'i tshig la spobs pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pas brtan pas bsags pa zhes bya ba dang /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva Suvarṇa­puṇya­acaya­tejorāja, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Prajñā­vyavasthāna­niruktipratibhāna, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Akṣayapuṇya­jñānasaṃbhāra­dhṛg,

original: de la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po grangs med dpag tu med pa dag dang thabs cig go /
analyzed: de la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po grangs med dpag tu med pa dag dang thabs cig go /
translated: He was together with an immeasurable and limitless number of bodhisattva great beings such as these.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pas nges par 'byung ba sgrib pa med pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs yang dag par rab tu ston to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pas nges par 'byung ba sgrib pa med pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs yang dag par rab tu ston to //
translated: Then the Blessed One taught the Dharma discourse called The Unobscured Gate of the Bodhisattva’s Entry into the Conduct of Awakening.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas lo bcu drug bzhes te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas lo bcu drug bzhes te /
translated: Then, sixteen years after the Blessed One’s complete awakening,

original: tshangs par spyod pa rgyas par gyur par mkhyen /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa rgyas par gyur par mkhyen /
translated: he knew that the practice of pure conduct had flourished.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'dus pa chen po de'ang gzigs shing mkhyen te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'dus pa chen po de'ang gzigs shing mkhyen te /
translated: He saw and knew that great assembly of bodhisattvas.

original: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' 'dus pa 'di dag ni /
analyzed: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' 'dus pa 'di dag ni /
translated: “Ah! These bodhisattvas have gathered.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mdzod 'dzin par mkhyen nas 'di snyam du gang gi phyir ngas byang chub sems dpa' rgya cher rjes su yongs su gzung ba dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mdzod 'dzin par mkhyen nas 'di snyam du gang gi phyir ngas byang chub sems dpa' rgya cher rjes su yongs su gzung ba dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: Knowing that they would uphold the Thus-Gone One’s treasury of Dharma, he thought, ‘Since I have so thoroughly accepted the bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @156b po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la gzud pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i cho 'phrul chen pos byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pas nges par 'byung ba sgrib pa med pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs yang dag par bstan par bya'o snyam du dgongs so; ;de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das de
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @156b po rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la gzud pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i cho 'phrul chen pos byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pas nges par 'byung ba sgrib pa med pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs yang dag par bstan par bya'o snyam du dgongs so; ;de nas de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das de
translated: Then at that time the Bhagavān

original: bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi yul rnam par sprul pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi yul rnam par sprul pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: entered the samādhi of the tathāgatas called the manifestation of the domain of the buddhas just as it is.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi yul rnam par sprul pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba de la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu de nas de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus steng gi bar snang
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi yul rnam par sprul pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba de la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu de nas de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus steng gi bar snang
translated: As soon as the Blessed One had entered the thus-gone absorption called the display of the domain of the buddhas, at that moment, through the power of the Buddha, a pavilion appeared in the sky above,

original: la 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi bar du 'khor gyi khyams /
analyzed: la 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi bar du 'khor gyi khyams /
translated: extending from the desire realm up to the realm of form.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas /
translated: It was a buddha realm,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas mngon par grub pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas mngon par grub pa /
translated: a thus-gone one’s abode that was accomplished through roots of virtue,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyong ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyong ba /
translated: purified the bodhisattvas’ intentions,

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byed pa /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byed pa /
translated: illuminated the worlds in the ten directions,

original: sems can tshad med pa'i bsam pa tshim par byed pa /
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa'i bsam pa tshim par byed pa /
translated: satisfied the aspirations of countless beings,

original: lha'i gzhal med khang thams cad zil gyis gnon @157a *//
analyzed: lha'i gzhal med khang thams cad zil gyis gnon @157a *//
translated: overshadowed all the celestial palaces,

original: pa / phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par skul ba /
analyzed: pa / phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par skul ba /
translated: and inspired the bodhisattvas in the ten directions.

original: gzhi bee d'urya dkar po'i dbyibs dang / dzambu'i gling gi gser gyi khang pa dag dang / dpal gyi snying po'i rta babs dag dang / rin po che rdo'i snying po'i sgo khang dag dang / nor bu rin po che snying po'i kha khyer dag dang /🔽rin po che dri ma med pa'i 'od kyi stegs bu dag dang / rin po che kun nas 'od kyi khang pa brtsegs pa dag dang / rin po che thams cad kyis dgab pa dang / mu tig gi rgyan phreng rab tu dpyangs pa dang /
analyzed: gzhi bee d'urya dkar po'i dbyibs dang / dzambu'i gling gi gser gyi khang pa dag dang / dpal gyi snying po'i rta babs dag dang / rin po che rdo'i snying po'i sgo khang dag dang / nor bu rin po che snying po'i kha khyer dag dang / rin po che dri ma med pa'i 'od kyi stegs bu dag dang / rin po che kun nas 'od kyi khang pa brtsegs pa dag dang / rin po che thams cad kyis dgab pa dang / mu tig gi rgyan phreng rab tu dpyangs pa dang /
translated: the shape of the white beryl ground, the golden palaces of Jambudvīpa, the archways of the center of glory, the doorways of the essence of precious stones, the ledges of the essence of precious jewels,🔽the terraces of the light of stainless jewels, the kūṭāgāras of the light of all jewels, the coverings of all jewels, the hanging garlands of pearl ornaments,

original: gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan sgreng ba dang / lha'i dar gyi lda ldi mngon par dbyangs pas bsngags pa bstan pa dpag tu med cing thug pa med pa stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad tsam zhig byung ste /
analyzed: gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan sgreng ba dang / lha'i dar gyi lda ldi mngon par dbyangs pas bsngags pa bstan pa dpag tu med cing thug pa med pa stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad tsam zhig byung ste /
translated: the raised parasols, victory banners, and flags, and the hanging silk tassels.

original: 'khor gyi khyams de'ang tsandan sprul gyi snying pos bskus pa /
analyzed: 'khor gyi khyams de'ang tsandan sprul gyi snying pos bskus pa /
translated: The courtyard was anointed with the essence of uragasāra sandalwood.

original: tsandan dus kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i dri yid du 'ong ba dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tsandan dus kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i dri yid du 'ong ba dang ldan pa /
translated: It had a pleasant scent that followed the seasons.

original: dri'i mchog aa ga ru dam pa'i snying pos bdugs pa /
analyzed: dri'i mchog aa ga ru dam pa'i snying pos bdugs pa /
translated: It was perfumed with the essence of the finest agaru.

original: klu'i mu tig dang rin po che'i me tog gis rnam par spras pa /
analyzed: klu'i mu tig dang rin po che'i me tog gis rnam par spras pa /
translated: It was adorned with nāga pearls and precious flowers.

original: me tog sil ma bkram pa /
analyzed: me tog sil ma bkram pa /
translated: It was strewn with loose flowers.

original: rin po che'i shing dang / rin po che'i mkha' rten gyis mdzes par byas pa ste /
analyzed: rin po che'i shing dang / rin po che'i mkha' rten gyis mdzes par byas pa ste /
translated: It was beautified with precious trees and precious canopies.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig @157b rten gyi khams thams cad na rgyan mdzes pa bgod pa ji snyed ba de dag thams cad 'khor gyi khyams de nyid na kun tu snang ngo //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig @157b rten gyi khams thams cad na rgyan mdzes pa bgod pa ji snyed ba de dag thams cad 'khor gyi khyams de nyid na kun tu snang ngo //
translated: All the beautiful ornaments in all the worlds in the ten directions were all seen in that courtyard.

original: der gdan sengge'i khri bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po dpag tu med pa /
analyzed: der gdan sengge'i khri bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang po dpag tu med pa /
translated: There were many quintillions of lion thrones,

original: grangs med pa /
analyzed: grangs med pa /
translated: incalculable,

original: sna tshogs pa /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa /
translated: varied,

original: blta na sdug pa /🔽mtho ba / rab tu bzang ba /
analyzed: blta na sdug pa / mtho ba / rab tu bzang ba /
translated: beautiful to behold,🔽lofty,🔽very fine,🔽vast,

original: yangs pa / rgya che ba /🔽yid du 'ong ba /
analyzed: yangs pa / rgya che ba /🔽yid du 'ong ba /
translated: and extensive.

original: yid dga' bar byed pa dag byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: yid dga' bar byed pa dag byung bar gyur to //
translated: and they were delightful.

original: gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir them skas kha khyer mi bdun gyi 'phang tsam gyis bskor ba /
analyzed: gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir them skas kha khyer mi bdun gyi 'phang tsam gyis bskor ba /
translated: In this four-continent world system, there appeared staircases that were as wide as seven men’s outstretched arms,

original: rgyar dpag tshad phyed kyis yongs su bzung ba /
analyzed: rgyar dpag tshad phyed kyis yongs su bzung ba /
translated: half a league in length,

original: rin po che aanda rnyil dang / mthon kha chen pos snying por gyur pa /
analyzed: rin po che aanda rnyil dang / mthon kha chen pos snying por gyur pa /
translated: with a core of the precious blue sapphire and great lapis lazuli,

original: brgya byin thogs pa'i nor bu rin po che chen po'i gdugs can /🔽tshangs pa'i ne tso'am ci dang / rin po che ser pos spras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin thogs pa'i nor bu rin po che chen po'i gdugs can / tshangs pa'i ne tso'am ci dang / rin po che ser pos spras pa /
translated: covered with the precious great jewel held by Śakra,🔽adorned with the precious parrot-green and yellow jewels,

original: rin po che'i dril bu g-yer kha'i dra ba kun tu bskyod pas sgra 'byung ba /
analyzed: rin po che'i dril bu g-yer kha'i dra ba kun tu bskyod pas sgra 'byung ba /
translated: and with a network of small precious bells that rang when moved.

original: sa'i steng nas 'khor gyi khyams la thug gi bar du gyen du mngon par 'phags pa /
analyzed: sa'i steng nas 'khor gyi khyams la thug gi bar du gyen du mngon par 'phags pa /
translated: They rose from the ground to the courtyard,

original: drang pa / ma yo ba bzhi stong byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: drang pa / ma yo ba bzhi stong byung bar gyur to //
translated: straight and without bends, and there were four thousand of them.

original: gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir ji lta ba bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du'ang de lta bu'i them skas chen po dag byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir ji lta ba bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du'ang de lta bu'i them skas chen po dag byung bar gyur to //
translated: Just as in this world system of four continents, so it was in all the world systems of four continents in all the great trichiliocosm.

original: @158a *// de nas bcom ldan 'das dgongs shing mkhyen bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs par gyur to //
analyzed: @158a *// de nas bcom ldan 'das dgongs shing mkhyen bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs par gyur to //
translated: Then the Blessed One, with full awareness and intention, arose from that absorption.

original: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs ma thag tu stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam pa drug tu g-yos te snang ba chen po'ang byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs ma thag tu stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam pa drug tu g-yos te snang ba chen po'ang byung bar gyur to //
translated: As soon as the Blessed One arose from that absorption, the entire great trichiliocosm shook in six ways and a great light appeared.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dang thabs cig /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dang thabs cig /
translated: Then the Blessed One, together with an assembly of bodhisattvas,

original: nyan thos kyi tshigs dang thabs cig tu byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor zhing nyan thos kyi tshogs kyis mdun du bdar te lha dang / klus mngon par bstod cing me tog gi char chen po ni /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi tshigs dang thabs cig tu byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor zhing nyan thos kyi tshogs kyis mdun du bdar te lha dang / klus mngon par bstod cing me tog gi char chen po ni /
translated: He was surrounded by a host of bodhisattvas and attended by a host of śrāvakas. He was praised by devas and nāgas,

original: 'bebs / na bza'i char chen pos ni /
analyzed: 'bebs / na bza'i char chen pos ni /
translated: and a great rain of flowers

original: mngon par 'gebs /
analyzed: mngon par 'gebs /
translated: was falling.🔽A great rain of clothing🔽was covering him.🔽A great rain of incense,

original: phye ma dang / spos dang / byug pa'i char chen po ni /
analyzed: phye ma dang / spos dang / byug pa'i char chen po ni /
translated: perfumes, and ointments🔽was being scattered.

original: 'thor / sil snyan dang / sgra dbyangs chen po ni /
analyzed: 'thor / sil snyan dang / sgra dbyangs chen po ni /
translated: A great sound of music and song

original: rab tu sgrog /
analyzed: rab tu sgrog /
translated: was being made.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa ni /
translated: Innumerable world systems

original: rab tu g-yo bar mdzad /
analyzed: rab tu g-yo bar mdzad /
translated: were shaking.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa ni /
translated: In countless world systems

original: snang bar mdzad cing sangs rgyas kyi mthu chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi cho 'phrul chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog tu gyur pa chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs chen po dang /🔽sangs rgyas kyi gzi brjid chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin chen po dang / sangs rgyas @158b kyi rnam par 'phrul pa chen pos bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri las mi snang bar gyur te lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang /
analyzed: snang bar mdzad cing sangs rgyas kyi mthu chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi cho 'phrul chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog tu gyur pa chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi gzi brjid chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin chen po dang / sangs rgyas @158b kyi rnam par 'phrul pa chen pos bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri las mi snang bar gyur te lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang /
translated: He was accompanied by many hundreds of thousands of gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, demigods, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, and mahoragas, and he was also accompanied by many hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas.🔽With the great power of the Buddha, the great miracles of the Buddha, the great manifestations of the Buddha, the great preeminence of the Buddha, the great blessings of the Buddha,

original: dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po bye ba phrag du ma zhabs 'bring du 'brang zhing nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyi them skas kyi dbus nas 'khor gyi khyams bkod pa ga la ba der gshegs so //
analyzed: dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po bye ba phrag du ma zhabs 'bring du 'brang zhing nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyi them skas kyi dbus nas 'khor gyi khyams bkod pa ga la ba der gshegs so //
translated: the great splendor of the Buddha, the great majesty of the Buddha, and the great miracles of the Buddha, he disappeared from Vulture Peak and arrived in the center of the jeweled staircase.🔽He then went to the center of the pavilion of the Dharma.

original: de nas rgyal po chen po bzhi la sogs pa rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das them skas su zhugs par rig nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir lha'i me tog gi sprin gyi char rab tu phab ste thal mo sbyar
analyzed: de nas rgyal po chen po bzhi la sogs pa rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das them skas su zhugs par rig nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir lha'i me tog gi sprin gyi char rab tu phab ste thal mo sbyar
translated: Then the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings, such as the Four Great Kings, knowing that the Blessed One had ascended the staircase, brought down a rain of clouds of divine flowers in order to worship the Blessed One,

original: nas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod pa /
analyzed: nas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod pa /
translated: and with palms joined in reverence, they praised the Blessed One:

original: nyi ma me dang nor bu'i 'od dang lha yul pa yi lha 'od shin tu dri med pa //
analyzed: nyi ma me dang nor bu'i 'od dang lha yul pa yi lha 'od shin tu dri med pa //
translated: “The light of the sun, fire, jewels, and the gods of the heavens is utterly stainless,

original: thub pas 'od kyis thams cad zil gyis mnan nas ngan song gsum po dag kyang zhi bar mdzad //
analyzed: thub pas 'od kyis thams cad zil gyis mnan nas ngan song gsum po dag kyang zhi bar mdzad //
translated: but the light of the Sage outshines them all and pacifies the three lower realms.

original: ri bo lhun po dang ni khor khor yug rtse mo bsnyil te zhing rnams gsal bar gyur pas na //
analyzed: ri bo lhun po dang ni khor khor yug rtse mo bsnyil te zhing rnams gsal bar gyur pas na //
translated: Mount Meru and the peaks of the encircling snowy mountains are crushed and the realms are illuminated,

original: dga' zhing yid rnams mgu nas don rnams thams cad grub pa'i rgyal ba la ni skyabs su mchi //
analyzed: dga' zhing yid rnams mgu nas don rnams thams cad grub pa'i rgyal ba la ni skyabs su mchi //
translated: so with joyful and delighted minds, we go for refuge to the Victorious One, who accomplishes all aims.”

original: de nas rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'dis mngon par bstod nas bcom ldan 'das gshegs pa'i zhabs 'bring du 'brang ngo //🔽de nas lha'i @159a *//🔽dbang po brgya byin la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das them skas su zhugs par rig nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir lha'i spos kyi sprin gyi char rab tu phab ste thal mo sbyar nas bcom ldan 'das
analyzed: de nas rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'dis mngon par bstod nas bcom ldan 'das gshegs pa'i zhabs 'bring du 'brang ngo // de nas lha'i @159a *// dbang po brgya byin la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das them skas su zhugs par rig nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir lha'i spos kyi sprin gyi char rab tu phab ste thal mo sbyar nas bcom ldan 'das
translated: Then the gods of the Heaven of the Four Kings, having praised the Bhagavān with this verse, followed behind the Bhagavān as he departed.

original: la mngon par bstod pa /
analyzed: la mngon par bstod pa /
translated: Then the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, led by Śakra, lord of the gods, having seen that the Bhagavān had ascended the staircase, brought down a rain of divine incense clouds in order to make offerings to the Bhagavān. With palms joined, they praised the Bhagavān:

original: rdzu 'phrul dam pa brnyes shing rab tu mtshungs pa med pa rnam par 'phrul pa shin tu ston //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dam pa brnyes shing rab tu mtshungs pa med pa rnam par 'phrul pa shin tu ston //
translated: “You have attained the highest magic power and are completely unequaled. You display your miracles.

original: rgyal ba nyi ma ji bzhin 'phags te zhing rnams bye ba brgya dag tu yang rab tu gda'//
analyzed: rgyal ba nyi ma ji bzhin 'phags te zhing rnams bye ba brgya dag tu yang rab tu gda'//
translated: The Victorious One shines like the sun and is seen in a hundred million realms.”

original: rgyal bas rang gi yon tan kun gyis zhing rnams thams cad brgyan te shin tu mdzes mdzad pa //
analyzed: rgyal bas rang gi yon tan kun gyis zhing rnams thams cad brgyan te shin tu mdzes mdzad pa //
translated: The Victorious One, with all his qualities, adorns and beautifies all the fields.

original: gang zhig shin tu mnyam med mtshungs pa med cing rdzu 'phrul dbang du gyur la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gang zhig shin tu mnyam med mtshungs pa med cing rdzu 'phrul dbang du gyur la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the one who is utterly incomparable, who has mastered miraculous powers.

original: de nas sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'dis mngon par bstod nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs 'bring du 'brang ngo //🔽de nas lha'i rgyal po rab 'thab bral la sogs pa 'thab bral gyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das them skas su zhugs par rig nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir lha'i na bza'i sprin gyi char rab tu phab ste thal mo sbyar nas bcom
analyzed: de nas sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'dis mngon par bstod nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs 'bring du 'brang ngo // de nas lha'i rgyal po rab 'thab bral la sogs pa 'thab bral gyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das them skas su zhugs par rig nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir lha'i na bza'i sprin gyi char rab tu phab ste thal mo sbyar nas bcom
translated: Then the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, having praised the Blessed One with this verse, followed in the Blessed One's retinue.

original: ldan 'das la mngon par bstod pa /
analyzed: ldan 'das la mngon par bstod pa /
translated: Then the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife, such as the king of gods Suyāma, upon seeing that the Blessed One had ascended the staircase, caused a rain of clouds of divine garments to fall in order to make offerings to the Blessed One. With palms joined, they praised the Blessed One:

original: bde gshegs khyod kyi mkhyen pa mtha' yas @159b yangs pas sems can bsam pa mkhyen //
analyzed: bde gshegs khyod kyi mkhyen pa mtha' yas @159b yangs pas sems can bsam pa mkhyen //
translated: Sugata, with your limitless and vast knowledge, you know the thoughts of beings.

original: mkha' 'dra'i lam gyi chos gsum dag la chags med thams cad mkhyen pa nyid //
analyzed: mkha' 'dra'i lam gyi chos gsum dag la chags med thams cad mkhyen pa nyid //
translated: The omniscience of the one who is unattached to the three dharmas of the path that is like space,

original: sems kyi 'jug pa gcig gis 'gro ba'i sems kyi spyod pa thams cad mkhyen //
analyzed: sems kyi 'jug pa gcig gis 'gro ba'i sems kyi spyod pa thams cad mkhyen //
translated: Knows the activities of the minds of all beings with a single engagement of mind.

original: des na srid pa gsum po dag na lus can rnams kyis mchod par 'os //
analyzed: des na srid pa gsum po dag na lus can rnams kyis mchod par 'os //
translated: Therefore, he is worthy of worship by embodied beings in the three existences.

original: de nas 'thab bral gyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'dis mngon par bstod nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs 'bring du 'brang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas 'thab bral gyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'dis mngon par bstod nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs 'bring du 'brang bar gyur to //
translated: Then, after the gods of Yāma had praised the Blessed One with this verse, they became attendants of the Blessed One.

original: de nas lha'i rgyal po rab dga' ldan la sogs pa dga' ldan gyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das them skas su zhugs par rig nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir lha'i rin po che'i sprin gyi char rab tu phab ste thal mo sbyar nas
analyzed: de nas lha'i rgyal po rab dga' ldan la sogs pa dga' ldan gyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das them skas su zhugs par rig nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir lha'i rin po che'i sprin gyi char rab tu phab ste thal mo sbyar nas
translated: Then, the gods of Tuṣita, such as the king of gods Suyāma, having seen that the Blessed One had ascended the staircase, caused a rain of clouds of divine jewels to fall for the sake of making offerings to the Blessed One. With palms joined,

original: bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod pa /
translated: they praised the Blessed One:

original: gang gi slad du sgra dang yi ge ma mchis gang du'ang rgyu ba ma mchis pas //
analyzed: gang gi slad du sgra dang yi ge ma mchis gang du'ang rgyu ba ma mchis pas //
translated: Because it is without sound or letters, and does not move anywhere,

original: khyod kyis chos rnams mi g-yo ya ma brla dang sgyu ma smig rgyu 'drar mkhyen nas //
analyzed: khyod kyis chos rnams mi g-yo ya ma brla dang sgyu ma smig rgyu 'drar mkhyen nas //
translated: You know phenomena to be unwavering, unreal, like illusions or mirages.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs rjes sems can rnams la ched du chos mchog gsungs pas na //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs rjes sems can rnams la ched du chos mchog gsungs pas na //
translated: Yet, Blessed One, out of compassion for beings, you deliberately teach the supreme Dharma.

original: chos kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin mkhas pa bdag med gsung ba'i rgyal la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽de nas dga' ldan gyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad @160a *//
analyzed: chos kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin mkhas pa bdag med gsung ba'i rgyal la phyag 'tshal lo // de nas dga' ldan gyi ris kyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad @160a *//
translated: Homage to you, O King who teaches selflessness and the nature of phenomena, O wise one!

original: pa 'dis mngon par bstod nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs 'bring du 'brang ngo //
analyzed: pa 'dis mngon par bstod nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs 'bring du 'brang ngo //
translated: Then the gods of Tuṣita realm praised the Blessed One with this verse, and followed in the Blessed One's footsteps.

original: de nas lha'i rgyal po rab 'phrul dga' la sogs pa 'phrul dga'i lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das them skas su zhugs par rig nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir lha'i rgyan gyi sprin gyi char rab tu phab ste thal mo sbyar nas bcom ldan
analyzed: de nas lha'i rgyal po rab 'phrul dga' la sogs pa 'phrul dga'i lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das them skas su zhugs par rig nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir lha'i rgyan gyi sprin gyi char rab tu phab ste thal mo sbyar nas bcom ldan
translated: Then the gods of the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, headed by the king of the gods Suyāma, knowing that the Blessed One had ascended the staircase, brought down a rain of clouds of divine ornaments in order to worship the Blessed One.

original: 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'dis mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'dis mngon par bstod do //
translated: With palms joined, they praised the Blessed One with this verse:🔽“You who have attained the ten powers, the sky-like radiance, and compassion,

original: chos kyi zong gis rang gi stobs bcu mkha' 'dra 'od zer ldan pa dang // thugs rje brnyes nas byams pa'i dgongs pas sems can rnams la gzugs ston pa //
analyzed: chos kyi zong gis rang gi stobs bcu mkha' 'dra 'od zer ldan pa dang // thugs rje brnyes nas byams pa'i dgongs pas sems can rnams la gzugs ston pa //
translated: you who manifest forms to beings with an attitude of love through the wealth of the Dharma,

original: gru tshul chos la gnyis su med par zhugs kyang rgyal ba mtshungs par mkhyen //
analyzed: gru tshul chos la gnyis su med par zhugs kyang rgyal ba mtshungs par mkhyen //
translated: you who, though nondual in the boat-like Dharma, know the Victor to be equal,

original: chos kyi khyad par sems lhag don kun grub pa'i rgyal la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: chos kyi khyad par sems lhag don kun grub pa'i rgyal la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: we pay homage to the Victor who has accomplished all the special aims of the Dharma with a superior mind!

original: de nas 'phrul dga'i lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'dis mngon par bstod nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs 'bring du 'brang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas 'phrul dga'i lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'dis mngon par bstod nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs 'bring du 'brang bar gyur to //
translated: Then the gods of Nirmāṇarati, having praised the Bhagavat with this verse, became his attendants.

original: de nas lha'i rgyal po dbang sgyur la sogs pa gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das them skas su zhugs pa dang 'khor gyi khyams su mngon par phyogs par rig nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir mu tig gi do shal
analyzed: de nas lha'i rgyal po dbang sgyur la sogs pa gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das them skas su zhugs pa dang 'khor gyi khyams su mngon par phyogs par rig nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir mu tig gi do shal
translated: Then the gods of Paranirmitavaśavartin, such as the king of gods Vaśavartin, having seen that the Bhagavat had entered the staircase and was facing the courtyard, in order to make offerings to the Bhagavat, caused a rain of pearl necklaces

original: gyi @160b sprin gyi char rab tu phab ste /
analyzed: gyi @160b sprin gyi char rab tu phab ste /
translated: and clouds to fall.

original: thal mo sbyar nas bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar nas bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis mngon par bstod do //
translated: With palms joined, they praised the Bhagavat with these verses:

original: tshul khrims dri ma mi mnga' rnam dag rnam par nges pa dam pa ting nge 'dzin mchog mi g-yos pa //
analyzed: tshul khrims dri ma mi mnga' rnam dag rnam par nges pa dam pa ting nge 'dzin mchog mi g-yos pa //
translated: “Pure, stainless discipline, the highest ascertainment, the supreme samādhi, unshakable,

original: mnyam med blo ldan rgya mtsho 'dra bar gnas shing srid las rnam grol dbang sgyur zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: mnyam med blo ldan rgya mtsho 'dra bar gnas shing srid las rnam grol dbang sgyur zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the feet of the one who is free from attachment, who abides like an ocean, who is liberated from existence, and who has power.

original: rim gyis byams dang ldan pa'i thugs rje yis ni bden pa'i lam gyi rnam pa rab tu gnas mdzad pa //
analyzed: rim gyis byams dang ldan pa'i thugs rje yis ni bden pa'i lam gyi rnam pa rab tu gnas mdzad pa //
translated: With a mind full of love, you gradually established the aspects of the path of truth.

original: rnam thar gsum gyi lam gyi khyim na gnas pa'i bde gshegs seng ge khyod la bdag cag phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rnam thar gsum gyi lam gyi khyim na gnas pa'i bde gshegs seng ge khyod la bdag cag phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to you, Sugata Lion, who abides in the house of the path of the three gates of liberation.

original: snying rje'i chu bo ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam 'phel ba //
analyzed: snying rje'i chu bo ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam 'phel ba //
translated: The river of compassion increases through samadhi,

original: zhi gnas 'dab ma rnam par grol ba'i me tog rgyas //
analyzed: zhi gnas 'dab ma rnam par grol ba'i me tog rgyas //
translated: the petals of shamatha bloom with the flowers of liberation,

original: slob ma'i tshogs kyi bung bas nges par bsnyen gyur pa //
analyzed: slob ma'i tshogs kyi bung bas nges par bsnyen gyur pa //
translated: and the bees of disciples gather around.

original: bde gshegs padma la ni spyi bos phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bde gshegs padma la ni spyi bos phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I bow my head to the lotus of the Sugata.

original: mnga' bdag g-yo ba ma mchis tshul khrims sar gnas pas //
analyzed: mnga' bdag g-yo ba ma mchis tshul khrims sar gnas pas //
translated: You are the lord who abides on the ground of discipline without wavering,

original: brtson 'grus mtshungs pa ma mchis stobs kyis yang dag 'phags //
analyzed: brtson 'grus mtshungs pa ma mchis stobs kyis yang dag 'phags //
translated: unequaled in diligence, exalted through strength,

original: yul gyi rlung rnams langs pa chen pos mi g-yos pa //
analyzed: yul gyi rlung rnams langs pa chen pos mi g-yos pa //
translated: unmoved by the great storms of objects.

original: sangs rgyas ri bo dam pa khyod la phyag 'tshal lo; ;mnga' bdag thugs rjes dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor rnam dag pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ri bo dam pa khyod la phyag 'tshal lo; ;mnga' bdag thugs rjes dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor rnam dag pa //
translated: Lord, with the pure maṇḍala of your compassionate voice,

original: blo gter blo mchog gis ni rab tu 'joms mdzad pa //
analyzed: blo gter blo mchog gis ni rab tu 'joms mdzad pa //
translated: You conquer with your supreme mind and treasure of wisdom.

original: sems can brgya dag gis ni mang @161a *//🔽pos mchod gyur pa //
analyzed: sems can brgya dag gis ni mang @161a *// pos mchod gyur pa //
translated: “You are worshipped by many hundreds of beings,

original: bde gshegs zla ba khyod la bdag cag phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bde gshegs zla ba khyod la bdag cag phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Sugata Candra, we pay homage to you!🔽You have gone to the path of liberation that is peaceful like space,

original: mkha' ltar zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa'i lam gshegs pa; ;shes rab 'od kyis phyogs bcu dag ni rgyas 'gengs shing //
analyzed: mkha' ltar zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa'i lam gshegs pa; ;shes rab 'od kyis phyogs bcu dag ni rgyas 'gengs shing //
translated: And the light of your wisdom fills the ten directions.

original: skye bo mang po mtshungs med padma kha 'byed pa //
analyzed: skye bo mang po mtshungs med padma kha 'byed pa //
translated: You open the incomparable lotus of many beings,

original: sangs rgyas nyi ma dam pa khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyi ma dam pa khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Buddha Sūryapradīparāja, we pay homage to you!

original: mnga' bdag phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gsum po dag na yang //
analyzed: mnga' bdag phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gsum po dag na yang //
translated: “Lord, in the ten directions, in the three worlds,

original: 'dren pa khyod dang mnyam pa dmigs par ma gyur te //
analyzed: 'dren pa khyod dang mnyam pa dmigs par ma gyur te //
translated: No guide is seen who is equal to you.

original: khyod ni yon tan kun gyis yang dag grub pa lags //
analyzed: khyod ni yon tan kun gyis yang dag grub pa lags //
translated: You are perfected in all good qualities.

original: bdag cag khyod la bstod pas ngoms par 'gyur ma lags //
analyzed: bdag cag khyod la bstod pas ngoms par 'gyur ma lags //
translated: We are never satisfied with praising you.

original: lha dbang klu dang lha ma yin gyis phyag bgyis pa //🔽lha mchog brgya dag gis kyang yang dag mngon bstod pa //
analyzed: lha dbang klu dang lha ma yin gyis phyag bgyis pa // lha mchog brgya dag gis kyang yang dag mngon bstod pa //
translated: You are worshipped by the lords of the gods, nāgas, and asuras,🔽And are truly praised by the best of gods.

original: bsngags pa brgya phrag mang pos yang dag mngon bstod pa //
analyzed: bsngags pa brgya phrag mang pos yang dag mngon bstod pa //
translated: You are truly praised by many hundreds of praises.

original: bde bar gshegs pa bstod 'os khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa bstod 'os khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Sugata, worthy of praise, we praise you.

original: de nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis mngon par bstod nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs 'bring du 'brang ngo //
analyzed: de nas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis mngon par bstod nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs 'bring du 'brang ngo //
translated: Then the gods of the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations, having praised the Bhagavān with these verses, followed in the retinue of the Bhagavān.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de ltar sangs rgyas kyi yul rnam par sprul pa tshad med pa lha 'bum gyis mngon par bstod nas 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par gshegs @161b te; ji ltar bcom ldan 'das gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de ltar sangs rgyas kyi yul rnam par sprul pa tshad med pa lha 'bum gyis mngon par bstod nas 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par gshegs @161b te; ji ltar bcom ldan 'das gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir
translated: Then the Bhagavān, having been praised by hundreds of thousands of gods with immeasurable emanations of the domain of the buddhas, went to the Jetavana, the garden of Anāthapiṇḍada, in the city of Śrāvastī.

original: them skas nas 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par gshegs pa shes pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: them skas nas 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par gshegs pa shes pa de bzhin du /
translated: He knew that the Blessed One had gone from the staircase to the jeweled courtyard of the retinue.

original: stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na'ang gshegs par shes so //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na'ang gshegs par shes so //
translated: In the same way, he knew that the Blessed One had gone to all the four-continent worlds in all the trichiliocosm.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'khor gyi khyams stong gsum gyis yongs su bzung ba rin po che bkod par gdan sengge'i khri ji ltar bshams pa la bzhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'khor gyi khyams stong gsum gyis yongs su bzung ba rin po che bkod par gdan sengge'i khri ji ltar bshams pa la bzhugs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One sat down on the lion throne that had been arranged in the jeweled courtyard of the trichiliocosm.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos chen po dag kyang stan ci rigs pa la 'khod par gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos chen po dag kyang stan ci rigs pa la 'khod par gyur to //
translated: The bodhisattvas and great hearers also sat down on their respective seats.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin rnam par thar pa sgrib pa med pa la sangs rgyas rnam par rol pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin rnam par thar pa sgrib pa med pa la sangs rgyas rnam par rol pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One, at that time, entered the buddha absorption called the Buddha’s Play in the Unimpeded Liberation.

original: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin rnam par thar pa sgrib pa med pa la sangs rgyas rnam par rol pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i spu'i khung bu thams cad kyi spu'i khung bu re
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin rnam par thar pa sgrib pa med pa la sangs rgyas rnam par rol pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i spu'i khung bu thams cad kyi spu'i khung bu re
translated: The Blessed One entered the meditative absorption called “the Buddha’s display in the unobstructed liberation of samādhi,” and immediately after he did so, from every pore of his body

original: re nas kyang 'od zer gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed byung ste /
analyzed: re nas kyang 'od zer gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed byung ste /
translated: there emerged as many light rays as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River.

original: byung nas kyang shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bar byas so //🔽de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang gi phyogs @162a *//
analyzed: byung nas kyang shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bar byas so // de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang gi phyogs @162a *//
translated: Having emerged, they illuminated all the world systems in the eastern direction.🔽In the same way, they illuminated all the world systems in the southern, western, and northern directions,

original: rnams dang / 'og dang / steng dang / phyogs mtshams rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bar byas so //
analyzed: rnams dang / 'og dang / steng dang / phyogs mtshams rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bar byas so //
translated: in the nadir and the zenith, and in the intermediate directions.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams snang bar byas ma thag tu de nas sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can thams cad kyi sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba rgyun chad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams snang bar byas ma thag tu de nas sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can thams cad kyi sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba rgyun chad do //
translated: As soon as the worlds were illuminated, the feelings of suffering of all the beings in the hells ceased.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa'i sems can rnams dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'ang rgyun chad do //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas pa'i sems can rnams dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'ang rgyun chad do //
translated: The feelings of suffering of the beings in the animal realm and the world of the Lord of Death also ceased.

original: sems can thams cad kyang skad cig de la 'dod chags kyis gnod par ma gyur cing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang skad cig de la 'dod chags kyis gnod par ma gyur cing /
translated: At that moment, all beings were not harmed by desire,

original: zhe sdang gis ma yin /
analyzed: zhe sdang gis ma yin /
translated: not harmed by anger,

original: gti mug gis ma yin te /
analyzed: gti mug gis ma yin te /
translated: not harmed by ignorance,

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan gyis kyang gnod par ma gyur to; ;de'i tshe sems can thams cad kyang byams pa'i sems dang / pha ma lta bu'i 'du shes su gyur to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan gyis kyang gnod par ma gyur to; ;de'i tshe sems can thams cad kyang byams pa'i sems dang / pha ma lta bu'i 'du shes su gyur to //
translated: and not harmed by other afflictions. At that time, all beings had a loving mind and the perception of their parents.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par bskul ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi mthus de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od de las tshigs su bcad pa 'di byung ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par bskul ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi mthus de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od de las tshigs su bcad pa 'di byung ngo //
translated: In order to exhort the bodhisattvas, from the light of the Tathāgata there issued forth these verses by the power of the Buddha:

original: gang gis brtson 'grus stobs ni mtha' yas yangs pa brtan pa brtsams gyur te //
analyzed: gang gis brtson 'grus stobs ni mtha' yas yangs pa brtan pa brtsams gyur te //
translated: “Those who have undertaken the practice of boundless, vast, and firm diligence,

original: gang gis brtson 'grus chen po'i stobs kyis bskal pa dag las phyir phyogs spangs //
analyzed: gang gis brtson 'grus chen po'i stobs kyis bskal pa dag las phyir phyogs spangs //
translated: Those who, by the power of great diligence, have turned away from eons,

original: gang gi yon tan dag ni phyogs bcu rnams na mthu ldan @162b rab brjod pa //
analyzed: gang gi yon tan dag ni phyogs bcu rnams na mthu ldan @162b rab brjod pa //
translated: Whose qualities are proclaimed by the powerful ones in the ten directions,

original: sh'akya thub pa'i 'od yangs 'gro ba thams cad snang bar byed pa mdzes //
analyzed: sh'akya thub pa'i 'od yangs 'gro ba thams cad snang bar byed pa mdzes //
translated: The light of Śākyamuni, vast and beautiful, illuminates all beings.

original: gang chos rgya chen bla med mnyan slad de yi zhabs la phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: gang chos rgya chen bla med mnyan slad de yi zhabs la phyag 'tshal te //
translated: Those who, in order to hear the vast and unsurpassed Dharma, bow at his feet,

original: mkhas pa blo gros brtan pa dag ni bskal pa grangs med rtag tu nyan //
analyzed: mkhas pa blo gros brtan pa dag ni bskal pa grangs med rtag tu nyan //
translated: The wise ones with firm intelligence always listen for countless eons.

original: blo rgyas gang zhig rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa tshim skyed pa //
analyzed: blo rgyas gang zhig rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa tshim skyed pa //
translated: Those whose vast minds generate the satisfaction of the bodhisattva intention,

original: thub pa des ni gang phyir sems can bde bar bzhed pas 'od 'di phyung //
analyzed: thub pa des ni gang phyir sems can bde bar bzhed pas 'od 'di phyung //
translated: “The Sage has emitted this light because he wishes to bring happiness to beings.

original: mnga' bdag gang zhig brtson 'grus kyis ni bdud stobs mu stegs tshogs bcas pha ma mdzad nas //
analyzed: mnga' bdag gang zhig brtson 'grus kyis ni bdud stobs mu stegs tshogs bcas pha ma mdzad nas //
translated: The Lord, through his diligence, has defeated Māra and the non-Buddhists, and has become the father and mother of all.

original: padma byung ba bzhin du 'phags shing phyogs bcu dag tu lhun po ji bzhin mdzes //
analyzed: padma byung ba bzhin du 'phags shing phyogs bcu dag tu lhun po ji bzhin mdzes //
translated: He is as exalted as a lotus, and as beautiful in the ten directions as Mount Meru.

original: gang zhig nyi ma bzhin du sku yi 'od kyis 'gro ba ma lus snang mdzad pa //
analyzed: gang zhig nyi ma bzhin du sku yi 'od kyis 'gro ba ma lus snang mdzad pa //
translated: He illuminates all beings with the light of his body, as if it were the sun.

original: de yi chos kyi 'khor lo gzhag pa don chen gsan du rgyal ba gshegs su gsol //
analyzed: de yi chos kyi 'khor lo gzhag pa don chen gsan du rgyal ba gshegs su gsol //
translated: Please come, Victorious One, to listen to the Dharma wheel, which is of great meaning.

original: rab tu bskor bar ma gyur mtshungs pa med cing rgyal ba kun gyis bskor gyur pa //
analyzed: rab tu bskor bar ma gyur mtshungs pa med cing rgyal ba kun gyis bskor gyur pa //
translated: It has not yet been turned, and is unequaled, surrounded by all the Victorious Ones.

original: 'khor lo dam pa stobs bcu sems can thugs brtse phyir ni de ring bskor bar mdzad //
analyzed: 'khor lo dam pa stobs bcu sems can thugs brtse phyir ni de ring bskor bar mdzad //
translated: Today, out of compassion for beings, the one with the ten powers will turn the wheel of the sacred Dharma.

original: srog chags rnams kyis bsten par rnyed dka' legs pa rgya chen de ring 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: srog chags rnams kyis bsten par rnyed dka' legs pa rgya chen de ring 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Today, the good and vast will arise, which is difficult to obtain for living beings.”

original: gang dag dad pa dang ba che yangs don du gnyer ba de dag de ring ltos //
analyzed: gang dag dad pa dang ba che yangs don du gnyer ba de dag de ring ltos //
translated: Those who are seeking the great and vast faith, look today!

original: de nas 'od zer de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis go bar byas /
analyzed: de nas 'od zer de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis go bar byas /
translated: Then those light rays caused all the buddha-fields to understand with these verses:

original: byang chub sems dpa' @163a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' @163a *//
translated: All the bodhisattvas

original: thams cad yang dag par bskul /
analyzed: thams cad yang dag par bskul /
translated: were fully exhorted,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rab tu g-yo bar byas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rab tu g-yo bar byas /
translated: all the world-systems trembled,

original: sems can thams cad bde bar byas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bde bar byas /
translated: all sentient beings were made happy,

original: nyon mongs pa'i khams thams cad rnam par sbyangs /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i khams thams cad rnam par sbyangs /
translated: all the realms of afflictions were purified,

original: mun pa mun nag thams cad bsal /
analyzed: mun pa mun nag thams cad bsal /
translated: all the darkness was dispelled,🔽and all the abodes of Mara were darkened.

original: bdud kyi khyim thams cad mog mog por byas nas byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor dpag tu med pa dag dang / 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed du slar 'ongs te bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu'i gcug tu mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: bdud kyi khyim thams cad mog mog por byas nas byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor dpag tu med pa dag dang / 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed du slar 'ongs te bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu'i gcug tu mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: Then, having returned to the world-system called Saha with an immeasurable retinue of bodhisattvas, they disappeared into the crown of the Blessed One's head.

original: de nas shar phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa dri med rnam dag rin chen 'od byang chub kyi yan lag dang ldan pa'i chos rgyun mi chad pa'i 'od zer bkod pa'i rgyal po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams yon tan mtha' yas pa'i rin po che'i
analyzed: de nas shar phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa dri med rnam dag rin chen 'od byang chub kyi yan lag dang ldan pa'i chos rgyun mi chad pa'i 'od zer bkod pa'i rgyal po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams yon tan mtha' yas pa'i rin po che'i
translated: Then, in the east, in the buddha realm of the thus-gone Stainless Pure Jewel Light Endowed with the Branches of Awakening, the king of the array of uninterrupted light rays of Dharma, in the world system of Infinite Qualities of Jewels,

original: bsod nams bkod pas rgya che ba dang ldan pa na byang chub sems dpa' me tog dpal gyi snying po chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba zhes bya ba 'od des bskul ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung bcu'i bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor
analyzed: bsod nams bkod pas rgya che ba dang ldan pa na byang chub sems dpa' me tog dpal gyi snying po chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba zhes bya ba 'od des bskul ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung bcu'i bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor
translated: the bodhisattva Glorious Heart of Flowers, the master of all phenomena, was dwelling in a vast array of merit. As soon as he was roused by that light, he was surrounded by as many bodhisattvas as there are grains of sand in ten Ganges Rivers.

original: zhing mdun du bdar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir phyin te 'khor gyi khyams rin @163b po che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar🔽'dug nas des bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te lan khri bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir lha'i nor bu bee d'urya'i dra pa'i char rab tu phab ste bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag
analyzed: zhing mdun du bdar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir phyin te 'khor gyi khyams rin @163b po che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas des bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te lan khri bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir lha'i nor bu bee d'urya'i dra pa'i char rab tu phab ste bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag
translated: and they disappeared from that buddha realm and in an instant arrived in the Sahā world realm.🔽They sat in the Jetavana grove in the Ornament of the Multitudes of Qualities pavilion in the presence of the Bhagavān.

original: gis mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: gis mngon par bstod do //
translated: They bowed their heads to the Bhagavān’s feet, circumambulated him ten thousand times, and in order to make offerings to the Bhagavān they caused a rain of divine jewels and beryl to fall. They praised the Bhagavān with these verses:

original: bcom ldan rab tu mtshungs med yon tan pha rol phyin //
analyzed: bcom ldan rab tu mtshungs med yon tan pha rol phyin //
translated: “Bhagavān, you are unequaled, you have perfected good qualities,

original: khyed kyi yon tan bsngags phreng phyogs bcu kun na brjod //
analyzed: khyed kyi yon tan bsngags phreng phyogs bcu kun na brjod //
translated: Your garland of good qualities is praised in all the ten directions.

original: khyod kyi yon tan tshogs mchis zhing gang yon tan gter //
analyzed: khyod kyi yon tan tshogs mchis zhing gang yon tan gter //
translated: You are a treasure of good qualities, a field of good qualities.

original: der ni chos don gnyer ba bdag cag rab tu mchi //
analyzed: der ni chos don gnyer ba bdag cag rab tu mchi //
translated: We have come here, O Lord, to seek the Dharma.

original: chos dbyings mnyam nyid rnam rtog ma mchis ji bzhin du //
analyzed: chos dbyings mnyam nyid rnam rtog ma mchis ji bzhin du //
translated: Just as the realm of phenomena is sameness, free of conceptualization,

original: bcom ldan dri med 'od kyis mnyam pa nyid mkhyen kyang //
analyzed: bcom ldan dri med 'od kyis mnyam pa nyid mkhyen kyang //
translated: The Bhagavān Vimalaprabhā knows sameness,

original: shin tu bslab pa'i sgyu ma mkhan ltar chos kyi rgyal //
analyzed: shin tu bslab pa'i sgyu ma mkhan ltar chos kyi rgyal //
translated: And like a magician who is well trained, the Dharma King

original: sems can rnam par dgrol slad tha dad bstan pa mdzad //🔽de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas shar phyogs logs su gnas te rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan dag la 'khod do
analyzed: sems can rnam par dgrol slad tha dad bstan pa mdzad // de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas shar phyogs logs su gnas te rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan dag la 'khod do
translated: Teaches in various ways in order to liberate sentient beings.🔽Then those bodhisattvas, having praised the Bhagavān with immeasurable bodhisattva praises, remained to the east and sat upon seats created by their own miraculous power.

original: // de nas lho phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan mtha' yas rin chen spobs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams @164a *//
analyzed: // de nas lho phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan mtha' yas rin chen spobs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams @164a *//
translated: Then, to the south, from the buddha realm of the Tathāgata Anantaguna­ratnapratibhāna in the world system Ananta­raśmi­pratibhāna­megha­nirghoṣa, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Ananta­prabhāsa­śrī, together with bodhisattva mahāsattvas as numerous as the atoms in a buddha realm, having given rise to the miraculous power to travel through space,

original: sangs rgyas kyi spobs pa na byang chub sems dpa' rin chen srog shing zhes bya ba 'od des bskul ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung bcu'i bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor zhing mdun du bdar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas🔽mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir phyin te 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas des bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag bcal te lan
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spobs pa na byang chub sems dpa' rin chen srog shing zhes bya ba 'od des bskul ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung bcu'i bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor zhing mdun du bdar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir phyin te 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas des bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag bcal te lan
translated: The bodhisattva Jewel Life-Tree, who was inspired by that light, immediately went to the Buddha with a retinue of bodhisattvas as numerous as the grains of sand in ten Ganges Rivers.🔽They disappeared from that buddha realm and in an instant arrived in the Sahā world system, where they sat in the Jeta Grove in the Array of Precious Flowers.

original: khri bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan la mchod pa'i las byed cing gser gyi dra bas bcom ldan la mngon par bkab ste tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: khri bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan la mchod pa'i las byed cing gser gyi dra bas bcom ldan la mngon par bkab ste tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod do //
translated: They bowed their heads to the Bhagavān's feet, circumambulated him ten thousand times, and made offerings to the Bhagavān. They covered the Bhagavān with a golden net and praised the Bhagavān with these verses:

original: bcom ldan thugs rje'i sprin gyis 'jig rten rgyas bkang nas //
analyzed: bcom ldan thugs rje'i sprin gyis 'jig rten rgyas bkang nas //
translated: The Blessed One fills the world with the clouds of his compassion,🔽And sends forth the lightning of his light, proclaiming the sound of emptiness and selflessness,

original: 'od kyi glog phyung stong pa bdag med sgra bsgrags te; ;yan lag brgyad pa'i lam gyi chu yis zhi mdzad cing //
analyzed: 'od kyi glog phyung stong pa bdag med sgra bsgrags te; ;yan lag brgyad pa'i lam gyi chu yis zhi mdzad cing //
translated: And with the water of the eight-branched path, he brings peace,

original: dkar po'i stobs dbang nags tshal gel pa 'phel bar mdzad //
analyzed: dkar po'i stobs dbang nags tshal gel pa 'phel bar mdzad //
translated: And causes the forest of the powers of virtue to flourish.

original: bde gshegs shes rab 'od kyis gti mug mun bsal nas //
analyzed: bde gshegs shes rab 'od kyis gti mug mun bsal nas //
translated: The Sugata, with the light of wisdom, dispels the darkness of ignorance,

original: ring nas srid mtshor gnyid log sems can sad mdzad de //
analyzed: ring nas srid mtshor gnyid log sems can sad mdzad de //
translated: And awakens beings who have long slept in the ocean of existence,

original: lam yang bstan cing sred pa dag kyang skam par mdzad //
analyzed: lam yang bstan cing sred pa dag kyang skam par mdzad //
translated: Showing them the path and drying up their craving.

original: thar pa'i grong gnas @164b rnams kyi mig kyang rnam par sbyong //
analyzed: thar pa'i grong gnas @164b rnams kyi mig kyang rnam par sbyong //
translated: He also purifies the eyes of those who dwell in the city of liberation.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas lho phyogs logs su gnas te rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan dag la 'khod do
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas lho phyogs logs su gnas te rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan dag la 'khod do
translated: Then, after the bodhisattvas had praised the Blessed One with countless bodhisattva praises, they sat to the south, on seats created by their own miraculous power.

original: // de nas nub phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas snang ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams snang ba dang ldan pa na byang chub sems dpa' sgra bsgrags pa'i stobs kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba 'od des bskul ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa'
analyzed: // de nas nub phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas snang ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams snang ba dang ldan pa na byang chub sems dpa' sgra bsgrags pa'i stobs kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba 'od des bskul ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa'
translated: Then, in the west, in the buddha realm of the thus-gone Samantāvabhāsa, in the world system of Ābhāsvarā, the bodhisattva Mahāpraṇāda­bala­rāja, the moment the light touched him,

original: gangg'a'i klung bcu'i bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor zhing mdun du bdar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thad gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir phyin te 'khor gyi khyams rin po
analyzed: gangg'a'i klung bcu'i bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor zhing mdun du bdar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thad gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir phyin te 'khor gyi khyams rin po
translated: was surrounded and attended by as many bodhisattvas as there are grains of sand in ten Ganges Rivers. They disappeared from that buddha realm and, in a single instant, arrived in the Sahā world system, in the Jeta Grove of Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park.

original: che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas des bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la lan khri bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las byed cing nor bu mu tig gi do shal gyi phreng
analyzed: che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas des bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la lan khri bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las byed cing nor bu mu tig gi do shal gyi phreng
translated: Having sat down in the presence of the Blessed One, he bowed his head to the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated the Blessed One ten thousand times, and while performing acts of worship to the Blessed One, with a net of pearl necklaces

original: ba'i dra bas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bkab ste tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: ba'i dra bas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bkab ste tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod do //
translated: he covered the Blessed One and extolled the Blessed One with these verses:

original: khyod kyi sku yi 'phrin las @165a *//
analyzed: khyod kyi sku yi 'phrin las @165a *//
translated: “Your bodily activity

original: nam mkha'i khams 'dra zhing //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams 'dra zhing //
translated: is like the element of space,

original: smon lam dge bas dag pa bye ba phrag mang ldan //
analyzed: smon lam dge bas dag pa bye ba phrag mang ldan //
translated: endowed with many millions of pure virtuous aspirations.

original: dri med rnam par dag cing zag pa med pa des //
analyzed: dri med rnam par dag cing zag pa med pa des //
translated: With that stainless, pure, undefiled [body],

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas zhing rnams bsam gyis mi khyab gsal //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas zhing rnams bsam gyis mi khyab gsal //
translated: the inconceivable buddha fields in the ten directions are illuminated.

original: khyod kyi tshig ni rgyun chags gsal zhing mtshungs pa ste //
analyzed: khyod kyi tshig ni rgyun chags gsal zhing mtshungs pa ste //
translated: Your speech is continuous, clear, and equal,
