original: 'gro ba bsam dag bsam pa mnyam nyid yongs tshim bgyid //
analyzed: 'gro ba bsam dag bsam pa mnyam nyid yongs tshim bgyid //
translated: satisfying the equal aspirations of beings to be trained.

original: sems kyi rgyu dang rnam rtog gang yang mi mnga' yang //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyu dang rnam rtog gang yang mi mnga' yang //
translated: Although the Victorious One has no thoughts or concepts,

original: sems can bsam pa rnams la rgyal ba dag gi 'byung //
analyzed: sems can bsam pa rnams la rgyal ba dag gi 'byung //
translated: He appears to the minds of sentient beings.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas nub phyogs logs su gnas te rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan dag la 'khod do
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas nub phyogs logs su gnas te rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan dag la 'khod do
translated: Then, after the bodhisattvas had praised the Blessed One with countless bodhisattva praises, they sat to the west, on seats created by their own miraculous power.

original: // de nas byang phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan mtha' yas rin chen spobs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che thams cad kyis spras pa na byang chub sems dpa' blo mchog rgya mtsho zhes bya ba 'od des bskul ma thag tu
analyzed: // de nas byang phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan mtha' yas rin chen spobs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che thams cad kyis spras pa na byang chub sems dpa' blo mchog rgya mtsho zhes bya ba 'od des bskul ma thag tu
translated: Then, in the north, in the buddha realm of the thus-gone Jewel of Infinite Qualities, in the world of Adorned with All Jewels, the bodhisattva Supreme Ocean of Mind, as soon as he was roused by that light,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung bcu'i bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thang gcig yud @165b tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams ma mjed 'dir phyin te
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung bcu'i bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thang gcig yud @165b tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams ma mjed 'dir phyin te
translated: He was surrounded and attended by bodhisattvas as numerous as the grains of sand in ten Ganges Rivers. They disappeared from that buddha realm and in an instant arrived in the Sahā world system.

original: 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas des bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la lan khri bskor bar byas nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las byed cing nor bu'i do shal
analyzed: 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas des bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la lan khri bskor bar byas nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las byed cing nor bu'i do shal
translated: They sat in the Jeta Grove in the pavilion of the Dharma. He bowed his head to the Bhagavān’s feet, circumambulated the Bhagavān ten thousand times, and, while making offerings to the Bhagavān, with a jeweled necklace

original: dang / rin po che'i dra bas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bkab ste tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: dang / rin po che'i dra bas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bkab ste tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod do //
translated: and a net of jewels, he praised the Bhagavān with these verses:

original: dzambu'i chu gser bco ma lta bur ser ba'i sku //
analyzed: dzambu'i chu gser bco ma lta bur ser ba'i sku //
translated: “Your body is the color of refined gold from the Jambū River,

original: kun nas spyan mnga' phyogs bcu dag tu rnam par mdzes //
analyzed: kun nas spyan mnga' phyogs bcu dag tu rnam par mdzes //
translated: You are the all-seeing one, beautiful in all directions.

original: mtshungs med sku la sems can gang dag nges rtog pa //
analyzed: mtshungs med sku la sems can gang dag nges rtog pa //
translated: Those sentient beings who contemplate your incomparable body

original: de dag skyon med bde zhing dga' ba thob par 'gyur //🔽gang gis lhun po brtsegs pa lta bu'i khrun cam du //
analyzed: de dag skyon med bde zhing dga' ba thob par 'gyur // gang gis lhun po brtsegs pa lta bu'i khrun cam du //
translated: Will attain faultless bliss and joy.

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa mtshungs med rgyal ba bltas kyang ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa mtshungs med rgyal ba bltas kyang ni //
translated: Even if you were to look at the Victorious One, the knower of the world,🔽Who is as tall as a stacked-up mountain,

original: de yi rdzu 'phrul kun gyi stobs dang brtson 'grus kyi //
analyzed: de yi rdzu 'phrul kun gyi stobs dang brtson 'grus kyi //
translated: For as long as the power of his miracles and diligence

original: rnam par sprul pas rgyal ba'i spyi gtsug mthong mi nus //
analyzed: rnam par sprul pas rgyal ba'i spyi gtsug mthong mi nus //
translated: Last, you will not see the crown of the Victorious One’s head.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas byang phyogs logs su gnas te rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan dag la 'khod do
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas byang phyogs logs su gnas te rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan dag la 'khod do
translated: Then, after the bodhisattvas had praised the Blessed One with countless bodhisattva praises, they sat to the north, on seats created by their own miraculous power.

original: // de nas shar dang @166a *//
analyzed: // de nas shar dang @166a *//
translated: Then, from the east,

original: lho'i mtshams phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan thams cad bcom pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams mya ngan med pa na byang chub sems dpa'i kun nas snang ba zhes bya ba 'od des bskul ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung bcu'i
analyzed: lho'i mtshams phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan thams cad bcom pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams mya ngan med pa na byang chub sems dpa'i kun nas snang ba zhes bya ba 'od des bskul ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung bcu'i
translated: In the southern direction, the light encouraged the bodhisattva called Universal Illumination, who resided in the buddha realm of the thus-gone one called Destroyer of All Suffering in the world system called Free of Suffering.🔽

original: bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor zhing mdun du bdar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir phyin te 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par
analyzed: bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor zhing mdun du bdar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir phyin te 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par
translated: In the south, in the buddha realm of the thus-gone one who has conquered all suffering, the world system called Free of Suffering, the bodhisattva called All-Illuminating, upon being urged by that light, together with a retinue of bodhisattvas as numerous as the grains of sand in ten million Ganges Rivers, disappeared from that buddha realm and in an instant arrived in the Sahā world system, in the Jeta Grove in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas des bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la lan khri bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las byed cing rin po che'i dra bas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bkab
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas des bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la lan khri bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las byed cing rin po che'i dra bas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bkab
translated: He bowed his head to the Bhagavat’s feet, circumambulated the Bhagavat ten thousand times, and while making offerings to the Bhagavat, he covered the Bhagavat with a net of jewels.

original: ste tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: ste tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod do //
translated: He praised the Bhagavat with these verses:

original: spu yi mtha' dpung ma mchis pa yi zhing 'dzin kyang //
analyzed: spu yi mtha' dpung ma mchis pa yi zhing 'dzin kyang //
translated: “You hold a buddhafield that is without rival in splendor,

original: sems can rnams la mi gnod zhing la mi gnod pas //
analyzed: sems can rnams la mi gnod zhing la mi gnod pas //
translated: Without harming sentient beings or the earth,

original: mig med rnams kyis rgyal ba'i spyod yul 'tshal bar dka'//
analyzed: mig med rnams kyis rgyal ba'i spyod yul 'tshal bar dka'//
translated: The domain of the Victor is difficult for those without eyes to know.

original: sangs rgyas sras ni rgyal ba'i byin gyis yang dag 'tshal //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras ni rgyal ba'i byin gyis yang dag 'tshal //
translated: The Victor’s sons know it through the Victor’s blessing.🔽“You display many buddhafields in one buddhafield,

original: zhing gcig phyogs la zhing mang rab 'byams ston mdzad @166b de; ;kun tu bstan kyang rnam par 'phel dang 'grib ma mchis //
analyzed: zhing gcig phyogs la zhing mang rab 'byams ston mdzad @166b de; ;kun tu bstan kyang rnam par 'phel dang 'grib ma mchis //
translated: Without increasing or decreasing the display.

original: bsam pa chen po dag ldan ci 'drar gyur de la //
analyzed: bsam pa chen po dag ldan ci 'drar gyur de la //
translated: To those who have the great aspiration,

original: dpag med rdzu 'phrul rnam par sprul pas de ston to //🔽de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas shar dang lho'i phyogs mtshams logs su gnas te rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan dag
analyzed: dpag med rdzu 'phrul rnam par sprul pas de ston to // de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas shar dang lho'i phyogs mtshams logs su gnas te rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan dag
translated: He manifests them through his immeasurable magical power.🔽Then, after the bodhisattvas had praised the Lord with countless bodhisattva praises, they sat down to one side in the southeast,

original: la 'khod do //
analyzed: la 'khod do //
translated: on seats that they themselves had created through their own magical power.

original: de nas lho dang nub kyi mtshams phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa thugs rje chen pos sems can thams cad la gzigs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams mig bzang po na byang chub sems dpa' snying rje chen po sems pa zhes bya ba 'od des
analyzed: de nas lho dang nub kyi mtshams phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa thugs rje chen pos sems can thams cad la gzigs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams mig bzang po na byang chub sems dpa' snying rje chen po sems pa zhes bya ba 'od des
translated: Then, in the southwest, from the buddhafield of the Tathāgata Great Compassionate Regard for All Beings, in the world system Good Eye, the bodhisattva Great Compassionate One,

original: bskul ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung bcu'i bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor zhing mdun du bdar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed🔽'dir phyin te 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas des bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la lan khri bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan @167a *//
analyzed: bskul ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung bcu'i bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor zhing mdun du bdar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir phyin te 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas des bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la lan khri bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan @167a *//
translated: As soon as he was requested, the bodhisattva surrounded and escorted by as many bodhisattvas as there are grains of sand in ten Ganges Rivers disappeared from that buddha realm and in an instant arrived in the Sahā world system.

original: 'das la mchod pa'i las byed cing na bza'i dra bas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bkab ste tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: 'das la mchod pa'i las byed cing na bza'i dra bas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bkab ste tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod do //
translated: He went to the Jeta Grove, where he bowed his head to the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated the Blessed One ten thousand times, and made offerings to the Blessed One. He then covered the Blessed One with a net of garments and praised the Blessed One with these verses:

original: sems can dam pa g-yag rnga thogs pa ji bzhin du //
analyzed: sems can dam pa g-yag rnga thogs pa ji bzhin du //
translated: “Supreme being, like a deer with antlers,

original: tshul khrims dri med nor bu rin chen 'dra ba bsrungs //
analyzed: tshul khrims dri med nor bu rin chen 'dra ba bsrungs //
translated: You have guarded the precious jewel of stainless discipline.

original: tshul khrims med gzigs mgon po shin tu thugs rje zhing //
analyzed: tshul khrims med gzigs mgon po shin tu thugs rje zhing //
translated: Protector, you see the absence of discipline, and you have great compassion.

original: bdag la bstod pa mi mdzad gzhan la smod mi mdzad //
analyzed: bdag la bstod pa mi mdzad gzhan la smod mi mdzad //
translated: You do not praise yourself, nor do you disparage others.🔽You are as stable as Mount Meru, and your guru is vast.

original: lhun po ji bzhin khyod brtan bla ma rgya chen bste; ;chu gter zab mo bzhin du shin tu gting dpag dka'//
analyzed: lhun po ji bzhin khyod brtan bla ma rgya chen bste; ;chu gter zab mo bzhin du shin tu gting dpag dka'//
translated: You are as difficult to fathom as the deep ocean.

original: srid pa thog mar bcings pa kun nas grol ba ste //
analyzed: srid pa thog mar bcings pa kun nas grol ba ste //
translated: You are bound by existence from the beginning, and you are completely liberated.

original: sems can khrag khrig nyes pa chen pos bcings las grol //
analyzed: sems can khrag khrig nyes pa chen pos bcings las grol //
translated: You liberate many millions of sentient beings from the great bondage of faults.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas lho dang / nub kyi mtshams phyogs logs su gnas te rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan dag la 'khod do //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas lho dang / nub kyi mtshams phyogs logs su gnas te rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan dag la 'khod do //
translated: Then, after the bodhisattvas had praised the Bhagavat with countless bodhisattva praises, they sat to one side in the southwest on seats created by their own miraculous power.

original: de nas nub dang byang gi mtshams phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa 'od bkod pa'i rgyal po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams mun pa dang bral ba na byang chub sems @167b dpa' 'od zer dra ba can zhes bya ba 'od des bskul ma thag tu
analyzed: de nas nub dang byang gi mtshams phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa 'od bkod pa'i rgyal po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams mun pa dang bral ba na byang chub sems @167b dpa' 'od zer dra ba can zhes bya ba 'od des bskul ma thag tu
translated: Then, in the northwest, in the buddha realm of the thus-gone King of Arrayed Light, in the world system Free of Darkness, the bodhisattva Net of Light was sitting in the middle of a lotus garden.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung bcu'i bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir phyin te 'khor
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung bcu'i bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor cing mdun du bdar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir phyin te 'khor
translated: As soon as he was roused by that light, he was surrounded and escorted by as many bodhisattvas as there are grains of sand in ten Ganges Rivers. They disappeared from that buddha realm and in an instant arrived in this Sahā world system.

original: gyi khyams rin po che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas des bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la lan khri bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las byed cing rgyan gyi dra bas bcom
analyzed: gyi khyams rin po che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas des bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la lan khri bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las byed cing rgyan gyi dra bas bcom
translated: He bowed his head to the Bhagavat’s feet, circumambulated the Bhagavat ten thousand times, and while making offerings to the Bhagavat, he covered the Bhagavat with a net of ornaments.

original: ldan 'das la mngon par bkab ste tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: ldan 'das la mngon par bkab ste tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod do //
translated: He praised the Bhagavat with these verses:

original: srid pa'i rang bzhin sgyu ma'i rang bzhin rtogs mdzad nas //
analyzed: srid pa'i rang bzhin sgyu ma'i rang bzhin rtogs mdzad nas //
translated: “Having realized the nature of existence to be illusory,

original: byed pa sgyu ma lta bu dngos po med par ston //
analyzed: byed pa sgyu ma lta bu dngos po med par ston //
translated: You teach that illusory activity is unreal.

original: sgyu ma lta bu sems can khams ni 'dul mdzad kyang //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu sems can khams ni 'dul mdzad kyang //
translated: Although you guide the realm of beings who are like illusions,

original: 'di na sems can rang bzhin ma mchis khams ma mchis //
analyzed: 'di na sems can rang bzhin ma mchis khams ma mchis //
translated: Here, beings have no nature and no realm.

original: dper na mi zhig gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam na //
analyzed: dper na mi zhig gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam na //
translated: For example, a person who has fallen asleep in a dream

original: gzugs mthong yang dag 'du shes de bzhin mthong ma lags //
analyzed: gzugs mthong yang dag 'du shes de bzhin mthong ma lags //
translated: Sees forms but does not see the perception of reality.

original: 'dus byas dngos po ma mchis rmi lam 'dra bar gsung //
analyzed: 'dus byas dngos po ma mchis rmi lam 'dra bar gsung //
translated: You have said that compounded things are unreal, like a dream.

original: chos rnams snang yang 'di na chos la chags ma mchis //🔽de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa @168a *//
analyzed: chos rnams snang yang 'di na chos la chags ma mchis // de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa @168a *//
translated: Although phenomena appear, there is no attachment to phenomena here.

original: dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas nub dang / byang gi mtshams phyogs logs su gnas te rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan dag la 'khod do //
analyzed: dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas nub dang / byang gi mtshams phyogs logs su gnas te rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan dag la 'khod do //
translated: Then those bodhisattvas, having praised the Blessed One with immeasurable bodhisattva praises, remained in the northwest direction, and sat on their own seats emanated by their own miraculous power.

original: de nas byang dang / shar gyi mtshams phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa nam mkha'i dkyil dri ma med pa rnam par sems pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dag pa dri ma med par rab tu gnas pa na byang chub sems dpa' blo mtha' yas dri med ces
analyzed: de nas byang dang / shar gyi mtshams phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa nam mkha'i dkyil dri ma med pa rnam par sems pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su dag pa dri ma med par rab tu gnas pa na byang chub sems dpa' blo mtha' yas dri med ces
translated: Then, in the northeast direction, in the world system called Pure Stainless Abode, in the buddha realm of the thus-gone Stainless Center of the Sky, the bodhisattva Infinite Stainless Mind,

original: bya ba 'od des bskul ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung bcu'i bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor zhing mdun du bdar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten
analyzed: bya ba 'od des bskul ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung bcu'i bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor zhing mdun du bdar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten
translated: As soon as he was urged by that light, the bodhisattva surrounded by a retinue of as many bodhisattvas as there are grains of sand in ten Ganges Rivers, disappeared from that buddha realm and in an instant arrived in the Sahā world system.

original: gyi khams mi mjed 'dir phyin te 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas de bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la lan khri bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i
analyzed: gyi khams mi mjed 'dir phyin te 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas de bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la lan khri bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i
translated: He sat in the Jeta Grove in the Array of Precious Trees pavilion in the presence of the Blessed One. He bowed his head to the Blessed One’s feet, circumambulated the Blessed One ten thousand times, and while making offerings to the Blessed One,

original: las byed cing rtag tu sgra 'byung ba'i sil snyan gyi dra bas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bkab ste tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: las byed cing rtag tu sgra 'byung ba'i sil snyan gyi dra bas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bkab ste tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod do //
translated: he covered the Blessed One with a net of musical instruments that always produced sounds. He then praised the Blessed One with these verses:

original: @168b zab mo'i chos la mkhas shing rab tu zhi la mos //
analyzed: @168b zab mo'i chos la mkhas shing rab tu zhi la mos //
translated: “You are skilled in the profound Dharma and have peaceful aspirations.

original: khyod kyis chos kun stong zhing mtshan ma med par mkhyen //
analyzed: khyod kyis chos kun stong zhing mtshan ma med par mkhyen //
translated: You know that all phenomena are empty and without characteristics.

original: khyod kyi thugs kyi dgongs pa 'jig rten kun ma 'tshal //
analyzed: khyod kyi thugs kyi dgongs pa 'jig rten kun ma 'tshal //
translated: Your mind’s intention is not understood by the entire world.

original: mtha' yas blo mnga' sems kyi bsam pa cho ga mkhyen //
analyzed: mtha' yas blo mnga' sems kyi bsam pa cho ga mkhyen //
translated: You, who have infinite intelligence, know the mental thoughts and rituals.

original: sems can gcig gi spyod bzhin sems can kun gyi spyod //
analyzed: sems can gcig gi spyod bzhin sems can kun gyi spyod //
translated: You know the conduct of all sentient beings through the conduct of a single sentient being.

original: gang dag dus gsum ldan pa de dag khyod kyis mkhyen //
analyzed: gang dag dus gsum ldan pa de dag khyod kyis mkhyen //
translated: You know those who possess the three times.

original: sems can 'du shes mi 'jug sems kyi 'du shes min //
analyzed: sems can 'du shes mi 'jug sems kyi 'du shes min //
translated: You do not engage in the perception of sentient beings, nor in the perception of mind.

original: 'du shes yongs shes mkhas shing mnyam pa nyid dang ldan //
analyzed: 'du shes yongs shes mkhas shing mnyam pa nyid dang ldan //
translated: You are skilled in the complete knowledge of perception and possess equality.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas byang dang / shar gyi phyogs mtshams logs su gnas te rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan dag la 'khod do //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas byang dang / shar gyi phyogs mtshams logs su gnas te rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan dag la 'khod do //
translated: Then, after the bodhisattvas had praised the Blessed One with immeasurable bodhisattva praises, they took their places to the northeast, on seats created by their own miraculous power.

original: de nas 'og gi phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa rin chen autpa la dmar po'i dpal gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par snang byed du snang ba na byang chub sems dpa' spobs pa'i rgyan bkod pa zhes bya ba 'od des bskul ma thag
analyzed: de nas 'og gi phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa rin chen autpa la dmar po'i dpal gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par snang byed du snang ba na byang chub sems dpa' spobs pa'i rgyan bkod pa zhes bya ba 'od des bskul ma thag
translated: Then, in the direction below, in the world system called Illuminating Appearance, in the buddha realm of the thus-gone Splendor of the Glory of the Red Lotus Jewel, the bodhisattva Array of Eloquence was prompted by that light.

original: tu byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung bcu'i bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor zhing mdun dub dar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thang gcig yud @168a  *//
analyzed: tu byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung bcu'i bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor zhing mdun dub dar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thang gcig yud @168a  *//
translated: As soon as he was prompted, he was surrounded and attended by as many bodhisattvas as there are grains of sand in ten Ganges Rivers. They disappeared from that buddha realm and in an instant arrived in the world system called Endurance.

original: de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa de mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa de mthong ngo //
translated: They saw the bodhisattva sitting at the seat of awakening.

original: mthong nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' de la ba de logs su me tog dag gtor to //
analyzed: mthong nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' de la ba de logs su me tog dag gtor to //
translated: Having seen him, they scattered flowers toward the bodhisattva.

original: gtor ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi mthus 'ongs nas byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus la bab bo //
analyzed: gtor ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi mthus 'ongs nas byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus la bab bo //
translated: By the power of the Buddha, the flowers arrived and fell on the bodhisattva’s body.

original: me tog de dag gis 'jig rten gyi khams shin tu sprul pa der mi bdun gyi 'phang tsam gyi me tog bkram pa gcig pu gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: me tog de dag gis 'jig rten gyi khams shin tu sprul pa der mi bdun gyi 'phang tsam gyi me tog bkram pa gcig pu gnas par gyur to //
translated: Those flowers covered the entire world of emanations, rising to a height of seven human beings.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de na dbang che ba dbang che bar grags pa'i lha gang dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' gang dag 'khod pa de dag gis 'od de mthong nas gang 'di lta bu rnam par dag pa'i 'od byung ba las na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de na dbang che ba dbang che bar grags pa'i lha gang dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' gang dag 'khod pa de dag gis 'od de mthong nas gang 'di lta bu rnam par dag pa'i 'od byung ba las na /
translated: The gods who had great power and influence in that world, and the bodhisattvas who were present, saw that light and exclaimed:

original: kye ma 'di ni /
analyzed: kye ma 'di ni /
translated: Alas!🔽🔽

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer snang ba mtha' yas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer snang ba mtha' yas su 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the light of the thus-gone Amitābha!”

original: zhes ched du brjod pa ched du brjod de /
analyzed: zhes ched du brjod pa ched du brjod de /
translated: They exclaimed this in unison.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de'i mtshan 'od zer snang ba mtha' yas /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de'i mtshan 'od zer snang ba mtha' yas /
translated: Thus, the name of that thus-gone one became Amitābha.

original: 'od zer snang ba mtha' yas zhes bya bar gyur to; ;ci'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams de shin tu sprul pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'od zer snang ba mtha' yas zhes bya bar gyur to; ;ci'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams de shin tu sprul pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why was that world called Emanated?

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de na 'khod pa'i mi de dag gi longs spyod dang / yongs su spyad pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de na 'khod pa'i mi de dag gi longs spyod dang / yongs su spyad pa ni /
translated: The enjoyments and possessions of the people in that world system

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i bu rnams kyi longs spyod dang / yongs su spyad pa ci 'dra ba de 'dra bar gyur bas de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams de shin tu sprul pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i bu rnams kyi longs spyod dang / yongs su spyad pa ci 'dra ba de 'dra bar gyur bas de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams de shin tu sprul pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are like those of the gods in the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations. Therefore, that world system is called Very Emanated.

original: ci'i phyir bskal @168b  pa de skar mdog ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bskal @168b  pa de skar mdog ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why is that eon called Star-like?

original: blo gros rgya mtsho /
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho /
translated: Sāgaramati,

original: bskal pa khri 'das nas bskal pa de la sangs rgyas byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: bskal pa khri 'das nas bskal pa de la sangs rgyas byung bar gyur te /
translated: after ten thousand eons had passed, a buddha appeared in that eon.

original: bde bzhin gshegs pa skar ma la dga' ba zhes bya ba byung ngo //
analyzed: bde bzhin gshegs pa skar ma la dga' ba zhes bya ba byung ngo //
translated: The Tathāgata called Joyful Star appeared.

original: gang gi 'og tu bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa 'od zer snang ba mtha' yas des byang chub thob pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de'i mtshan gyis bskal pa de skar mdog ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi 'og tu bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa 'od zer snang ba mtha' yas des byang chub thob pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de'i mtshan gyis bskal pa de skar mdog ces bya'o //
translated: After him, the Blessed Tathāgata Infinite Light attained awakening. The name of that tathāgata is the reason that eon is called Star-like.

original: blo gros rgya mtsho /
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho /
translated: Sāgaramati,

original: bskal pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa bye ba phrag bcu bzhi byung ngo //
analyzed: bskal pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa bye ba phrag bcu bzhi byung ngo //
translated: In that eon, fourteen billion tathāgatas appeared.

original: yangs shing tha gru chen bar gyur te /
analyzed: yangs shing tha gru chen bar gyur te /

original: ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las byed cing nor bu rin po che'i gling gi phreng gi dra bas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bkab ste tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod do //
