translated: He made offerings to the Lord and, covering the Lord with a net of jewels and gems, he praised the Lord with these verses:

original: gal te khrag khrig zhing na ji snyed rdul mchis pa //
analyzed: gal te khrag khrig zhing na ji snyed rdul mchis pa //
translated: “If there were as many bodhisattvas as there are atoms in a billion buddha-fields,

original: de snyed bde gshegs sras po rgyal ba'i drung lhags te //
analyzed: de snyed bde gshegs sras po rgyal ba'i drung lhags te //
translated: and they were to come into the presence of the Victor,

original: bskal pa bye ba stong mang zhu ba zhus pa dag /
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba stong mang zhu ba zhus pa dag /
translated: and if they were to ask questions for many quintillions of eons,

original: de dag thams cad tshig gcig dus kyis go bar mdzad //
analyzed: de dag thams cad tshig gcig dus kyis go bar mdzad //
translated: they would all understand the meaning of a single word.

original: blo la mkhas par ba rdzogs shes rab shin tu rdzogs //
analyzed: blo la mkhas par ba rdzogs shes rab shin tu rdzogs //
translated: “You are skilled in wisdom, with perfect wisdom,

original: gzungs dang ting 'dzin rab rdzogs bsod nams mtha' yas te //
analyzed: gzungs dang ting 'dzin rab rdzogs bsod nams mtha' yas te //
translated: with perfect retention and samādhi, and with infinite merit.

original: bskal pa mang po mtha' yas bsngags pa rab brjod kyang //
analyzed: bskal pa mang po mtha' yas bsngags pa rab brjod kyang //
translated: Even if you were to praise you for infinite eons,

original: skra rtses rgya mtsho ji bzhin zad par mi nus so //
analyzed: skra rtses rgya mtsho ji bzhin zad par mi nus so //
translated: it would be like the tip of a hair compared to the ocean.🔽“

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas 'og gi phyogs logs su gnas te rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan @169b dag la
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas 'og gi phyogs logs su gnas te rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan @169b dag la
translated: Then, after those bodhisattvas had praised the Bhagavat with immeasurable bodhisattva praises, they sat to the west on their own seats created by their own miraculous power.

original: 'khod do // de nas steng gi phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa sgra bsgrags mchog gi rgyal po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams rgyan gyis brgyan pa na byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad rnam par 'phrul ba'i rgyal po zhes bya ba 'od des bskul ma thag tu
analyzed: 'khod do // de nas steng gi phyogs na de bzhin gshegs pa sgra bsgrags mchog gi rgyal po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams rgyan gyis brgyan pa na byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad rnam par 'phrul ba'i rgyal po zhes bya ba 'od des bskul ma thag tu
translated: Then, in the world system called Adorned with Ornaments, in the western direction, there was the thus-gone King of Supremely Proclaimed Sounds. The light rays awakened the bodhisattva called King of the Miraculous Display of All Dharmas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung bcu'i bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor zhing mdun du bdar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir phyin te 'khor🔽gyi khyams rin po che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas des bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la lan khri bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las byed cing rgyan thams cad bkod pa
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gangg'a'i klung bcu'i bye ma snyed kyis yongs su bskor zhing mdun du bdar te lhan cig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing de nas mi snang bar gyur nas skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir phyin te 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'dug nas des bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das la lan khri bskor ba byas nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa'i las byed cing rgyan thams cad bkod pa
translated: He was surrounded and attended by bodhisattvas as numerous as the grains of sand in ten Ganges Rivers. They disappeared from that buddha realm and in an instant arrived in the Sahā world system.🔽They sat in the Jeta Grove in the pavilion of the precious stūpa in the presence of the Blessed One. They bowed their heads to the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated the Blessed One ten thousand times, and made offerings to the Blessed One. They covered the Blessed One with a net of precious bells and a display of all ornaments

original: dang / rin po che'i dril bu g-yer kha'i dra bas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bkab ste tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: dang / rin po che'i dril bu g-yer kha'i dra bas bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bkab ste tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod do //
translated: and praised the Blessed One with these verses:

original: bde gshegs sku yi 'phrin las mtha' dang dbus ma mchis //
analyzed: bde gshegs sku yi 'phrin las mtha' dang dbus ma mchis //
translated: “The activity of the Sugata’s body has no end or middle.

original: bla med rnams kyi gsung thugs spyod yul mtha' yas pa //
analyzed: bla med rnams kyi gsung thugs spyod yul mtha' yas pa //
translated: The speech, mind, and domain of activity of the unsurpassed ones are limitless.

original: de ni sangs rgyas mkhyen gyi sems can gzhan gyis min //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas mkhyen gyi sems can gzhan gyis min //
translated: This is the knowledge of the buddhas, not of other sentient beings.

original: dper na nam mkha'i mtha' ma skye bos mi rnyed @170a *//
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i mtha' ma skye bos mi rnyed @170a *//
translated: Just as the end of space cannot be found by a person,

original: bzhin // mtshungs med spyod pa mtha' dbus med pa ji bzhin du //
analyzed: bzhin // mtshungs med spyod pa mtha' dbus med pa ji bzhin du //
translated: Likewise, the incomparable conduct has no center or edge.

original: byang chub 'khor lo de bzhin 'on te mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: byang chub 'khor lo de bzhin 'on te mya ngan 'das //
translated: The wheel of enlightenment is like this, and so is nirvana.

original: sa bon ji bzhin de ltar 'bras bu 'byung ba ltar //
analyzed: sa bon ji bzhin de ltar 'bras bu 'byung ba ltar //
translated: Just as a seed gives rise to a fruit in the same way,

original: de bzhin phyogs bcur rgyal ba'i gnas kyang tshad ma mchis //
analyzed: de bzhin phyogs bcur rgyal ba'i gnas kyang tshad ma mchis //
translated: In the same way, the abodes of the victors in the ten directions are immeasurable.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas steng gi bar snang la dong ste rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan dag la 'khod
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa tshad med pa dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas steng gi bar snang la dong ste rang gi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis sprul pa'i rang rang gi stan dag la 'khod
translated: Then, after those bodhisattvas had praised the Blessed One with immeasurable bodhisattva praises, they rose up into the sky and sat on their own seats created by their own miraculous power.

original: do; ;de ltar phyogs bcu dag nas byang chub sems dpa' bcu 'dus pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' tshad med pa dag 'od des bskul ma thag tu skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir phyin te 'khor gyi khyams
analyzed: do; ;de ltar phyogs bcu dag nas byang chub sems dpa' bcu 'dus pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' tshad med pa dag 'od des bskul ma thag tu skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir phyin te 'khor gyi khyams
translated: In this way, the bodhisattvas who had gathered from the ten directions, and so forth, were countless. As soon as they were roused by that light, in that very instant, in that very moment, they arrived in the Sahā world system and took their seats in the pavilion

original: rin po che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'khod do //
analyzed: rin po che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'khod do //
translated: in the Jeta Grove.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das dran pa dang ldan zhing mkhyen bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs te gsung bsal ba'i sgra mdzad nas gsung bsal ba'i sgra des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dbyangs kyis go bar gyur te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das dran pa dang ldan zhing mkhyen bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs te gsung bsal ba'i sgra mdzad nas gsung bsal ba'i sgra des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dbyangs kyis go bar gyur te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, with mindfulness and awareness, rose from that samādhi and made a sound with his voice. That sound with his voice was heard throughout the trichiliocosm.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na gang dag dad pa dang ldan zhing snod du gyur @170b pa'i dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa de dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsung bsal ba'i sgra de thos nas lus dang /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na gang dag dad pa dang ldan zhing snod du gyur @170b pa'i dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa de dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsung bsal ba'i sgra de thos nas lus dang /
translated: All the bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, upāsikās, humans, and non-humans who were vessels of faith in this world realm of a billion worlds heard the Blessed One’s clear voice and their bodies and minds were satisfied.

original: sems tshim par gyur te sangs rgyas kyi mthus ji ltar byung ba'i them skas dag nas skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par phyin te; de dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas phyogs gcig🔽tu ji ltar mthun pa'i stan dag la 'khod do //
analyzed: sems tshim par gyur te sangs rgyas kyi mthus ji ltar byung ba'i them skas dag nas skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par phyin te; de dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas phyogs gcig🔽tu ji ltar mthun pa'i stan dag la 'khod do //
translated: By the power of the Buddha, they instantly ascended the stairs that had appeared and arrived at the Jeta Grove, where they bowed their heads at the Blessed One’s feet and sat to one side.

original: gsung bsal ba'i sgra de nyid kyis tshangs pa'i lha rnams dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / 'od chen dang / 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal dang /
analyzed: gsung bsal ba'i sgra de nyid kyis tshangs pa'i lha rnams dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / 'od chen dang / 'od chung dang / tshad med 'od dang / 'od gsal dang /
translated: The sound of the Buddha’s voice also reached the gods of the Brahmā realm, including the gods of Brahmā’s group, Brahmā’s ministers, Brahmā’s attendants, the great Brahmās, the gods of limited radiance, the gods of immeasurable radiance, the shining gods,

original: dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas dang / sprin med dang / bsod nams skyes dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / gya nom snang dang /🔽shin tu mthong ba dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang bskul nas skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par phyin te /
analyzed: dge chung dang / tshad med dge dang / dge rgyas dang / sprin med dang / bsod nams skyes dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / gya nom snang dang / shin tu mthong ba dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang bskul nas skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par phyin te /
translated: the gods of limited splendor, the gods of immeasurable splendor, the luminous gods, the gods of the sphere of no thought, the gods of the sphere of no discrimination, the gods of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, the gods of the highest heaven, and the gods of the summit of existence.

original: de dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas stan rab tu brtan pa dag la 'khod do //
analyzed: de dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag btsal nas stan rab tu brtan pa dag la 'khod do //
translated: They all came to the Jeta Grove in an instant, a moment, a second, and bowed their heads to the feet of the Blessed One. They then sat down on stable seats.

original: de nas @171a *//
analyzed: de nas @171a *//
translated: Then,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor 'dus pa chen po de mkhyen nas smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu nas byang chub sems dpa'i stobs nye bar ston pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer phyung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor 'dus pa chen po de mkhyen nas smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu nas byang chub sems dpa'i stobs nye bar ston pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer phyung ste /
translated: The Blessed One, knowing the great gathering of the retinue, emitted from the hair between his eyebrows a light ray called the Bodhisattva's Power Display.

original: des thams cad dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs la lan bdun bskor ba byas nas byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs de nyid kyi spyi bor mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: des thams cad dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs la lan bdun bskor ba byas nas byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs de nyid kyi spyi bor mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: It circumambulated the entire assembly of bodhisattvas seven times and then disappeared above the crown of that assembly of bodhisattvas.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' me tog dpal gyi snying po chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba 'od nges reg ma thag tu de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rgyan thams cad bkod pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs so
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' me tog dpal gyi snying po chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba 'od nges reg ma thag tu de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rgyan thams cad bkod pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs so
translated: Then, as soon as the bodhisattva Glorious Heart of Flowers, the One Who Controls All Dharmas, was touched by the light, at that time through the power of the Buddha he entered the bodhisattva absorption called Array of All Ornaments.

original: // byang chub sems dpa' me tog dpal gyi snying pos chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rgyan thams cad bkod pa la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu de nas de'i tshe 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod pa'i dbus nas bcom
analyzed: // byang chub sems dpa' me tog dpal gyi snying pos chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rgyan thams cad bkod pa la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu de nas de'i tshe 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod pa'i dbus nas bcom
translated: The bodhisattva Puṣyaśrīgarbha, as soon as he had entered the bodhisattva samādhi called the array of all adornments, which is the mastery of all phenomena, then at that time, in the center of the jeweled pavilion of the retinue, the bodhisattva Puṣyaśrīgarbha rose from his seat, draped his upper robe on one shoulder, and knelt on his right knee.🔽

original: ldan 'das kyi gdan sengge'i khri 'phang du shin ta la bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag brgyad cu tsam du mtho ba /
analyzed: ldan 'das kyi gdan sengge'i khri 'phang du shin ta la bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag brgyad cu tsam du mtho ba /
translated: As soon as the bodhisattva Puṣya­śrī­garbha entered the bodhisattva samādhi called the array of all adornments, which is the mastery of all phenomena, at that time, in the middle of the pavilion of precious arrays, the lion throne of the Bhagavān rose up to a height of eighty hundred thousand quintillion fathoms.

original: rin po che thams cad kyis spras pa /🔽kha khyer rgyan thams cad las byas pa /
analyzed: rin po che thams cad kyis spras pa / kha khyer rgyan thams cad las byas pa /
translated: It was adorned with all precious materials.🔽Its railings were made of all adornments.

original: ras bkod pa thams cad bting ba /🔽me tog sil ma sna tshogs thams cad bkram pa /
analyzed: ras bkod pa thams cad bting ba / me tog sil ma sna tshogs thams cad bkram pa /
translated: It was covered with all kinds of cloth.🔽It was strewn with all kinds of loose flowers.

original: bla re yid du 'ong @171b ba thams cad bres pa /
analyzed: bla re yid du 'ong @171b ba thams cad bres pa /
translated: It was covered with all kinds of beautiful canopies.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lus thams cad kyis yang dag par bzung ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lus thams cad kyis yang dag par bzung ba /
translated: It was held up by all bodhisattva bodies.

original: 'khor thams cad kyi mig gis bltas pa /
analyzed: 'khor thams cad kyi mig gis bltas pa /
translated: It was looked at by the eyes of all the retinue.

original: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa /🔽bsam pa tshim par byed pa zhig byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa / bsam pa tshim par byed pa zhig byung bar gyur to //
translated: He was able to satisfy the wishes of all beings.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' me tog dpal gyi snying po chos thams cad la dbang sgyur bas de bzhi gshegs pa'i gdan sengge'i khri chen po bskul bar bsngags pa mtha' yas zhes bya ba mngon par sprul nas dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du ting nge
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' me tog dpal gyi snying po chos thams cad la dbang sgyur bas de bzhi gshegs pa'i gdan sengge'i khri chen po bskul bar bsngags pa mtha' yas zhes bya ba mngon par sprul nas dran pa dang ldan zhing shes bzhin du ting nge
translated: Then the bodhisattva Flower of the Essence of Glory, Who Has Mastery Over All Dharmas, emanated a lion throne called “Praise of the Infinite Qualities of the Tathāgata’s Seat.”🔽With mindfulness and alertness, he rose from samādhi,

original: 'dzin de las langs te gus pa dang bcas shing zhes dang bcas par thal mo sbyar nas bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /
analyzed: 'dzin de las langs te gus pa dang bcas shing zhes dang bcas par thal mo sbyar nas bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /
translated: and with respect and devotion, he joined his palms and addressed the Blessed One with these verses:

original: nyi ma'i 'od kyis 'gro ba'i dgos pa rab tu bgyid //
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od kyis 'gro ba'i dgos pa rab tu bgyid //
translated: “The light of the sun fulfills the needs of beings,

original: lha dbang gzi brjid yon tan sum cu rtsa gsum dga'//
analyzed: lha dbang gzi brjid yon tan sum cu rtsa gsum dga'//
translated: The splendor and qualities of the lord of gods delight the Thirty-Three,

original: tshangs pa'i dbyangs kyis tshangs pa'i 'jig rten rnam par mdzes //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i dbyangs kyis tshangs pa'i 'jig rten rnam par mdzes //
translated: The Brahma voice beautifies the Brahma world.

original: sangs rgyas mthu yi yul gyis rnam par 'phrul pa 'di; ;chos rnams mi g-yo nam mkha'i rang bzhin ya ma bral //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mthu yi yul gyis rnam par 'phrul pa 'di; ;chos rnams mi g-yo nam mkha'i rang bzhin ya ma bral //
translated: The nature of phenomena, which is like space, is not a thing.

original: sgyu ma smig rgyu lta bu chu yi zla 'dra zhing //
analyzed: sgyu ma smig rgyu lta bu chu yi zla 'dra zhing //
translated: They are like illusions, mirages, and the reflection of the moon in water.

original: rje med byed pa po dang tshor ba po med par //
analyzed: rje med byed pa po dang tshor ba po med par //
translated: They are without a master, without an agent, and without a feeler.

original: mkhyen nas mgon po 'dir ni rnam par sgrub pa ston //
analyzed: mkhyen nas mgon po 'dir ni rnam par sgrub pa ston //
translated: The Lord knows this and teaches the accomplishment of the practice here.

original: bkod pa'i sems kyi dbang 'gro sems ni gzugs can min /
analyzed: bkod pa'i sems kyi dbang 'gro sems ni gzugs can min /
translated: “The mind is not a form, yet it moves according to the power of the mind’s display.

original: rnam sgrub thams cad sems kyi rang bzhin dbang du 'gro //
analyzed: rnam sgrub thams cad sems kyi rang bzhin dbang du 'gro //
translated: All accomplishments are under the power of the mind’s nature.

original: bkod pa thams cad 'dir @172a *//
analyzed: bkod pa thams cad 'dir @172a *//
translated: All displays here

original: ni sgyu ma'i rang bzhin 'dra //
analyzed: ni sgyu ma'i rang bzhin 'dra //
translated: are like the nature of an illusion.

original: rnam sgrub bdag gis ma mchis gang na'ang gnas ma mchis //
analyzed: rnam sgrub bdag gis ma mchis gang na'ang gnas ma mchis //
translated: Accomplishments do not exist and are nowhere to be found.

original: gang gis sems rgyun ma mchis rang bzhin dag 'tshal ba //
analyzed: gang gis sems rgyun ma mchis rang bzhin dag 'tshal ba //
translated: Those who know the nature of the mind, which is without a continuum,

original: de la glo bur gnas pa'i nyon mongs ma mchis so //
analyzed: de la glo bur gnas pa'i nyon mongs ma mchis so //
translated: will not have the kleśas that abide as guests.

original: rtog dang kun rtog yongs su rtog las sems grol ba //
analyzed: rtog dang kun rtog yongs su rtog las sems grol ba //
translated: “The mind is liberated from thoughts, concepts, and imagination.

original: de ni sgyu ma'i rnam bar sprul pa sna tshogs ston //
analyzed: de ni sgyu ma'i rnam bar sprul pa sna tshogs ston //
translated: It displays various emanations that are like illusions.

original: sa steng rdul tsam mngon par 'phags pa ma mchis kyang //
analyzed: sa steng rdul tsam mngon par 'phags pa ma mchis kyang //
translated: “There is not even a particle of dust on the ground

original: sa steng nor bu rin chen sna tshogs kun tu bstan //🔽gdan gang bzhugs nas sems can bye ba 'dul 'gyur ba //
analyzed: sa steng nor bu rin chen sna tshogs kun tu bstan // gdan gang bzhugs nas sems can bye ba 'dul 'gyur ba //
translated: That is not covered with various precious jewels.🔽I have prepared a beautiful lion throne

original: khyod kyi sengge'i khri gdan rab mdzes bdag gis bgyis //
analyzed: khyod kyi sengge'i khri gdan rab mdzes bdag gis bgyis //
translated: For you to sit on and tame the millions of beings.

original: gdus dang rgyal mtshan mchog dan dar gyi phreng ba bsgrengs //
analyzed: gdus dang rgyal mtshan mchog dan dar gyi phreng ba bsgrengs //
translated: “It is raised up with banners and flags,

original: de ni gang du'ang 'gro ba ma mchis 'ong ma mchis //
analyzed: de ni gang du'ang 'gro ba ma mchis 'ong ma mchis //
translated: But it does not go anywhere or come from anywhere.

original: khyod kyis gang nas chos rnams 'du ba mkhyen nas kyang //
analyzed: khyod kyis gang nas chos rnams 'du ba mkhyen nas kyang //
translated: You know that phenomena do not assemble from anywhere,

original: sems can dam pa rnam par 'phrul ba sna tshogs ston //
analyzed: sems can dam pa rnam par 'phrul ba sna tshogs ston //
translated: And you display various miracles, supreme being.

original: tshangs pa'i dbyangs ldan legs shing shin tu bsrungs pa'i gsung //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i dbyangs ldan legs shing shin tu bsrungs pa'i gsung //
translated: “You have the voice of Brahmā, a beautiful and well-guarded voice,

original: 'jig rten sgron ma mdzad pa bsod nams gzi brjid mang //
analyzed: 'jig rten sgron ma mdzad pa bsod nams gzi brjid mang //
translated: You are the light of the world, and you have the splendor of merit.

original: bdag la thugs brtse'i slad du 'dzegs te gdan la bzhugs //
analyzed: bdag la thugs brtse'i slad du 'dzegs te gdan la bzhugs //
translated: Out of compassion for me, please ascend and sit upon it.

original: rga dang 'chi dang na ba gcod ba'i chos bshad gsol //
analyzed: rga dang 'chi dang na ba gcod ba'i chos bshad gsol //
translated: Please teach the Dharma that will cut through old age, death, and sickness.”

original: khyod la bsnyen bkur bgyi dang chos ni mnyan slad du //
analyzed: khyod la bsnyen bkur bgyi dang chos ni mnyan slad du //
translated: In order to serve you and listen to the Dharma,

original: rnam dag sems can 'di rnams phyogs bcu dag nas lhags //
analyzed: rnam dag sems can 'di rnams phyogs bcu dag nas lhags //
translated: These pure beings have come from the ten directions.

original: gang gi don du lhags @172b pa'i don de stsal du gsol //
analyzed: gang gi don du lhags @172b pa'i don de stsal du gsol //
translated: Please grant them the purpose for which they have come.

original: sengge'i khri la bzhugs te chos kyang bshad du gsol //
analyzed: sengge'i khri la bzhugs te chos kyang bshad du gsol //
translated: Please sit on the lion throne and teach the Dharma.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' me tog dpal gyi snying po chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa mkhyen nas gdan sengge'i khri de la bzhugs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' me tog dpal gyi snying po chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa mkhyen nas gdan sengge'i khri de la bzhugs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the superior intention of the bodhisattva Flower of Glorious Essence, Lord of All Dharmas, sat down on that lion throne.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das sgrib pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa brnyes nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pas nges par 'byung ba sgrib pa med pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs byang chub sems dpa'i lam bkod pa la dmigs pa dang
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das sgrib pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa brnyes nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pas nges par 'byung ba sgrib pa med pa'i sgo zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs byang chub sems dpa'i lam bkod pa la dmigs pa dang
translated: Then the Blessed One, having attained unobstructed liberation, taught the Dharma discourse called “The Unimpeded Gate of Liberation through the Bodhisattva’s Practice,” which focuses on the array of the bodhisattva path,

original: / sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo thams cad dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa yongs su sgrub pa dang / ye shes kyi 'byung gnas chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'i gzungs kyi phyag rgya'i skor 'jug pa /🔽so so yang dag par rig pa la rnam par gtan la dbab pa la gzhol ba'i sgor 'jug pa /
analyzed: / sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo thams cad dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa yongs su sgrub pa dang / ye shes kyi 'byung gnas chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'i gzungs kyi phyag rgya'i skor 'jug pa / so so yang dag par rig pa la rnam par gtan la dbab pa la gzhol ba'i sgor 'jug pa /
translated: the gateway to the dhāraṇī-seal that controls all phenomena,

original: mngon par shes pa chen po'i ye she sla gzhol ba'i sgor 'jug pa /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa chen po'i ye she sla gzhol ba'i sgor 'jug pa /
translated: the gateway to the easy attainment of the wisdom of the great superknowledges,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor la mi skye ba'i chos ston pa /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor la mi skye ba'i chos ston pa /
translated: the teaching of the unborn Dharma to the irreversible assembly,

original: theg pa thams cad theg pa gcig tu mnyam pa nyid du yang dag par 'du ba /
analyzed: theg pa thams cad theg pa gcig tu mnyam pa nyid du yang dag par 'du ba /
translated: the perfect inclusion of all vehicles within the sameness of the single vehicle,

original: chos kyi dbyings tshul gcig cing ma 'dres pa la 'jug pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings tshul gcig cing ma 'dres pa la 'jug pa /
translated: the entry into the unadulterated single principle of the realm of phenomena,

original: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang dbang po la 'jug pa ston pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang dbang po la 'jug pa ston pa /
translated: the teaching of the entry into the thoughts and faculties of all beings,

original: snying po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: snying po dang ldan pa /
translated: endowed with the essence,

original: chos rnam par gdon mi za ba /
analyzed: chos rnam par gdon mi za ba /
translated: the Dharma that is certain,

original: bdu @173a *// kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam par 'joms par byed pa /
analyzed: bdu @173a *// kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam par 'joms par byed pa /
translated: It is the destroyer of all the maṇḍalas of the māras.

original: tshul bzhin gyi chos kyi tshul la gzhol bar 'jug pa /
analyzed: tshul bzhin gyi chos kyi tshul la gzhol bar 'jug pa /
translated: It is the entrance into the proper way of the Dharma.

original: nyon mongs pa dang lta bar gyur pa thams cad 'dul ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang lta bar gyur pa thams cad 'dul ba /
translated: It is the taming of all the afflictions and views.

original: chags pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su 'jug pa /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su 'jug pa /
translated: It is the entrance into unimpeded wisdom.

original: thub pa med par yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pa'i thabs dang ye shes ston pa /
analyzed: thub pa med par yongs su bsngo ba la mkhas pa'i thabs dang ye shes ston pa /
translated: It is the teaching of the skill in means and wisdom of the unassailable dedication.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la 'jug pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la 'jug pa /
translated: It is the entrance into the wisdom of the sameness of all the buddhas.

original: chags pa med pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi sgor 'jug pa /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi sgor 'jug pa /
translated: It is the entrance into the door of the blessing of nonattachment.

original: chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par nges pa ston pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par nges pa ston pa /
translated: It is the teaching of the ascertainment of all phenomena just as they are.

original: rtog pa med pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pa mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pa mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa /
translated: It is the entrance into the sameness of the absence of thought and the absence of discursive thought.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad bsags pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab mo mnyam pa nyid rtogs par byed pa /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad bsags pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab mo mnyam pa nyid rtogs par byed pa /
translated: It is the realization of the sameness of the profound dependent origination in order to accumulate all the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs mnyam pa nyid kyi rgyan dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs mnyam pa nyid kyi rgyan dang ldan pa /
translated: He was adorned with the adornments of the equality of the body, speech, and mind of the buddhas.

original: dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtogs pa dang / mos pa dang / shes rab zad mi shes pa mngon par sgrub pa /
analyzed: dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtogs pa dang / mos pa dang / shes rab zad mi shes pa mngon par sgrub pa /
translated: He had accomplished inexhaustible mindfulness, intelligence, realization, interest, and wisdom.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pas 'dul ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa'i tshul la 'jug pa /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pas 'dul ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa'i tshul la 'jug pa /
translated: He had entered the way of the noble truths in order to tame those who were to be tamed by the vehicle of the hearers.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas 'dul ba'i phyir lus dang / ngag dang / sems rab tu dben par shes pa /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas 'dul ba'i phyir lus dang / ngag dang / sems rab tu dben par shes pa /
translated: He knew the body, speech, and mind to be isolated in order to tame those who were to be tamed by the vehicle of the solitary buddhas.

original: theg pa chen pos 'dul ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen @173b pa'i ye shes kyi sang dbang bskur ba rab tu thob pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen pos 'dul ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen @173b pa'i ye shes kyi sang dbang bskur ba rab tu thob pa /
translated: He had attained the consecration of the wisdom of omniscience in order to tame those who were to be tamed by the Great Vehicle.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan thams cad brjod pa'i phyir chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'i tshul la 'jug pa 'di lta bu'i chos kyi rnam grangs yang dag par rab tu bstan pa dang / bsnyad pa dang / bshad pa dang / bklag pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan thams cad brjod pa'i phyir chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'i tshul la 'jug pa 'di lta bu'i chos kyi rnam grangs yang dag par rab tu bstan pa dang / bsnyad pa dang / bshad pa dang / bklag pa dang /
translated: He had entered the way of mastering all phenomena in order to describe all the qualities of the tathāgatas. He taught, explained, and expounded this kind of Dharma teaching, this Dharma discourse, this instruction for bodhisattvas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is possessed by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is taught by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is spoken by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is taught by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is taught by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is taught by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is taught by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is taught by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is taught by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is taught by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is taught by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is taught by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is taught by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is taught by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is taught by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is taught by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is taught by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is taught by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is taught by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is taught by the buddhas, this instruction for bodhisattvas that is taught by the budd

original: gzung ba dang / rnam par shes par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su bskang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par sprul pa yang dag par bstan pa dang / 'khor gyi the tshom thams cad gcad pa dang /
analyzed: gzung ba dang / rnam par shes par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su bskang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par sprul pa yang dag par bstan pa dang / 'khor gyi the tshom thams cad gcad pa dang /
translated: to satisfy the aspirations of all the bodhisattvas; to reveal the emanations of the tathāgatas; to cut through all doubts in the retinue;

original: bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad tshar gcad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'bar bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa chen po yongs su thob par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gdan sengge'i khri de la bzhugs so //
analyzed: bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad tshar gcad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'bar bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa chen po yongs su thob par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das gdan sengge'i khri de la bzhugs so //
translated: to destroy all the maṇḍalas of Māra; to make the teachings of the tathāgatas blaze; and to attain the great deeds of the buddhas.

original: bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po gnyis pa /
translated: PART TWO

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' rin chen srog shing zhes bya bas sangs rgyas kyi rgyan bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor sangs rgyas kyi rgyan gyis brgyan par byin gyis brlabs so🔽// de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' sgra bsgrags stobs kyi rgyal pos padma bkod pa zhes bya ba'i @174a *//
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' rin chen srog shing zhes bya bas sangs rgyas kyi rgyan bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor sangs rgyas kyi rgyan gyis brgyan par byin gyis brlabs so // de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' sgra bsgrags stobs kyi rgyal pos padma bkod pa zhes bya ba'i @174a *//
translated: Then, through the power of the Buddha, the bodhisattva Jewel Life-Tree entered the meditative absorption called “the array of the ornaments of the Buddha” and blessed the entire retinue to be adorned with the ornaments of the Buddha.🔽Then, through the power of the Buddha, the bodhisattva Proclamation of Sound, King of Power, entered the meditative absorption called “the array of lotuses” and blessed the entire retinue to have garlands of flowers and flower baskets in their hands.

original: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor gyi lag pa rnams su me tog gi lda ldi dag dang / me tog gi skon bu rnams byin gyis brlabs te me tog gi lda ldi dang / me tog gi skon bu de dag gis bcom ldan 'das dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor gyi lag pa rnams su me tog gi lda ldi dag dang / me tog gi skon bu rnams byin gyis brlabs te me tog gi lda ldi dang / me tog gi skon bu de dag gis bcom ldan 'das dang /
translated: With those garlands of flowers and flower baskets, they scattered offerings to the Blessed One

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs thams cad la mngon par 'thor ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs thams cad la mngon par 'thor ro //
translated: and the assembly of bodhisattvas.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' blo mchog rgya mtshos dri bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor gyi spu'i khung bu thams cad du tsandan sprul gyi snying po'i drir byin gyis brlabs so
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' blo mchog rgya mtshos dri bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor gyi spu'i khung bu thams cad du tsandan sprul gyi snying po'i drir byin gyis brlabs so
translated: Then, through the power of the Buddha, the bodhisattva Ocean of Supreme Intelligence entered the meditative absorption called “array of fragrances” and blessed the entire assembly so that the scent of snake-heart sandalwood emanated from all their pores.

original: // de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' 'od zer dra ba can gyis 'od bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor la lus kyi 'od mtha' yas pa byin gyis brlabs so //
analyzed: // de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' 'od zer dra ba can gyis 'od bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor la lus kyi 'od mtha' yas pa byin gyis brlabs so //
translated: Then, through the power of the Buddha, the bodhisattva Web of Light Rays entered the meditative absorption called “array of light” and blessed the entire assembly so that their bodies emitted limitless light.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' snying rje chen po sems pas mig mi 'dzum pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de bzhin gshegs pa la mngon par phyogs shing mig mi 'dzum par byin🔽gyis brlabs so //🔽de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' blo mtha' @174b yas dri med kyis chos la mchog tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor chos don du gnyer zhing chos la dga' ba dang /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' snying rje chen po sems pas mig mi 'dzum pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de bzhin gshegs pa la mngon par phyogs shing mig mi 'dzum par byin gyis brlabs so // de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' blo mtha' @174b yas dri med kyis chos la mchog tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor chos don du gnyer zhing chos la dga' ba dang /
translated: Then, through the power of the Buddha, the bodhisattva Great Compassionate Mind entered the samādhi called “Unblinking Eyes” and blessed the entire assembly to face the Tathāgata with unblinking eyes.

original: mos par byin gyis brlabs so //
analyzed: mos par byin gyis brlabs so //
translated: Then, through the power of the Buddha, the bodhisattva Infinite Stainless Mind entered the samādhi called “Supreme Joy in the Dharma” and blessed the entire assembly to be intent on the Dharma and to delight in the Dharma.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' spobs pa'i rgyan bkod pas rab tu zhi ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor sgrib pa lnga rnam par sel bar byin gyis brlabs so //🔽de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyal pos brjed pa med par spyod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor byang chub kyi sems dran zhing de bzhin gshegs
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' spobs pa'i rgyan bkod pas rab tu zhi ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor sgrib pa lnga rnam par sel bar byin gyis brlabs so // de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyal pos brjed pa med par spyod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor byang chub kyi sems dran zhing de bzhin gshegs
translated: Then, through the power of the Buddha, the bodhisattva Adorned with Eloquence entered the samādhi called “endowed with peace” and blessed the entire assembly to clear away the five hindrances.

original: pa la dmigs pa mi brjed par byin gyis brlabs so //
analyzed: pa la dmigs pa mi brjed par byin gyis brlabs so //
translated: Then, through the power of the Buddha, the bodhisattva King of the Miraculous Manifestations of All Dharmas entered the samādhi called “conduct without forgetfulness” and blessed the entire assembly to remember the mind of awakening and not forget to focus on the Tathāgata.

original: de nas de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun nas snang ba zhes bya bas zil gyis mi non pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor bdud dang / phyir rgol ba bcom par byin gyis brlabs so //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun nas snang ba zhes bya bas zil gyis mi non pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor bdud dang / phyir rgol ba bcom par byin gyis brlabs so //
translated: Then, at that time, through the power of the Buddha, the bodhisattva mahāsattva named Samantāvabhāsa entered the samādhi called “Unconquerable” and blessed the entire assembly to conquer Māra and his adversaries.

original: de nas de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' bdud rab tu 'joms pas bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam @175a *//🔽par 'joms pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' bdud rab tu 'joms pas bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam @175a *// par 'joms pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: Then, at that time, through the power of the Buddha, the bodhisattva Mārapramardaka entered the samādhi called “Conquering All Māra’s Circles”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bdud rab tu 'joms pa bdud kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par 'joms pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu de nas de'i tshe stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bdud bye ba phrag brgya ji snyed pa
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bdud rab tu 'joms pa bdud kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par 'joms pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu de nas de'i tshe stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bdud bye ba phrag brgya ji snyed pa
translated: and as soon as the bodhisattva Mārapramardaka entered that samādhi called “Conquering All Māra’s Circles,” at that time, in this billion-world galactic universe, all the hundreds of thousands of māras

original: de dag thams cad dpung dang bcas /🔽g-yog 'khor dang bcas te myur ba myur ba ring thabs su rang rang gi bdud kyi gnas nas mi snang bar gyur te 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'khod nas de dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos
analyzed: de dag thams cad dpung dang bcas / g-yog 'khor dang bcas te myur ba myur ba ring thabs su rang rang gi bdud kyi gnas nas mi snang bar gyur te 'khor gyi khyams rin po che bkod par bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'khod nas de dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos
translated: all of them with their armies,

original: phyag btsal te lha'i mchod pa rnam pa brgya stong phrag du mas bcom ldan 'das la mchod nas gus pa dang bcas shing zhe sa dang bcas par thal mo sbyar te bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba btab nas bcom ldan 'das /🔽bdag cag gsol ba 'tshal na /
analyzed: phyag btsal te lha'i mchod pa rnam pa brgya stong phrag du mas bcom ldan 'das la mchod nas gus pa dang bcas shing zhe sa dang bcas par thal mo sbyar te bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba btab nas bcom ldan 'das / bdag cag gsol ba 'tshal na /
translated: retinues, and entourages, disappeared from their own abodes in an instant and gathered in the Jeta Grove. They bowed their heads to the feet of the Blessed One and made offerings to the Blessed One with many hundreds of thousands of divine offerings. With respect and reverence, they joined their palms and supplicated the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: chos bshad du gsol /
analyzed: chos bshad du gsol /
translated: please teach the Dharma.

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Sugata,

original: chos bshad du gsol /
analyzed: chos bshad du gsol /
translated: please teach the Dharma.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' bdud rab tu 'joms pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis bdag cag bdud kyi su ga las 'dor zhing slan chad sems can rnams la mig gis mi rtsol bar 'gyur ba'i @175b las mi bgyid do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdud rab tu 'joms pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis bdag cag bdud kyi su ga las 'dor zhing slan chad sems can rnams la mig gis mi rtsol bar 'gyur ba'i @175b las mi bgyid do //
translated: “By the power of the bodhisattva Mārapramardaka, we will be released from the domain of Māra and will not commit any actions that would cause us to look upon sentient beings with hostility.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag cag la dbugs dbyung ba stsol cig dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du mchis te bdag cag chos nyan par bgyid do //
analyzed: bdag cag la dbugs dbyung ba stsol cig dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du mchis te bdag cag chos nyan par bgyid do //
translated: please comfort us, so that we may go to the Blessed One and listen to the Dharma.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bdud de dag dbugs dbyung ba'i phyir 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bdud de dag dbugs dbyung ba'i phyir 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said this in order to comfort those māras:

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: “Friends,

original: legs so legs so //
analyzed: legs so legs so //
translated: excellent, excellent!

original: gang gi phyir khyed bdud kyi las kyang 'or la de bzhin gshegs pa la chos bshad par gsol ba'ang thob cig dang / de nyid khyed kyi bdud kyi lam thams cad las 'da' ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyed bdud kyi las kyang 'or la de bzhin gshegs pa la chos bshad par gsol ba'ang thob cig dang / de nyid khyed kyi bdud kyi lam thams cad las 'da' ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Since you have given up your māra activities and requested the Thus-Gone One to teach the Dharma, this will become the cause for you to transcend all the paths of māras.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the power of the roots of virtue planted in the Buddha.

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: Friends,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / mun pa mun nag lo du mar bsags pa ni; mar me gcig gis med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / mun pa mun nag lo du mar bsags pa ni; mar me gcig gis med par 'gyur ro //
translated: a single lamp can dispel the darkness of a hundred thousand years that has accumulated in a completely enclosed space,

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: Friends,

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i mun pa mun nag bskal pa brgyar bsags pa'ang ye shes kyi stobs bskyed pa gcig gis med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i mun pa mun nag bskal pa brgyar bsags pa'ang ye shes kyi stobs bskyed pa gcig gis med par 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, a single moment of the power of wisdom can dispel the darkness of afflictions that has accumulated for a hundred eons.

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: Friends,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gcig dang / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gcig dang / nor bu rin po che chen po gcig gis mun pa mun nag thams cad sel to //
analyzed: dper na / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gcig dang / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gcig dang / nor bu rin po che chen po gcig gis mun pa mun nag thams cad sel to //
translated: a single moon disk, a single sun disk, and a single great precious jewel can dispel all darkness.

original: grogs po dag /🔽de bzhin du dge ba'i sems lhag mthong dang ldan pa gcig gis mi shes pa'i mun @176a *//
analyzed: grogs po dag / de bzhin du dge ba'i sems lhag mthong dang ldan pa gcig gis mi shes pa'i mun @176a *//
translated: Friends,

original: pa mun nag thams cad sel to //
analyzed: pa mun nag thams cad sel to //
translated: in the same way, a single wholesome state of mind endowed with insight can dispel all the darkness of ignorance.

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: Friends,🔽it is like this:

original: de'i phyir khyed dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis rim gyis mi shes pa'i mun pa mun nag thams cad bsal nas chos kyi snang ba chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis rim gyis mi shes pa'i mun pa mun nag thams cad bsal nas chos kyi snang ba chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by these roots of virtue, you will gradually dispel all the darkness of ignorance and attain the great light of the Dharma.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po zhes bya ba 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur te 'dug pa des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po zhes bya ba 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur te 'dug pa des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then, a bodhisattva called King of the Power of the Dharma, who was present in the assembly, said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa dang / kun tu bstan pa 'di ni; bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa dang / kun tu bstan pa 'di ni; bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: the domain of the buddhas, which is blessed and revealed by the Thus-Gone One, is inconceivable.

original: deng ni / de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pas nges par 'byung ba sgrib pa med pa'i sgo zhes bgyi ba 'dus pa chen po'i le'u'i chos kyi rnam grangs bshad par bzhed par the tshom ma mchis so //
analyzed: deng ni / de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pas nges par 'byung ba sgrib pa med pa'i sgo zhes bgyi ba 'dus pa chen po'i le'u'i chos kyi rnam grangs bshad par bzhed par the tshom ma mchis so //
translated: Today, the Thus-Gone One has no doubt that he will explain the Dharma discourse of the chapter on the great assembly, called ‘The Unobscured Gate of Liberation through Engaging in the Bodhisattva’s Conduct.’

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ae ma byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'dus pa 'di ni /
analyzed: ae ma byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'dus pa 'di ni /
translated: “Ah! This assembly of bodhisattvas is great.

original: che ste / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: che ste / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa' bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i go cha bgos pa /
analyzed: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa' bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i go cha bgos pa /
translated: this assembly is made up of bodhisattvas who have donned the inconceivable armor,

original: mngon par shes pa'i ye shes chen pos rnam par rol pa /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i ye shes chen pos rnam par rol pa /
translated: who revel in the great wisdom of the superknowledges,

original: phyogs bcur sgra bsgrags pa /
analyzed: phyogs bcur sgra bsgrags pa /
translated: whose fame has spread in the ten directions,

original: sems shin tu byang bar bgyis te dri ma mchis pa /
analyzed: sems shin tu byang bar bgyis te dri ma mchis pa /
translated: whose minds are pure and stainless,🔽who are illuminated by knowledge and liberation,

original: rig pa dang rnam par grol bas snang bar @176b gyur pa; sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bstod cing bsngags pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang rnam par grol bas snang bar @176b gyur pa; sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bstod cing bsngags pa /
translated: who are praised and extolled by all the buddhas,

original: chos thams cad la dbang phyug gis dbang sgyur pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad la dbang phyug gis dbang sgyur pa /
translated: who have mastered all phenomena,🔽who have reached the other shore of all the perfections,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu son pa; thabs mkhas pa thams cad las nges par skyes pa /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu son pa; thabs mkhas pa thams cad las nges par skyes pa /
translated: who have been born from all skillful means,

original: bdud kyi las dang / rtsod pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad bsal ba /
analyzed: bdud kyi las dang / rtsod pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad bsal ba /
translated: who have dispelled all the activities of Māra, disputes, and afflictions,

original: phas kyi rgol ba dang / ngan pa'i tshogs can gyi tshogs thams cad rab tu 'dul ba /
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba dang / ngan pa'i tshogs can gyi tshogs thams cad rab tu 'dul ba /
translated: and who have subdued all the hordes of adversaries and evil ones.

original: tshig thams cad rab tu dbye ba bstan pa shes pa la mkhas pa /
analyzed: tshig thams cad rab tu dbye ba bstan pa shes pa la mkhas pa /
translated: They were skilled in teaching the divisions of all words.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu son pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu son pa /
translated: They had reached the perfection of the perfection of wisdom, which is without attachment.

original: dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtogs pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / mos pa dang / gzungs dang / ye shes rab tu thob pa /
analyzed: dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtogs pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / mos pa dang / gzungs dang / ye shes rab tu thob pa /
translated: They had attained mindfulness, intelligence, realization, modesty, interest, dhāraṇī, and wisdom.

original: byin gyi rlabs thogs pa ma mchis shing spobs pa rgyun mi chad pa /
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs thogs pa ma mchis shing spobs pa rgyun mi chad pa /
translated: They were unimpeded in their blessings and had uninterrupted eloquence.

original: sems can thams cad kyi dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma lags pa shes pa la mkhas pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma lags pa shes pa la mkhas pa /
translated: They were skilled in knowing the superior and inferior faculties of all beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos ston pa /
translated: They taught the Dharma in accordance with the interests of all beings.

original: 'khrul pa ma mchis par kha na ma tho ba ma mchis pa'i chos ston pa /
analyzed: 'khrul pa ma mchis par kha na ma tho ba ma mchis pa'i chos ston pa /
translated: They taught the Dharma without error or fault.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sgra dang / skad la mkhas pa; mi'am ci dang / bya ka la pingka dang / khrung khrung gi sgra dang / tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs can /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sgra dang / skad la mkhas pa; mi'am ci dang / bya ka la pingka dang / khrung khrung gi sgra dang / tshangs pa'i sgra dbyangs can /
translated: They were skilled in the languages and sounds of all beings, and they had the melodious voice of the kalaviṅka bird, the voice of the swan, and the voice of Brahmā.

original: shin tu bshes gnyen bgyis pas sems can thams cad yongs su @177a *//
analyzed: shin tu bshes gnyen bgyis pas sems can thams cad yongs su @177a *//
translated: By being a very close friend, all sentient beings are completely🔽liberated.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god pa /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la 'god pa /
translated: They are very friendly and establish all sentient beings in nirvāṇa.

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'i lhag pa'i bsam pa can /
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'i lhag pa'i bsam pa can /
translated: They have the superior intention of great love and great compassion.

original: brtan zhing shin tu gnas la mi g-yo zhing ji skad smras pa de bzhin du bgyid pa /
analyzed: brtan zhing shin tu gnas la mi g-yo zhing ji skad smras pa de bzhin du bgyid pa /
translated: They are steadfast, very stable, and unmoving, and they do as they say.

original: chos kyi rgyal mtshan yang dag par sgreng bar bgyid pa /
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal mtshan yang dag par sgreng bar bgyid pa /
translated: They raise the banner of the Dharma.

original: rdo rje ltar sra zhing mi shigs pa'i khor yug lta bu /
analyzed: rdo rje ltar sra zhing mi shigs pa'i khor yug lta bu /
translated: They are as firm and indestructible as a vajra or a mountain.

original: smon pa ma mchis pa'i smon lam dang ldan pa /
analyzed: smon pa ma mchis pa'i smon lam dang ldan pa /
translated: They have the aspiration of the aspirationless.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo blta dka' zhing rtogs par dka' ba la zhugs pa /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo blta dka' zhing rtogs par dka' ba la zhugs pa /
translated: They have entered the profound dependent origination that is difficult to see and difficult to understand.

original: chad pa dang / rtag pa'i mtha' gnyi ga dang / lta bar gyur pa thams cad dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba yang dag par bcad pa /
analyzed: chad pa dang / rtag pa'i mtha' gnyi ga dang / lta bar gyur pa thams cad dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba yang dag par bcad pa /
translated: They have cut the extremes of annihilation and permanence, all views, and the connections of the latent tendencies.

original: tshogs can chen po'i tshogs kyi rgyal po yongs su 'gugs pa /
analyzed: tshogs can chen po'i tshogs kyi rgyal po yongs su 'gugs pa /
translated: They are the kings of the great assemblies of the hosts.

original: ded dpon chen po bskal pa grangs med par chos dkon mchog gis bsod nams yang dag par bsgrubs pa /
analyzed: ded dpon chen po bskal pa grangs med par chos dkon mchog gis bsod nams yang dag par bsgrubs pa /
translated: Great captain, you have perfectly accomplished the merit of the jewel of the Dharma for countless eons.

original: sman pa'i rgyal po chen po sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa gzugs can ma lags pa'i nad gso bar bgyid pa /
analyzed: sman pa'i rgyal po chen po sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa gzugs can ma lags pa'i nad gso bar bgyid pa /
translated: Great king of physicians, you heal the formless sicknesses of the afflictions of all sentient beings.

original: sengge'i sgra chen po sgrog pa /
analyzed: sengge'i sgra chen po sgrog pa /
translated: You roar the great lion’s roar.

original: snrel zhi'i rgyud dang / spyi'u tshugs kyi rgyud thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba la mi skrag pa /
analyzed: snrel zhi'i rgyud dang / spyi'u tshugs kyi rgyud thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba la mi skrag pa /
translated: You are not afraid of the secret of the Tathāgata, of all the tantras of the inverted and the inverted-upward,

original: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos lus legs par brgyan pa /
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos lus legs par brgyan pa /
translated: Your body is well adorned with the major and minor marks.

original: gtan pa med pa'i mchod sbyin bgyid pa thams cad la sems dpa' ba /
analyzed: gtan pa med pa'i mchod sbyin bgyid pa thams cad la sems dpa' ba /
translated: You are heroic in all the offerings of the unfixed.

original: bdud bzhi dang / @177b nyon mongs pa'i g-yul 'dul ba /
analyzed: bdud bzhi dang / @177b nyon mongs pa'i g-yul 'dul ba /
translated: You have conquered the four māras and the battle of the afflictions.

original: mnyan pa lta bur gyur pa /
analyzed: mnyan pa lta bur gyur pa /
translated: You are like a ferry.

original: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa /
analyzed: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa /
translated: You have the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, the concentrations, the liberations, and the samādhis.

original: shin tu yongs su sbyang ba bgyis pa /
analyzed: shin tu yongs su sbyang ba bgyis pa /
translated: They are very well trained.

original: sems can thams cad rab tu sgrol ba la brtson pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad rab tu sgrol ba la brtson pa /
translated: They are dedicated to liberating all sentient beings.

original: ri lta bur gyur pa /
analyzed: ri lta bur gyur pa /
translated: They are like mountains.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad po rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa dang / smad pa dang / bstod pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal las log pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad po rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa dang / smad pa dang / bstod pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal las log pa /
translated: They are free from the eight worldly concerns: gain and loss, fame and disgrace, praise and blame, pleasure and pain.

original: dga' ba dang / dang ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba'i chos la sems zhugs pa /
analyzed: dga' ba dang / dang ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba'i chos la sems zhugs pa /
translated: They are immersed in the Dharma of joy, clarity, and supreme joy.

original: chos dkon mchog gi 'od zer dang ldan pa /
analyzed: chos dkon mchog gi 'od zer dang ldan pa /
translated: They are endowed with the light rays of the precious Dharma.

original: shes rab kyis ngoms nas ngoms par bgyid pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyis ngoms nas ngoms par bgyid pa /
translated: They are satisfied with wisdom and satisfy others.

original: padma lta bu 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad kyis mi gos pa /
analyzed: padma lta bu 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad kyis mi gos pa /
translated: They are like lotuses, unstained by any conditioned phenomena.

original: 'od kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: 'od kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa /
translated: They have a pure halo of light.

original: zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa'i 'od mog mog por bgyid pa /
analyzed: zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa'i 'od mog mog por bgyid pa /
translated: They outshine the light of the sun, moon, Śakra, and Brahmā.

original: rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa /
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa /
translated: They have attained the samādhi of the ocean mudrā.

original: chos dkon mchog thams cad la yang dag par gzhol ba /
analyzed: chos dkon mchog thams cad la yang dag par gzhol ba /
translated: They are dedicated to all the precious teachings.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung mi gcod pa /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung mi gcod pa /
translated: They do not cut off the lineage of the Three Jewels.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bgyi ba dang / 'dul ba'i cho ga 'tshal ba /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bgyi ba dang / 'dul ba'i cho ga 'tshal ba /
translated: They know the rituals for ripening and training all beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos dkon mchog thams cad kyi mdzod yang dag par 'dzin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos dkon mchog thams cad kyi mdzod yang dag par 'dzin pa /
translated: They uphold the treasury of all the precious teachings of the Buddha.

original: bsngags pa mtha' yas pa dang yang @178a *//🔽dag par ldan pa /
analyzed: bsngags pa mtha' yas pa dang yang @178a *// dag par ldan pa /
translated: They are endowed with infinite praise.

original: bsod nams tshad ma mchis pa bsags pa /
analyzed: bsod nams tshad ma mchis pa bsags pa /
translated: They have accumulated immeasurable merit.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la nye bar gyur pa /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la nye bar gyur pa /
translated: They are close to the omniscient wisdom that is endowed with the most sublime of all aspects.

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i mu'i bskal par bsngags pa mthar mi phyin pa 'di lta bu rnams kyi 'dus pa lags so //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i mu'i bskal par bsngags pa mthar mi phyin pa 'di lta bu rnams kyi 'dus pa lags so //
translated: They are the assemblies of those who will never reach the end of such praise, even in the eons of the future.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de la bdag 'di snyam du bcom ldan 'das ni /
analyzed: de la bdag 'di snyam du bcom ldan 'das ni /
translated: I thought to myself, ‘The Blessed One

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pas nges par 'byung ba sgrib pa med pa'i sgo zhes bgyi ba 'dus pa chen po'i le'u'i chos kyi rnam grangs bshad par bzhed pa snyam bgyid do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pas nges par 'byung ba sgrib pa med pa'i sgo zhes bgyi ba 'dus pa chen po'i le'u'i chos kyi rnam grangs bshad par bzhed pa snyam bgyid do //
translated: I think that the Blessed One wishes to explain the Dharma discourse of the chapter on the great assembly called the Door of Unobstructed Liberation through the Bodhisattva’s Activity.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji tsam du sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: ji tsam du sangs rgyas 'byung ba ni /
translated: the appearance of a Buddha

analyzed: phan 'dogs par 'gyur ba /
translated: is beneficial,

original: sems can thams cad tshim par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: sems can thams cad tshim par 'gyur ba /
translated: satisfies all beings,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par skyed pa /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par skyed pa /
translated: generates the roots of virtue for future bodhisattvas,

original: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa yongs su sbyong ba /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam pa yongs su sbyong ba /
translated: purifies the intentions of bodhisattvas who have generated the initial thought [of awakening],

original: spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul gcig la 'jug pa /
analyzed: spyod pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul gcig la 'jug pa /

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos la dbang bskur ba /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos la dbang bskur ba /
translated: and is the empowerment in the Buddha’s teachings for irreversible bodhisattvas.

original: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu chud mi za ba /
analyzed: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu chud mi za ba /
translated: It is the cause and effect of bodhisattvas who are impeded by only one birth.

original: nges @178b pa'i sems can rnams la rkyen nye bar sgrub pa /
analyzed: nges @178b pa'i sems can rnams la rkyen nye bar sgrub pa /

analyzed: ma nges pa'i sems can rnams la snying rje chen po nye bar sgrub pa /

original: log pa nyid du nges pa'i sems can rnams 'dzud pa /
analyzed: log pa nyid du nges pa'i sems can rnams 'dzud pa /
translated: It is the entry for sentient beings who are wrongly determined.

original: theg pa gsum la mos pa'i sems can rnams la rnam par dgod pa ston pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa gsum la mos pa'i sems can rnams la rnam par dgod pa ston pa ste /
translated: It is the teaching of the arrangement for sentient beings who aspire to the three vehicles.

translated: This concludes the chapter on the array of adornments, the first chapter.

translated: Then, the Blessed One, having seen that great assembly of bodhisattvas, thought, “Ah! These assembled bodhisattvas

translated: are dedicated to the Dharma and uphold the Thus-Gone One’s treasury of Dharma.” Knowing this, he explained the chapter on the Dharma discourse called “The Unceasing Gate of the Bodhisattva’s Conduct That Leads to Liberation” in order to proclaim the chapter on fearlessness.

original: ba'i 'od zer skyes bu chen po'i mtshan spyi gtsug nas byung ngo //
analyzed: ba'i 'od zer skyes bu chen po'i mtshan spyi gtsug nas byung ngo //
translated: The light rays that emerged from the crown of the Blessed One’s head were the major marks of a great being.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'od zer de phyung ma thag tu de nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs la lan bdun bskor ba byas te byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po'i lus la lan brgyar bskor ba byas nas byang chub🔽sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po'i spyi gtsug tu mi snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'od zer de phyung ma thag tu de nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs la lan bdun bskor ba byas te byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po'i lus la lan brgyar bskor ba byas nas byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po'i spyi gtsug tu mi snang bar gyur to //
translated: As soon as the Blessed One emitted the light rays, they circled the entire assembly of bodhisattvas seven times and circled the body of the bodhisattva Dhāraṇīśvara­rāja a hundred times before disappearing into the crown of the bodhisattva Dhāraṇīśvara­rāja’s head.

original: 'od des byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po la reg ma thag tu de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal pos thams cad dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi 'od dang /
analyzed: 'od des byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po la reg ma thag tu de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal pos thams cad dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi 'od dang /
translated: As soon as the light rays touched the bodhisattva Dhāraṇīśvara­rāja, through the power of the Buddha, the bodhisattva Dhāraṇīśvara­rāja outshone the entire assembly of bodhisattvas,

original: sengge'i khri dang / lus brgya 'gyur du zil gyis mnan nas lam me /
analyzed: sengge'i khri dang / lus brgya 'gyur du zil gyis mnan nas lam me /
translated: their light, lion thrones, and bodies, a hundred times over.

original: lhang nge / lhan ne'o //
analyzed: lhang nge / lhan ne'o //
translated: radiant, and resplendent.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' @180a *//
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' @180a *//
translated: Then the bodhisattva🔽Dhāraṇīśvara­rāja, knowing the blessing of the Tathāgata, rose from his seat, draped his upper robe on one shoulder, and knelt on his right knee.

original: gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal pos de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs rig nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te bcom ldan 'das ga la bde logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud
analyzed: gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal pos de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs rig nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te bcom ldan 'das ga la bde logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud
translated: He bowed to the Bhagavat with palms together and,

original: nas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu'i gtsug gi drang thad kyi steng gi bar snang la rin po che'i gdugs de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyan ces bya ba yu ba ni /🔽bee d'urya / g-yogs ma ni; gser /
analyzed: nas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbu'i gtsug gi drang thad kyi steng gi bar snang la rin po che'i gdugs de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyan ces bya ba yu ba ni / bee d'urya / g-yogs ma ni; gser /
translated: above the crown of the Bhagavat’s head, in the sky, he held up a precious parasol called the Ornament of the Tathāgata.

original: snying po ni /🔽rin po che ne tso'am ci /
analyzed: snying po ni / rin po che ne tso'am ci /
translated: Its handle was🔽made of beryl,🔽its surface of gold,

original: rtsibs ni / aanda rnyil las byas pa /🔽mu tig gi do shal rab tu dpyangs pa /🔽dar gyi lda ldis mdzes par byas pa /
analyzed: rtsibs ni / aanda rnyil las byas pa / mu tig gi do shal rab tu dpyangs pa / dar gyi lda ldis mdzes par byas pa /
translated: its hub of sapphire,🔽its spokes of sapphire,🔽and it was hung with strings of pearls.🔽It was beautified with silk tassels,

original: dril bu g-yer ka'i dra ba 'khrol ba /
analyzed: dril bu g-yer ka'i dra ba 'khrol ba /
translated: had a network of small bells that tinkled,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyis bzung ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyis bzung ba /
translated: and was held by the body of a bodhisattva.

original: rgyar stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad tsam zhig byin gyis brlabs so //
analyzed: rgyar stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad tsam zhig byin gyis brlabs so //
translated: and in breadth it was the size of the trichiliocosm.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir rin po che'i gdugs de lta bu byin gyis brlabs nas me tog gi char yang phab ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'i las kyi phyir rin po che'i gdugs de lta bu byin gyis brlabs nas me tog gi char yang phab ste /
translated: He blessed the jeweled parasol in order to make offerings to the Tathāgata, and caused a rain of flowers to fall.

original: sil snyan dang / sgra dbyangs rtag tu rgyun mi chad par sgra 'byung bar byin gyis brlabs nas bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: sil snyan dang / sgra dbyangs rtag tu rgyun mi chad par sgra 'byung bar byin gyis brlabs nas bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis mngon par bstod do //
translated: He blessed the sound of music and song to be heard continuously, and he praised the Bhagavat with these verses:

original: kun tu snang ba kun nas 'od zer can //
analyzed: kun tu snang ba kun nas 'od zer can //
translated: “You are all-illuminating, all-radiant,

original: don rnams ma @180b lus ston pa kun nas spyan //
analyzed: don rnams ma @180b lus ston pa kun nas spyan //
translated: You are all-seeing, showing all meanings,

original: rang byung chos kyi ngo bo nyid la mkhas //
analyzed: rang byung chos kyi ngo bo nyid la mkhas //
translated: Skilled in the nature of self-arisen phenomena,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab yon tan kun dang ldan //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab yon tan kun dang ldan //
translated: Endowed with all inconceivable qualities.

original: skyes bu khyu mchog gis ni 'od zer phyung //
analyzed: skyes bu khyu mchog gis ni 'od zer phyung //
translated: The leader of beings emitted light

original: zhal yang rnam par spyod zhing 'od mdzad pa //
analyzed: zhal yang rnam par spyod zhing 'od mdzad pa //
translated: From his face, which was radiant,

original: 'dren pa de ni bdag gi lus la yang //
analyzed: 'dren pa de ni bdag gi lus la yang //
translated: And that leader

original: lan brgyar bskor ba bgyis nas spyi bor zhi //
analyzed: lan brgyar bskor ba bgyis nas spyi bor zhi //
translated: And circumambulated him a hundred times, and bowed my head to his feet.

original: mi yi 'dren pa'i 'od kyis reg pas na //
analyzed: mi yi 'dren pa'i 'od kyis reg pas na //
translated: The light of the Leader of Men touched me,🔽And I remembered what I had attained before,

original: gang dag bdag gis sngon thob dran pa dang // blo gros spobs pa snang ba de bzhin gzungs //
analyzed: gang dag bdag gis sngon thob dran pa dang // blo gros spobs pa snang ba de bzhin gzungs //
translated: And my understanding, eloquence, and illumination were just the same.

original: rnam pa stong du khyad par 'phags par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam pa stong du khyad par 'phags par 'gyur //
translated: They were a thousand times more exalted.

original: bdag lus rab sim sems ni rnam par dag /
analyzed: bdag lus rab sim sems ni rnam par dag /
translated: My body was refreshed and my mind was purified.

original: bdag gi blo gros dga' mgu mnyam par gyur //
analyzed: bdag gi blo gros dga' mgu mnyam par gyur //
translated: My understanding was joyful, happy, and even.🔽Moreover, the infinite knowledge of the Buddha

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas mkhyen pa mtha' yas dang // spobs pa bdag gi lus la rab tu zhugs //
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas mkhyen pa mtha' yas dang // spobs pa bdag gi lus la rab tu zhugs //

original: sangs rgyas mthu chen bsnyen par dka' ba la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mthu chen bsnyen par dka' ba la //
translated: The Buddha is greatly powerful and difficult to approach.

original: nyam chung dag gis mnyes par bgyid mi nus //🔽sangs rgyas gnang nas 'gro kun phan slad du //
analyzed: nyam chung dag gis mnyes par bgyid mi nus // sangs rgyas gnang nas 'gro kun phan slad du //
