analyzed: sangs rgyas la ni zhu ba zhu bar 'tshal //
translated: I will ask the Buddha, for the benefit of all beings.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod 'jug dang // 'jig rten rnam 'dren dag gi 'byung ba dang // snang dang nges 'byung rnam par sprul pa dang // dbang bskur ye shes yongs su zhu bar 'tshal //🔽theg mchog dam pa rtogs par khong chud cing //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod 'jug dang // 'jig rten rnam 'dren dag gi 'byung ba dang // snang dang nges 'byung rnam par sprul pa dang // dbang bskur ye shes yongs su zhu bar 'tshal // theg mchog dam pa rtogs par khong chud cing //
translated: And the consecration of their wisdom.🔽The assembly that has gathered is infinite and vast,

original: mtha' yas rgya che ba yi 'khor lhags dang // gang dag rgya chen chos don gnyer ba dag /
analyzed: mtha' yas rgya che ba yi 'khor lhags dang // gang dag rgya chen chos don gnyer ba dag /
translated: And those who seek the Dharma of the Great Vehicle,

original: de dag phan slad sangs rgyas la yang zhu //
analyzed: de dag phan slad sangs rgyas la yang zhu //

original: bdud kyi dkyil 'khor shin tu tshar @181a *//
analyzed: bdud kyi dkyil 'khor shin tu tshar @181a *//

original: gcad cing // sangs rgyas bstan pa 'di ni shin tu gzung //
analyzed: gcad cing // sangs rgyas bstan pa 'di ni shin tu gzung //
translated: To uphold the Buddha’s teachings,🔽And to destroy the maṇḍala of Māra.

original: bcom ldan phung po ma mchis dam chos mdzod //
analyzed: bcom ldan phung po ma mchis dam chos mdzod //
translated: Blessed One, treasury of the sacred Dharma,

original: lus can rnams la bshad pa'i dus 'di lags //
analyzed: lus can rnams la bshad pa'i dus 'di lags //

original: skyes bu khyu mchog mkhyen pa mtha' yas pas //
analyzed: skyes bu khyu mchog mkhyen pa mtha' yas pas //
translated: O bull among men, your wisdom is infinite,

original: bcom ldan de la bdag gi blo mi chud //
analyzed: bcom ldan de la bdag gi blo mi chud //
translated: Blessed One, my mind cannot comprehend it.

original: bde gshegs mkhyen pa shes pas mi dpog pas //
analyzed: bde gshegs mkhyen pa shes pas mi dpog pas //
translated: Sugata, your wisdom cannot be measured by the knowable.

original: mkhas pa yangs pa bdag ni zhu bar 'tshal //
analyzed: mkhas pa yangs pa bdag ni zhu bar 'tshal //
translated: I, the wise one, the vast one, wish to ask.🔽How is the knowledge and practice of the Bhagavān,

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen 'jug dang // ji ltar yun ring nas ni bslab pa dang // chos kyi dbang phyug rgyal po rab brlabs pa //
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi mkhyen 'jug dang // ji ltar yun ring nas ni bslab pa dang // chos kyi dbang phyug rgyal po rab brlabs pa //
translated: And how is it that for a long time he has trained🔽And been consecrated as the lord of the Dharma?

original: 'dren pa rnams kyi spyod yul bshad du gsol //🔽de nas byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal pos tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: 'dren pa rnams kyi spyod yul bshad du gsol // de nas byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal pos tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bcom ldan 'das la mngon par bstod nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Please explain the domain of the guides.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Dhāraṇīśvararāja, having praised the Bhagavān with these verses, said to the Bhagavān, “Bhagavān,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul ni /
translated: the domain of the tathāgatas

original: bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: is inconceivable,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul ni /
translated: and the domain of the bodhisattvas

original: tshad ma mchis te /
analyzed: tshad ma mchis te /
translated: is immeasurable.

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / bdag gis de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: yongs su mi skyo bar chos ston pa lags par rig cing /
analyzed: yongs su mi skyo bar chos ston pa lags par rig cing /
translated: I know that the Tathāgata teaches the Dharma without weariness,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: and the Tathāgata

original: sems can thams cad mi gtong ba'i thugs rje chen po la gnas par mthong nas don 'di zhu bar 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad mi gtong ba'i thugs rje chen po la gnas par mthong nas don 'di zhu bar 'tshal lo //
translated: I ask this on behalf of all sentient beings, in order to abide in great compassion that does not abandon any sentient being.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems @181b dpa' rnams kyi rgyan dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems @181b dpa' rnams kyi rgyan dag ni /

analyzed: gang lags / bcom ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa' rgyan gang dag gis brgyan na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na mdzes pa lags /

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / ji ltar na /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi snang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa thos nas gti mug gi mun pa dang bral zhing the tshom ma mchis pa dang / chos kyi sgo chen po shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa rnams lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi snang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa thos nas gti mug gi mun pa dang bral zhing the tshom ma mchis pa dang / chos kyi sgo chen po shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa rnams lags /
translated: how is it that bodhisattvas, having heard the inconceivable illumination of the Dharma, are free from the darkness of delusion and doubt, and have purified the great Dharma gateway?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: how is it that bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad kyi mi gtong pa'i snying rje chen po dang / snying rje chen po la gnas pa mchog dang ldan zhing sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong bar gnas pa rnams lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad kyi mi gtong pa'i snying rje chen po dang / snying rje chen po la gnas pa mchog dang ldan zhing sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong bar gnas pa rnams lags /
translated: what are the bodhisattvas’ great compassion and great mercy that never abandon any being, and that are the supreme support for those who abide in great compassion and never abandon any being?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / ji ltar na /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽how do bodhisattvas engage in the activities of bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ngag byang chub sems dpa'i las yang dag pa la zhugs pa dang / legs par bgyid pa'i las bgyid pa dang / las kyi mtha' gdung ba ma mchis pa rnams lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ngag byang chub sems dpa'i las yang dag pa la zhugs pa dang / legs par bgyid pa'i las bgyid pa dang / las kyi mtha' gdung ba ma mchis pa rnams lags /
translated: how do they perform good actions, and how do they avoid the extremes of action?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' bdud dang / phyir rgol ba bcom zhing the tshom dang bral nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yul la mngon du 'phags par 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: ci nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' bdud dang / phyir rgol ba bcom zhing the tshom dang bral nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yul la mngon du 'phags par 'gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: how do bodhisattvas conquer Māra and his adversaries, how do they become free from doubt, how do they enter the domain of the thus-gone ones, how do they master the domain of the bodhisattvas, and how do they understand the thoughts of all beings?

original: sems can thams cad kyi @182a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi @182a *//
translated: the knowledge of the mental activity of all sentient beings,

original: sems kyi spyod pa dag yongs su 'tshal bar 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams rnam par sbyong bar 'gyur ba dang / bdud kyi dkyil 'khor tshar gcod par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa yang dag par 'dzin par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod pa dag yongs su 'tshal bar 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams rnam par sbyong bar 'gyur ba dang / bdud kyi dkyil 'khor tshar gcod par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa yang dag par 'dzin par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: the purification of buddha realms, the destruction of the circles of Māra, the upholding of the teachings of the thus-gone ones,🔽and the swift attainment of mastery over all phenomena.

original: myur du chos thams cad la dbang ba thob par 'gyur bar de bzhin gshegs pas blo shin tu rnam par nges pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pas mngon par 'phags pa'i chos kyi sgo de legs par bshad du gsol /
analyzed: myur du chos thams cad la dbang ba thob par 'gyur bar de bzhin gshegs pas blo shin tu rnam par nges pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pas mngon par 'phags pa'i chos kyi sgo de legs par bshad du gsol /
translated: Thus-gone One, please explain the Dharma gateway that is superior through the bodhisattva conduct of the extremely discerning mind.”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When he had thus requested, the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Dhāraṇīśvara­rāja,

original: skyes bu dam pa; khyod legs so //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa; khyod legs so //
translated: “Excellent, excellent, O sublime being!

original: legs so // khyod ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul tshad med pa la rnam par nges pa thob nas khyod blo rnam par nges pa 'di lta bus de bzhin gshegs pa la don 'di 'dri bar sems pa ni /🔽skyes bu dam pa /
analyzed: legs so // khyod ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul tshad med pa la rnam par nges pa thob nas khyod blo rnam par nges pa 'di lta bus de bzhin gshegs pa la don 'di 'dri bar sems pa ni / skyes bu dam pa /
translated: In this way, you have attained certainty in the immeasurable domain of the thus-gone ones. With such certainty, you have thought to ask the Thus-Gone One about this topic.

original: khyod legs so //
analyzed: khyod legs so //
translated: Excellent, excellent, son of noble family!

original: de'i phyir rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs kyi bu /
translated: Therefore, son of noble family,

original: khyod shin tu legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar yon tan 'di dag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan tshad med pa gzhan dag kyang yongs @182b su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: khyod shin tu legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar yon tan 'di dag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan tshad med pa gzhan dag kyang yongs @182b su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: listen well and keep this in mind, for I will explain to you how bodhisattva great beings can perfect these qualities and other immeasurable bodhisattva qualities,

analyzed: myur du chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba thob par 'gyur ba ngas khyod la bshad do //
translated: and how they can swiftly attain mastery over all phenomena.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal pos bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal pos bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The bodhisattva Dhāraṇiśvara­rāja said to the Blessed One, “Excellent, Blessed One!

analyzed: legs so // zhes gsol te bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar nyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: “Excellent!” he replied, and listened as the Blessed One had instructed. The Blessed One said:

translated: It is the morality of the absence of corruption because it increases the wholesome dharmas. It is the morality of one’s own desire because it is the morality that goes where one wishes. It is the morality of self-mastery because it is the knowledge that is not dependent on others.

translated: The ornament of body, because it is the perfect ornament of the major and minor marks of excellence; the ornament of speech, because it acts in accordance with what it says; the ornament of mind, because it is free of defilements; the ornament of buddhafield, because it is the perfect fulfillment of aspirations;

translated: the ornament of bringing sentient beings to full maturity, because it purifies their intentions; the ornament of birth, because it does not engage in any evil; the ornament of bodhisattva conduct, because it is the training in the conduct of the tathagatas;

original: nga rgyal med pa'i phyir shes pa'i rgyan dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir byang chub kyi snying po'i rgyan dang / tshul khrims kyi rtsa ba la gnas pa mi 'dor ba'i phyir stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i rgyan te /

translated: the ornament of knowledge because of being free from pride, the ornament of the essence of enlightenment because of dedicating the roots of virtue, the ornament of the powers, fearlessnesses, and unshared qualities of a buddha because of not abandoning the foundation of morality.

analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' brjed pa med pa'i sems kyis snying rje chen po'i gnas la gnas te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' brjed pa med pa'i sems kyis snying rje chen po'i gnas la gnas te /
translated: here, with a mind free of forgetfulness, the bodhisattvas abide in the state of great compassion,

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong bar gnas @186a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong bar gnas @186a *//
translated: and, without abandoning any sentient being,

original: nas 'dod pa dag las dpen pa /
analyzed: nas 'dod pa dag las dpen pa /
translated: they abide in solitude from desires,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa /
translated: in solitude from nonvirtuous factors,

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa /
translated: and with conceptualization.

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: It is accompanied by investigation and analysis.

original: dpen pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: dpen pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: It is the first concentration that is fulfilled and abides in the joy and bliss born of seclusion.

original: de rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste /
analyzed: de rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste /
translated: Free from investigation and analysis, the mind becomes inwardly clear and fully focused.

original: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: It is the second concentration that is fulfilled and abides in the joy and bliss born of meditative stabilization, which is free from investigation and analysis.

original: de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas shing dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te /🔽bde ba lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa dang ldan pa /🔽bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas shing dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te / bde ba lus kyis myong la 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa dang ldan pa / bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o //
translated: Free from attachment to joy, one abides in equanimity, and with mindfulness and alertness,🔽one experiences physical bliss.

original: zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: The noble ones call this “abiding in mindfulness and equanimity with physical bliss.”

original: dga' ba med pa bsam gtan gsum pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: dga' ba med pa bsam gtan gsum pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: It is the third concentration that is fulfilled and abides without joy.

original: de bde ba'ang spangs te /
analyzed: de bde ba'ang spangs te /
translated: One abandons even that bliss

original: snga nas sdug bsngal ba'ang spangs shing yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba'ang nub pas bde ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: snga nas sdug bsngal ba'ang spangs shing yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba'ang nub pas bde ba'ang ma yin /
translated: He has abandoned previous suffering and the joy and sorrow of this life have subsided.

original: sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'ang ma yin pa /
translated: He is neither happy nor unhappy.

original: btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi ba rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi ba rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: He is in the fourth concentration, which is complete equanimity and mindfulness.🔽He has completely transcended all perceptions of form.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams @186b las yang dag par 'das te thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams @186b las yang dag par 'das te thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing /
translated: He has completely transcended all perceptions of obstruction.

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas /🔽nam mkha' mtha' yas so //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas / nam mkha' mtha' yas so //
translated: He does not think about various perceptions.🔽He thinks, “Space is infinite.”

original: snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mtshed rdzogs par byas te gnas so //🔽de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so //
analyzed: snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mtshed rdzogs par byas te gnas so // de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so //
translated: He is in the sphere of infinite space.🔽He has completely transcended the sphere of infinite space.🔽He thinks, “Consciousness is infinite.”

original: snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: He is in the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te ci'ang med do snyam nas ci'ang med pa'i skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so //🔽de rnam pa thams cad du ci'ang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te ci'ang med do snyam nas ci'ang med pa'i skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so // de rnam pa thams cad du ci'ang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: Having completely transcended the sphere of infinite consciousness, they think, “There is nothing at all,” and they abide in the perfection of the sphere of nothing whatsoever.🔽Having completely transcended the sphere of nothing whatsoever, they abide in the perfection of the sphere of neither perception nor nonperception.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug kyang thabs mkhas pas yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du'ang mi byed la sngon🔽gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis yang dag par gnas /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched las yang dag par 'das te 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug kyang thabs mkhas pas yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du'ang mi byed la sngon gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis yang dag par gnas /
translated: Having completely transcended the sphere of neither perception nor nonperception, they enter into the absorption of the cessation of perception and feeling.🔽However, through skillful means, they do not actualize the limit of reality, but they abide through the power of their previous aspirations.

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed pa ste /🔽ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyan ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed pa ste / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyan ni /
translated: They bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: dgu po 'di dag go /
analyzed: dgu po 'di dag go /
translated: These are the nine ornaments of meditative absorption.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems @187a *//🔽dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyan ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems @187a *// dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyan ni /
translated: the bodhisattvas’

original: bcu po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: bcu po 'di dag ste /
translated: ten ornaments of samādhi are as follows:

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are these ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:🔽a mind that is unwavering and certain,🔽the completion of śamatha,🔽the non-abandonment of striving,🔽the concealment of one’s samādhi,

original: mi 'khrugs pas nges par sems pa dang / zhi gnas yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / mngon par brtson pa mi 'dor ba dang / nang du yang dag 'jog sbed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams chud mi za ba dang / sems dben pa dang /
analyzed: mi 'khrugs pas nges par sems pa dang / zhi gnas yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / mngon par brtson pa mi 'dor ba dang / nang du yang dag 'jog sbed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams chud mi za ba dang / sems dben pa dang /
translated: the non-wastage of one’s roots of virtue,🔽the solitude of one’s mind,🔽the pliancy of one’s body,🔽the investigation, examination, and discernment of phenomena,

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / chos rnams la sems shing 'jal la so sor rtog pa dang / sems la dbang sgyur ba dang / 'phags pa'i rigs thob pa ste /
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / chos rnams la sems shing 'jal la so sor rtog pa dang / sems la dbang sgyur ba dang / 'phags pa'i rigs thob pa ste /
translated: the mastery of one’s mind,🔽and the attainment of the ārya family.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyan ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyan ni /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: bcu po 'di dag go /
analyzed: bcu po 'di dag go /
translated: these are the ten ornaments of the bodhisattvas’ samādhi.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan gang zhe na /
translated: what are the bodhisattvas’ ornaments of insight?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,🔽they are as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni /
translated: The ornaments of the bodhisattvas’ wisdom🔽are one.

original: gcig ste / gcig gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gcig ste / gcig gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What is that one?

original: chos thams cad la the tshom med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la the tshom med pa ste /
translated: It is the absence of doubt regarding all phenomena.

original: 'di ni / gcig go /
analyzed: 'di ni / gcig go /
translated: That is the one.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni /🔽gnyis po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni / gnyis po 'di dag ste /
translated: the ornaments of the bodhisattvas’ wisdom🔽are two.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are those two?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: 'gyod pa dang bral ba dang / kun nas ldang ba dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang bral ba dang / kun nas ldang ba dang bral ba ste /
translated: the absence of regret and the absence of agitation.

original: gnyis po 'di dag go /
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag go /
translated: Those are the two.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni /🔽gsum po @187b 'di dag ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni / gsum po @187b 'di dag ste /
translated: the ornaments of the bodhisattvas’ wisdom🔽are three.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are those three?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: gti mug spong ba dang / ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs nges par gcog pa dang / mun pa mun nag sel ba ste /
analyzed: gti mug spong ba dang / ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs nges par gcog pa dang / mun pa mun nag sel ba ste /
translated: the abandonment of delusion, the breaking of the eggshell of ignorance, and the dispelling of darkness.

original: gsum po 'di dag go /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag go /
translated: Those are the three.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni /
translated: the ornaments of the bodhisattvas’ wisdom

original: bzhi po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ste /
translated: are four.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are these four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba'i shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba spang ba'i snang ba dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon gsal dang / lam bsgom pa'i byin gyi rlabs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba'i shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba spang ba'i snang ba dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon gsal dang / lam bsgom pa'i byin gyi rlabs te /
translated: the knowledge that fully understands suffering, the illumination that abandons the origin of suffering, the illumination that actualizes cessation, and the blessing of cultivating the path.

original: bzhi po 'di dag go /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag go /
translated: These are the four.

original: rigs kyi bu; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni /🔽lnga po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni / lnga po 'di dag ste /
translated: “Son of noble family, there are five ornaments of the bodhisattvas’ wisdom.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are these five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dmigs pa med pas tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su dag pa dang / shes rab mchog gis bsam gtan pa yin pas ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po yongs su dag pa dang / gnyis dang bral bas rnam par grol ba'i phung po yongs su dag pa dang /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pas tshul khrims kyi phung po yongs su dag pa dang / shes rab mchog gis bsam gtan pa yin pas ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po yongs su dag pa dang / gnyis dang bral bas rnam par grol ba'i phung po yongs su dag pa dang /
translated: the purity of the aggregate of discipline due to the absence of reference points, the purity of the aggregate of concentration due to the supreme wisdom of meditation, the purity of the aggregate of liberation due to the absence of duality, the purity of the aggregate of wisdom due to the absence of conceptualization, and the purity of the aggregate of the wisdom of liberation due to the absence of the afflictions.

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid pas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po yongs su dag pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid pas chos kyi phung po yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid pas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po yongs su dag pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid pas chos kyi phung po yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The aggregate of seeing the wisdom of liberation is purified by the equality of the three times. The aggregate of phenomena is purified by the nature of being free from desire.

original: lnga po 'di dag go /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag go /
translated: These are the five.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni /
translated: The ornaments of the bodhisattvas’ wisdom

original: drug po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: drug po 'di dag ste /
translated: are these six:

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽'khor gsum @188a *//
analyzed: 'di lta ste / 'khor gsum @188a *//
translated: They are as follows:

original: yongs su dag pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of generosity, which is completely pure of the three spheres,

original: sgyu ma dang mnyam pa nyid pas bdag gi 'khor yongs su dag pa dang / rmi lam dang mnyam pa nyid pas sems can gyi 'khor yongs su dag pa dang / rnam par smin pa la re ba med pas byang chub kyi 'khor yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang mnyam pa nyid pas bdag gi 'khor yongs su dag pa dang / rmi lam dang mnyam pa nyid pas sems can gyi 'khor yongs su dag pa dang / rnam par smin pa la re ba med pas byang chub kyi 'khor yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: is purified of the sphere of the self by being equal to an illusion, purified of the sphere of sentient beings by being equal to a dream, and purified of the sphere of awakening by not hoping for karmic ripening.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of discipline, which is completely pure of the three spheres,

original: gzugs brnyan lta bu'i phyir lus kyi 'khor yongs su dag pa dang / brag ca lta bu'i shes pas ngag gi 'khor yongs su dag pa dang / sgyu ma dang mnyam pa nyid pas sems kyi 'khor yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan lta bu'i phyir lus kyi 'khor yongs su dag pa dang / brag ca lta bu'i shes pas ngag gi 'khor yongs su dag pa dang / sgyu ma dang mnyam pa nyid pas sems kyi 'khor yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of the retinue of the body is due to the fact that it is like a reflection. The purity of the retinue of speech is due to the fact that it is like an echo. The purity of the retinue of mind is due to the fact that it is like a magical creation.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of patience with regard to the three spheres is threefold:

original: nyes par smras pa'i tshig rnams la khong khro ba spong ba yongs su dag pa dang / bstod pa dang / bsngags pa dang / rjes su chags pa spong ba yongs su dag pa dang / yan lag dang nying lag gcod pa dag la chos kyi sku la rab tu rtog pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: nyes par smras pa'i tshig rnams la khong khro ba spong ba yongs su dag pa dang / bstod pa dang / bsngags pa dang / rjes su chags pa spong ba yongs su dag pa dang / yan lag dang nying lag gcod pa dag la chos kyi sku la rab tu rtog pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: the purity of the abandonment of anger at offensive words; the purity of the abandonment of attachment to praise, fame, and flattery; and the purity of the realization of the Dharma Body in the cutting off of the major and minor limbs.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of effort with regard to the three spheres is threefold:

original: 'khor ba rmi lam lta bur mos pas yongs su mi skyo ba yongs su dag pa dang / rdo rje lta bu'i bsam pas bstan pa yongs su dag pa dang / mtshan ma thams cad las sgrol bas blang ba med pa @188b dang / dor ba med pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba rmi lam lta bur mos pas yongs su mi skyo ba yongs su dag pa dang / rdo rje lta bu'i bsam pas bstan pa yongs su dag pa dang / mtshan ma thams cad las sgrol bas blang ba med pa @188b dang / dor ba med pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of non-appropriation and non-rejection is due to the deliverance from all signs.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of meditation is purified of the three spheres.

original: 'gyur par shes pas de la ma chags pa yongs su dag pa dang / mngon par zhen pa med pas lhag mthong yongs su dag pa dang / mngon par shes pa skyed pas dmigs pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur par shes pas de la ma chags pa yongs su dag pa dang / mngon par zhen pa med pas lhag mthong yongs su dag pa dang / mngon par shes pa skyed pas dmigs pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of non-attachment is due to the knowledge of change. The purity of insight is due to the absence of clinging. The purity of the object is due to the production of superknowledge.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of means is purified of the three spheres.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pas bsdu ba'i dngos po yongs su dag pa dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pas gzungs yongs su dag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan gyi phyir smon lam yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pas bsdu ba'i dngos po yongs su dag pa dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pas gzungs yongs su dag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan gyi phyir smon lam yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The purity of the means of attracting disciples through bringing sentient beings to full maturity, the purity of the dhāraṇīs through upholding the sublime Dharma, and the purity of aspirations for the adornment of the buddhafields.

original: drug po 'di dag go /
analyzed: drug po 'di dag go /
translated: These are the six.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni /
translated: the bodhisattvas’ ornaments of wisdom

original: bdun po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: bdun po 'di dag ste /
translated: are sevenfold.

original: bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la dran pa med cing yid la byed pa med pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams la skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyis lus dang sems dben pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la dran pa med cing yid la byed pa med pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams la skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par shes pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyis lus dang sems dben pa dang /
translated: The absence of recollection and attention with regard to the applications of mindfulness, the knowledge that the correct exertions are unborn and unceasing, the isolation of body and mind through the bases of miraculous power,

original: dbang po rnams la dbang po yongs su shes pa dang / stobs rnams kyis bdud dang nyon mongs pa thams cad tshar gcod pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyis chos thams cad kyi ngo bo @189a *//
analyzed: dbang po rnams la dbang po yongs su shes pa dang / stobs rnams kyis bdud dang nyon mongs pa thams cad tshar gcod pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyis chos thams cad kyi ngo bo @189a *//
translated: It is to know the faculties. It is to destroy all demons and afflictions through the powers. It is to know all phenomena through the branches of awakening.🔽

original: nyid dang / lam rnams la 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med par shes pa ste /🔽bdun po 'di dag go /
analyzed: nyid dang / lam rnams la 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med par shes pa ste / bdun po 'di dag go /
translated: It is to know the faculties with regard to the faculties. It is to destroy all the māras and afflictions with the powers. It is to know the nature of all phenomena with the branches of awakening. It is to know that all paths and all phenomena are neither coming nor going.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni /🔽brgyad po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni / brgyad po 'di dag ste /
translated: there are eight ornaments of the bodhisattvas’ wisdom.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are these eight?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: shin tu zhi ba'i phyir zhi gnas shes pa dang / rab rib dang bral ba'i phyir lhag mthong shes pa dang / chos kyi phung po rjes su rtogs pa'i phyir phung po shes pa dang / nam mkha'i khams dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir khams shes pa dang /
analyzed: shin tu zhi ba'i phyir zhi gnas shes pa dang / rab rib dang bral ba'i phyir lhag mthong shes pa dang / chos kyi phung po rjes su rtogs pa'i phyir phung po shes pa dang / nam mkha'i khams dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir khams shes pa dang /
translated: It is to know tranquility because of complete peace. It is to know insight because of being free from cataracts. It is to know the aggregates because of realizing the aggregates of Dharma. It is to know the elements because of being the same as the element of space.

original: grong stong dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir skye mched shes pa dang / bdag med pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar shes pa dang / mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir bden pa shes pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu rtogs pas chos thams cad nges par rtogs pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: grong stong dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir skye mched shes pa dang / bdag med pa'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar shes pa dang / mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir bden pa shes pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu rtogs pas chos thams cad nges par rtogs pa shes pa ste /
translated: the knowledge of the sense-sources, because of their equality with an empty town; the knowledge of dependent origination, because of selflessness; the knowledge of the truths, because of imperturbability; and the knowledge of the ascertainment of all phenomena, because of the realization of the way things really are.

original: brgyad po 'di dag go /
analyzed: brgyad po 'di dag go /
translated: These are the eight.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni /
translated: the bodhisattvas’ ornaments of wisdom

original: dgu po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: dgu po 'di dag ste /
translated: are these nine:

original: dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: sngon gyi mtha' dag pas 'das pa shes pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dag pas ma 'ongs pa shes pa dang / bar gyi mtha' dag pas da ltar byung ba shes pa dang / rgyu chud mi za bas nges pa rnams shes pa dang / rkyen nye bar sgrub pas ma nges pa rnams shes pa dang /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dag pas 'das pa shes pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dag pas ma 'ongs pa shes pa dang / bar gyi mtha' dag pas da ltar byung ba shes pa dang / rgyu chud mi za bas nges pa rnams shes pa dang / rkyen nye bar sgrub pas ma nges pa rnams shes pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of the past through the purity of the past, the knowledge of the future through the purity of the future, the knowledge of the present through the purity of the present, the knowledge of the certain through the non-wastage of causes, the knowledge of the uncertain through the establishment of conditions,

original: yongs su smin par byed pas log pa @189b nyid du nges pa rnams shes pa dang / chos kyi skus rab tu phye ba'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos kyi phyir chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang /
analyzed: yongs su smin par byed pas log pa @189b nyid du nges pa rnams shes pa dang / chos kyi skus rab tu phye ba'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos kyi phyir chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes pa dang /
translated: understanding that all phenomena are the same because they are distinguished by the absence of characteristics,🔽understanding that all phenomena are the same because they are distinguished by the absence of conceptualization,🔽understanding that all phenomena are the same because they are distinguished by the absence of mental engagement,

original: 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir 'phags pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes pa ste /🔽dgu po 'di dag go /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir 'phags pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes pa ste / dgu po 'di dag go /
translated: and understanding that all phenomena are the same because they are distinguished by the absence of arising.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni /🔽bcu po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi rgyan ni / bcu po 'di dag ste /
translated: there are ten ornaments of the bodhisattvas’ wisdom:

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are these ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rnam par sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir sgyu ma lta bur shes pa dang / yongs su rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir rmi lam lta bur shes pa dang / rnam par 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir smig rgyu lta bur shes pa dang / 'pho ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir gzugs brnyan lta bur shes pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir sgyu ma lta bur shes pa dang / yongs su rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir rmi lam lta bur shes pa dang / rnam par 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir smig rgyu lta bur shes pa dang / 'pho ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir gzugs brnyan lta bur shes pa dang /
translated: The knowledge that it is like an illusion because of the characteristic of creation, the knowledge that it is like a dream because of the characteristic of imagination, the knowledge that it is like a mirage because of the characteristic of delusion, the knowledge that it is like a reflection because of the characteristic of non-transmigration,

original: 'du 'phrod kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir mig yor lta bur shes pa dang / rkyen gyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir brag ca lta bur shes pa dang / chos kyi dbyings 'dres pa med pa'i mtshan nyid du shes pa dang / de bzhin nyid gnas med pa'i mtshan nyid du shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'du 'phrod kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir mig yor lta bur shes pa dang / rkyen gyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir brag ca lta bur shes pa dang / chos kyi dbyings 'dres pa med pa'i mtshan nyid du shes pa dang / de bzhin nyid gnas med pa'i mtshan nyid du shes pa dang /
translated: the knowledge that it is like an optical illusion because of the characteristic of the combination of conditions, the knowledge that it is like an echo because of the characteristic of conditions, the knowledge that the realm of phenomena is characterized by the absence of mixture, the knowledge that suchness is characterized by the absence of a basis,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' mi 'khrugs pa'i mtshan nyid du shes pa dang / 'dus byas dag 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid du shes pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' mi 'khrugs pa'i mtshan nyid du shes pa dang / 'dus byas dag 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid du shes pa ste /
translated: the knowledge that the limit of reality is characterized by the absence of disturbance, and the knowledge that the conditioned is characterized by the unconditioned.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin du byed pa dang / bden pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i tshig rab tu thob pa dang / nga rgyal med pas gzung bar 'os pa'i tshig dang / g-yo med pas blang bar 'os pa'i tshig dang / snying rje chen po la sbyor bas 'bras bu yod pa'i chos ston pa dang /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin du byed pa dang / bden pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i tshig rab tu thob pa dang / nga rgyal med pas gzung bar 'os pa'i tshig dang / g-yo med pas blang bar 'os pa'i tshig dang / snying rje chen po la sbyor bas 'bras bu yod pa'i chos ston pa dang /
translated: acting in accordance with one’s words, attaining words that accord with the truth, being worthy of being heeded due to one’s lack of pride, being worthy of being accepted due to one’s lack of deceit, teaching the Dharma with results due to one’s application of great compassion,

analyzed: snod la mkhas pas phyed par chos ston pa dang / 'jig rten shes pas dus su chos ston pa ste /
translated: teaching the Dharma in a timely manner due to one’s knowledge of the world, and teaching the Dharma in a way that is appropriate due to one’s skill in knowing the vessels.

analyzed: dgu po 'di dag ste /
translated: the bodhisattvas’ nine ornaments of retention are as follows:

original: dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'khor gyi nang du spa gong ba med pa dang / smra ba'i nang du zhum pa med pa dang / chos bshad pa'i nang du 'jigs pa med pa dang / 'dri ba rnams la nges par 'byung ba shes pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams la snrel zhi bstan pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du spa gong ba med pa dang / smra ba'i nang du zhum pa med pa dang / chos bshad pa'i nang du 'jigs pa med pa dang / 'dri ba rnams la nges par 'byung ba shes pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams la snrel zhi bstan pa shes pa dang /
translated: not being overwhelmed in the midst of an assembly, not being timid in the midst of speech, not being afraid in the midst of teaching the Dharma, knowing how to answer questions, knowing how to teach the Dharma in a way that is appropriate for those who are arrogant,

original: yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la rjes su mthun pa bstan pa shes pa dang / khengs pa dag la lag na rdo rje ston pa dang / mngon par chags pa rnams la sreg pa'i bskal pa ston pa dang / yongs su smin pa rnams la theg pa'i rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la rjes su mthun pa bstan pa shes pa dang / khengs pa dag la lag na rdo rje ston pa dang / mngon par chags pa rnams la sreg pa'i bskal pa ston pa dang / yongs su smin pa rnams la theg pa'i rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa ste /
translated: knowing how to teach the Dharma in a way that is appropriate for those who are humble, showing Vajrapāṇi to the proud, showing the fire at the end of the eon to those who are attached, and showing the stages of the vehicles in accordance with the level of maturity of those to be trained.

original: dgu po 'di dag go /
analyzed: dgu po 'di dag go /
translated: These are the nine.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,
