analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bden pa sgom pa gang gis nges par gyur pa la 'jug pa de la de'i snang ba dang / bden pa sgom pa gang gis 'bras bu dang po thob par 'gyur ba de la de'i snang ba dang / bden pa sgom pa gang gis 'bras bu gnyis pa thob par 'gyur ba de la de'i snang ba dang /🔽bden pa sgom pa gang gis 'bras bu gsum pa thob par 'gyur ba de la de'i snang ba dang / bden pa sgom pa gang gis 'bras bu bzhi pa thob par 'gyur ba de la de'i snang ba dang / bden pa sgom pa gang gis rang sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ba de la de'i snang ba dang /
analyzed: bden pa sgom pa gang gis nges par gyur pa la 'jug pa de la de'i snang ba dang / bden pa sgom pa gang gis 'bras bu dang po thob par 'gyur ba de la de'i snang ba dang / bden pa sgom pa gang gis 'bras bu gnyis pa thob par 'gyur ba de la de'i snang ba dang / bden pa sgom pa gang gis 'bras bu gsum pa thob par 'gyur ba de la de'i snang ba dang / bden pa sgom pa gang gis 'bras bu bzhi pa thob par 'gyur ba de la de'i snang ba dang / bden pa sgom pa gang gis rang sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ba de la de'i snang ba dang /
translated: The light of the truth that is cultivated by those who enter the certainty of the path, the light of the truth that is cultivated by those who attain the first fruition, the light of the truth that is cultivated by those who attain the second fruition,🔽the light of the truth that is cultivated by those who attain the third fruition, the light of the truth that is cultivated by those who attain the fourth fruition, the light of the truth that is cultivated by those who attain the state of a pratyekabuddha,

original: bden pa sgom pa gang gis byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa rab tu thob par 'gyur ba de la de'i snang ba dang / bden pa sgom pa gang gis sangs rgyas @198a *//
analyzed: bden pa sgom pa gang gis byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa rab tu thob par 'gyur ba de la de'i snang ba dang / bden pa sgom pa gang gis sangs rgyas @198a *//
translated: the light of the truth that is cultivated by those who attain the acceptance of bodhisattvas, and the light of the truth that is cultivated by those who attain buddhahood.

original: kyi byang chub mngon par rdzogs pa 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de la de'i snang ba ste /
analyzed: kyi byang chub mngon par rdzogs pa 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de la de'i snang ba ste /
translated: The light of the bodhisattvas’ wisdom is the light of the bodhisattvas’ wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bden pa'i snang ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bden pa'i snang ba ni /
translated: the bodhisattvas’ light of truth

original: brgyad po 'di dag go /
analyzed: brgyad po 'di dag go /
translated: consists of eight aspects.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa'i snang ba ni /🔽brgyad po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa'i snang ba ni / brgyad po 'di dag ste /
translated: the bodhisattvas’ light of superknowledge🔽consists of eight aspects.

original: brgyad gang zhe na; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na; 'di lta ste /
translated: What are these eight?

original: lha'i mig gis gzugs thams cad yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir gsal ba'i snang ba dang / lha'i rna bas sgra thams cad thos pa'i phyir nges par rtog pa'i snang ba dang / sngon gyi gnas bskal ba grangs med pa rjes su dran pa'i phyir rjes su dran pa'i snang ba dang /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis gzugs thams cad yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir gsal ba'i snang ba dang / lha'i rna bas sgra thams cad thos pa'i phyir nges par rtog pa'i snang ba dang / sngon gyi gnas bskal ba grangs med pa rjes su dran pa'i phyir rjes su dran pa'i snang ba dang /
translated: The light of clarity, because all forms are seen with the divine eye; the light of ascertainment, because all sounds are heard with the divine ear; the light of recollection, because one recollects the past abodes of countless eons;

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems la lta ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i snang ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtha' yas par rdzu 'phrul gyis 'gro ba'i phyir nam mkha' sgrib pa med pa'i snang ba dang / zag pa med pa'i shes pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir shes pa'i snang ba dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems la lta ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i snang ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtha' yas par rdzu 'phrul gyis 'gro ba'i phyir nam mkha' sgrib pa med pa'i snang ba dang / zag pa med pa'i shes pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir shes pa'i snang ba dang /
translated: the appearance of knowledge in order to perfect untainted knowledge,

original: sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi snang ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi dogs pa gcod pa'i phyir ye shes kyi tshogs kyi snang ba ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba'i phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi snang ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi dogs pa gcod pa'i phyir ye shes kyi tshogs kyi snang ba ste /
translated: the appearance of the accumulation of merit in order to sustain all sentient beings, and the appearance of the accumulation of wisdom in order to cut through the doubts of all sentient beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi @198b mngon par shes pa'i snang ba ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi @198b mngon par shes pa'i snang ba ni /
translated: “Noble son,🔽the bodhisattvas’ eight appearances of superknowledge

original: brgyad po 'di dag go /
analyzed: brgyad po 'di dag go /
translated: are as follows.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrub pa'i snang ba ni /🔽dgu po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrub pa'i snang ba ni / dgu po 'di dag ste /
translated: the bodhisattvas’ nine appearances of accomplishment🔽are as follows.

original: dgu gang zhe na; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dgu gang zhe na; 'di lta ste /
translated: What are these nine?

original: sgrub pas ye shes kyi snang ba dang / sgrub pas shes rab kyi snang ba dang / sgrub pas blo'i snang ba dang / sgrub pas yang dag pa'i lta ba'i snang ba dang / sgrub pas zhi gnas kyi snang ba dang / sgrub pas lhag mthong gi snang ba dang /
analyzed: sgrub pas ye shes kyi snang ba dang / sgrub pas shes rab kyi snang ba dang / sgrub pas blo'i snang ba dang / sgrub pas yang dag pa'i lta ba'i snang ba dang / sgrub pas zhi gnas kyi snang ba dang / sgrub pas lhag mthong gi snang ba dang /
translated: the appearance of wisdom through accomplishment, the appearance of insight through accomplishment, the appearance of intelligence through accomplishment, the appearance of the correct view through accomplishment, the appearance of śamatha through accomplishment, the appearance of vipaśyanā through accomplishment,

original: sgrub pas sems can gyi bsam pa'i snang ba dang / sgrub pas 'khrugs pa med par sems rnam par grol ba'i snang ba dang / sgrub pas shin tu mthar thug pa'i snang ba snang ba ste /
analyzed: sgrub pas sems can gyi bsam pa'i snang ba dang / sgrub pas 'khrugs pa med par sems rnam par grol ba'i snang ba dang / sgrub pas shin tu mthar thug pa'i snang ba snang ba ste /
translated: the appearance of the thoughts of sentient beings through accomplishment, the appearance of the mind liberated from disturbance through accomplishment, and the appearance of the ultimate through accomplishment.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrub pa'i snang ba ni; dgu po 'di dag go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrub pa'i snang ba ni; dgu po 'di dag go /
translated: these are the nine appearances of accomplishment for bodhisattvas.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses:

original: dran pa de dang yang dag 'dres pa ni //
analyzed: dran pa de dang yang dag 'dres pa ni //
translated: “Those who are fully absorbed in mindfulness

original: sngon chad las dge bsags pa chud mi gzon //
analyzed: sngon chad las dge bsags pa chud mi gzon //
translated: will not waste the previously accumulated roots of virtue.

original: phra bar bsngo ba phun sum tshogs pa ste //
analyzed: phra bar bsngo ba phun sum tshogs pa ste //
translated: They will be fully absorbed in the subtle dedication

original: phyi phyir zhing ni yang dag sgrub par byed //
analyzed: phyi phyir zhing ni yang dag sgrub par byed //
translated: And they will practice them more and more.

original: thos pa'i chos rnams la ni brjed pa med //
analyzed: thos pa'i chos rnams la ni brjed pa med //
translated: They will not forget the teachings they have heard.

original: rnam par nges pa myur du thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam par nges pa myur du thob par 'gyur //
translated: They will quickly attain certainty.

original: nye bar zhi bas yul rnams las ni sbas //
analyzed: nye bar zhi bas yul rnams las ni sbas //
translated: They will be hidden from objects by means of tranquility.

original: dran dang ldan pa mi dge rnams dang bral //
analyzed: dran dang ldan pa mi dge rnams dang bral //
translated: They will be mindful and free from nonvirtue.

original: dran pa rgya bo che ni shin tu bsags //
analyzed: dran pa rgya bo che ni shin tu bsags //
translated: They will gather the vast and great mindfulness.

original: bya @199a *// ba bya ba dag ni rnam par 'byed //
analyzed: bya @199a *// ba bya ba dag ni rnam par 'byed //
translated: They will distinguish between what should and should not be done.

original: dran pa dag dang ldan par rig nas ni //
analyzed: dran pa dag dang ldan par rig nas ni //
translated: Knowing that they are endowed with mindfulness,

original: rgyal ba rang byung dag gi byin gyis rlob //
analyzed: rgyal ba rang byung dag gi byin gyis rlob //
translated: The victorious self-arisen ones will bless them.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi grong khyer skyong byed pa //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi grong khyer skyong byed pa //
translated: They will protect the city of the sublime Dharma

original: de ni 'gro ba rnams la chos ston nus //
analyzed: de ni 'gro ba rnams la chos ston nus //
translated: And will be able to teach the Dharma to beings.

original: shes rab ldan pa mun pa rnam bral te //
analyzed: shes rab ldan pa mun pa rnam bral te //
translated: The wise are free from darkness

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ni don kyang byed //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ni don kyang byed //
translated: And will benefit gods and humans.

original: blo gros bzang ldan snang ba thob gyur nas //
analyzed: blo gros bzang ldan snang ba thob gyur nas //
translated: Endowed with good intelligence, they will attain illumination

original: dogs pa dang ni the tshom rnams kyang gcod //
analyzed: dogs pa dang ni the tshom rnams kyang gcod //
translated: And will cut through doubts and hesitation.

original: dran dang ldan pa rang byung ye shes kyis //
analyzed: dran dang ldan pa rang byung ye shes kyis //
translated: The mindful ones, through self-arisen wisdom,

original: byang chub myur du rjes su rtogs par byed //
analyzed: byang chub myur du rjes su rtogs par byed //
translated: And quickly realize enlightenment.

original: de ni don gyi blo gros can yin gyi //
analyzed: de ni don gyi blo gros can yin gyi //
translated: They have the intelligence of meaning,

original: tshig 'bru'i rjes su mi rgyug sgra la'ang min //
analyzed: tshig 'bru'i rjes su mi rgyug sgra la'ang min //
translated: Not pursuing words or sounds.

original: sems can dag pa ye shes blo gros can //
analyzed: sems can dag pa ye shes blo gros can //
translated: Pure beings with the intelligence of wisdom🔽Do not desire the intelligence of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i blo gros 'dod ma yin; ;chos kyi blo gros ldan par gyur pa de //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i blo gros 'dod ma yin; ;chos kyi blo gros ldan par gyur pa de //
translated: Those who have the intelligence of the Dharma

original: nyon mongs blo gros sel cing gti mug bral //
analyzed: nyon mongs blo gros sel cing gti mug bral //
translated: Eliminate the intelligence of afflictions and are free from delusion.

original: shes rab dang ni thabs kyi tshul shes pa //
analyzed: shes rab dang ni thabs kyi tshul shes pa //
translated: Knowing the way of wisdom and methods,

original: de ni rgyal ba'i byang chub 'gal mi byed //
analyzed: de ni rgyal ba'i byang chub 'gal mi byed //
translated: They do not contradict the enlightenment of the Victorious Ones.

original: de ni sangs rgyas 'gyur ba'i blo gros ldan //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas 'gyur ba'i blo gros ldan //
translated: They have the intelligence that will become a Buddha,

original: nyan thos 'gyur min rang rgyal 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: nyan thos 'gyur min rang rgyal 'gyur ma yin //
translated: Not the intelligence of a Hearer or a Solitary Realizer.

original: rtag tu rlabs chen blo gros can yin gyi //
analyzed: rtag tu rlabs chen blo gros can yin gyi //
translated: They always have vast intelligence,

original: de ni blo gros chung du 'dod ma yin //
analyzed: de ni blo gros chung du 'dod ma yin //
translated: Not the intelligence of the Lesser Vehicle.

original: sangs rgyas blo gros rtag tu ldan yin gyi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas blo gros rtag tu ldan yin gyi //
translated: They always have the intelligence of a Buddha,

original: bdud kyi blo gros su ni 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: bdud kyi blo gros su ni 'gyur ma yin //
translated: Not the intelligence of a demon.

original: blo gros ldan pa snying rje cher gzhol gyi //
analyzed: blo gros ldan pa snying rje cher gzhol gyi //
translated: The intelligent ones are devoted to great compassion,

original: @199b sems can gang la'ang rnam par 'tshe ba min //
analyzed: @199b sems can gang la'ang rnam par 'tshe ba min //
translated: And they do not harm any being.

original: chos 'ga' bstan pa gang yin de la ni //🔽the tshom med cing rtogs par khong du chud //
analyzed: chos 'ga' bstan pa gang yin de la ni // the tshom med cing rtogs par khong du chud //
translated: Whatever teachings they have been given,🔽They understand them without doubt.

original: de ni dgongs te gsungs la mkhas 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de ni dgongs te gsungs la mkhas 'gyur zhing //
translated: They are skilled in the teachings that are intentional,

original: sems can spyod pa rnams la rtogs dang ldan //
analyzed: sems can spyod pa rnams la rtogs dang ldan //
translated: And they understand the conduct of beings.

original: so so yang dag rig la rtogs ldan zhing //
analyzed: so so yang dag rig la rtogs ldan zhing //
translated: They understand the different kinds of knowledge,

original: de yi shes pa 'jug pa chags pa med //🔽rkyen byung byed pa po dang rnam bral bar //🔽rten pa'i chos rnams dag ni rab tu shes //
analyzed: de yi shes pa 'jug pa chags pa med // rkyen byung byed pa po dang rnam bral bar // rten pa'i chos rnams dag ni rab tu shes //
translated: And their knowledge is unimpeded.🔽They know the dependent phenomena🔽That arise from conditions and are free of an agent.

original: de ni snrel zhi'i rgyu la mkhas gyur cing //
analyzed: de ni snrel zhi'i rgyu la mkhas gyur cing //
translated: They are skilled in the causes of the inverted,

original: spyi'u tshugs tshul ni rtogs par khong du chud //
analyzed: spyi'u tshugs tshul ni rtogs par khong du chud //
translated: And they understand the inverted way of the world.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ni chos rnams ji snyed pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ni chos rnams ji snyed pa //
translated: They understand all the teachings of the Buddha

original: thams cad kyang ni rtogs par khong du chud //
analyzed: thams cad kyang ni rtogs par khong du chud //
translated: And they understand all the teachings of the non-Buddhists.

original: 'jig rten pa yi chos kyi snang ba yis //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi chos kyi snang ba yis //
translated: Through the light of the teachings of the world,

original: lha mi rnams kyi las kyi bya ba shes //
analyzed: lha mi rnams kyi las kyi bya ba shes //
translated: They know the actions of gods and humans.

original: 'jig rten las ni 'das pa'i ye shes kyis //
analyzed: 'jig rten las ni 'das pa'i ye shes kyis //
translated: Through the supramundane wisdom

original: shes rab snang ba dang ni ldan pa yin //
analyzed: shes rab snang ba dang ni ldan pa yin //
translated: And is endowed with the light of wisdom.

original: kha na ma thor bcas dang ma tho med //
analyzed: kha na ma thor bcas dang ma tho med //
translated: With and without fault,

original: ye shes rab tu gsal ba chen po 'jug /
analyzed: ye shes rab tu gsal ba chen po 'jug /
translated: The great light of wisdom shines.

original: lam ni shin tu bsgoms par gyur pa'i phyir //
analyzed: lam ni shin tu bsgoms par gyur pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the path has been well cultivated,

original: rtag tu 'bras bu yod par chos ston to //🔽zag par bcas dang zag pa med pa yi //
analyzed: rtag tu 'bras bu yod par chos ston to // zag par bcas dang zag pa med pa yi //
translated: The Dharma is always taught with results.🔽The light of that wisdom shines

original: chos la de yi snang ba rab tu 'jug /
analyzed: chos la de yi snang ba rab tu 'jug /
translated: On dharmas with and without outflows.

original: de ni zag pa thams cad spong byed cing //
analyzed: de ni zag pa thams cad spong byed cing //
translated: It abandons all outflows

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ni don kyang byed //🔽'dus ma byas dang 'dus byas chos rnams la //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ni don kyang byed // 'dus ma byas dang 'dus byas chos rnams la //
translated: And benefits gods and humans.🔽Its knowledge always shines

original: de yi shes pa rtag tu rab tu 'jug /
analyzed: de yi shes pa rtag tu rab tu 'jug /
translated: On conditioned and unconditioned dharmas.

original: @200a *// de ni de yis dri bral rab rib med //
analyzed: @200a *// de ni de yis dri bral rab rib med //
translated: Free of stains and cataracts,

original: skyon med thob nas spyad pa rnams kyang spyod //🔽rnam par byang dang kun nas nyon mongs pa //
analyzed: skyon med thob nas spyad pa rnams kyang spyod // rnam par byang dang kun nas nyon mongs pa //
translated: Having attained the faultless, it engages in conduct.

original: de yi shes pa sgrib pa med pa 'jug /
analyzed: de yi shes pa sgrib pa med pa 'jug /
translated: Its knowledge engages without obscuration🔽In purification and affliction.🔽The mind is luminous by nature,

original: rang bzhin gyis ni sems 'od gsal ba dang // kun nas nyon mongs pa yi tshul yang shes //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni sems 'od gsal ba dang // kun nas nyon mongs pa yi tshul yang shes //
translated: And it knows the way of affliction.

original: ji ltar mya ngan 'das par gyur pa ni; ;skye ba med cing 'byung ba med par shes //🔽'di 'dra 'di ni theg pa chen po la //
analyzed: ji ltar mya ngan 'das par gyur pa ni; ;skye ba med cing 'byung ba med par shes // 'di 'dra 'di ni theg pa chen po la //
translated: Knows that there is no birth and no origination.🔽This is the infinite illumination of the Dharma

original: chos kyi snang ba mtha' yas gyur pa yin //
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba mtha' yas gyur pa yin //
translated: In the Great Vehicle.🔽“It is the knowledge of the eighth,🔽The knowledge that enters into the stream,🔽The knowledge of the once-returner,🔽The knowledge that enters into the nonreturner,

original: de ni brgyad pa yi ni shes pa dang // rgyun du zhugs la shes pa 'jug pa dang // lan gcig phyir 'ong ba yi shes pa dang // phyir mi 'ong la shes pa 'jug pa dang // de ni dgra bcom pa dang rang rgyal dang //
analyzed: de ni brgyad pa yi ni shes pa dang // rgyun du zhugs la shes pa 'jug pa dang // lan gcig phyir 'ong ba yi shes pa dang // phyir mi 'ong la shes pa 'jug pa dang // de ni dgra bcom pa dang rang rgyal dang //
translated: “The knowledge of the arhat and the pratyekabuddha,

original: 'jig rten mgon po byang chub sems dpa' dag /
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po byang chub sems dpa' dag /
translated: And of the bodhisattvas, the lords of the world,

original: kun la de yi shes dang sgrub pa rnams //
analyzed: kun la de yi shes dang sgrub pa rnams //
translated: All of their knowledge and practice

original: lhag ma lus pa med par rab tu 'jug /
analyzed: lhag ma lus pa med par rab tu 'jug /
translated: Enter into it without remainder.🔽“The one who has attained the result,

original: gang gis 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba dang // 'khrugs med don dam nges par 'byung 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang gis 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba dang // 'khrugs med don dam nges par 'byung 'gyur ba //
translated: Who has the ultimate, unshakable certainty of deliverance,

original: de la rab bsgoms smra ba dpa' bo rnams //
analyzed: de la rab bsgoms smra ba dpa' bo rnams //
translated: The one who has meditated on that

original: bden pa'i snang ba dag dang ldan pa yin //
analyzed: bden pa'i snang ba dag dang ldan pa yin //
translated: Is a hero of speech who possesses the light of the truth.

original: bden pa dag ni sgom pa byas pas na //
analyzed: bden pa dag ni sgom pa byas pas na //
translated: “The one who has meditated on the truths

original: skyon med 'jug dang 'bras bu dang po thob //
analyzed: skyon med 'jug dang 'bras bu dang po thob //
translated: And attain the first result, which is faultless.🔽They attain the second, third, and likewise the fourth result,

original: gnyis dang gsum dang de bzhin bzhi pa dang // @200b rang rgyal rnams kyi 'bras bu thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis dang gsum dang de bzhin bzhi pa dang // @200b rang rgyal rnams kyi 'bras bu thob par 'gyur //
translated: And the result of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: sgom pa gang gis su ni smra ba'i stag /
analyzed: sgom pa gang gis su ni smra ba'i stag /
translated: Through which meditation the lions of speech🔽Attain the acceptances,🔽And through which the victors attain enlightenment,

original: de dag bzod pa dag ni thob 'gyur dang // gang gis rgyal ba byang chub 'tshang rgya ba; ;bden pa de dag lnga ni snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag bzod pa dag ni thob 'gyur dang // gang gis rgyal ba byang chub 'tshang rgya ba; ;bden pa de dag lnga ni snang bar 'gyur //
translated: Those truths will shine.

original: lha yi mig gis su ni de yis kyang //
analyzed: lha yi mig gis su ni de yis kyang //
translated: Through the divine eye they

original: gzugs kyi rnam pa dag ni thams cad mthong //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam pa dag ni thams cad mthong //
translated: See all the forms.🔽Through the divine ear, which is definite understanding,

original: lha yi rna ba nges par rtogs pa yis; ;phyogs bcu dag gi sgra rnams rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: lha yi rna ba nges par rtogs pa yis; ;phyogs bcu dag gi sgra rnams rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: They understand the sounds in the ten directions.

original: sngon gyi gnas shes pa yi snang ba yis //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas shes pa yi snang ba yis //
translated: Through the light of the knowledge of past lives

original: bskal pa khrag khrig dag ni rjes su dran //
analyzed: bskal pa khrag khrig dag ni rjes su dran //
translated: They recollect many quintillions of eons.

original: 'od gsal ba yi shes pa'i snang ba yis //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba yi shes pa'i snang ba yis //
translated: Through the light of the knowledge of luminosity

original: gzhan gyi sems kyi spyod pa rnams la mkhas //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems kyi spyod pa rnams la mkhas //
translated: They are skilled in the activities of the minds of others.

original: rdzu 'phrul kyi ni shes pa'i snang ba yis //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul kyi ni shes pa'i snang ba yis //
translated: Through the light of the knowledge of magical power

original: phyogs bcu'i zhing ni khrag khrig rnams su 'gro //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i zhing ni khrag khrig rnams su 'gro //
translated: And to the quintillions of realms in the ten directions.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes pa'i snang ba ni //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes pa'i snang ba ni //
translated: The light of uncontaminated knowledge

original: nam mkha' dang ni mtshungs shing 'dra ba yin //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang ni mtshungs shing 'dra ba yin //
translated: Is equal to and the same as space.

original: bsod nams kyi ni snang ba mtha' yas pa'i //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi ni snang ba mtha' yas pa'i //
translated: The light of infinite merit

original: mngon shes thog ma 'gro ba nye bar 'gro //
analyzed: mngon shes thog ma 'gro ba nye bar 'gro //
translated: Is the first superknowledge that is attained.

original: de yi shes pa chags pa med pa yis //
analyzed: de yi shes pa chags pa med pa yis //
translated: With that unattached knowledge

original: 'gro ba'i dogs pa dag ni gcod par byed //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i dogs pa dag ni gcod par byed //
translated: One cuts through the doubts of beings.

original: nan tan snying por byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: nan tan snying por byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
translated: The yogi who makes practice essential

original: dran dang blo gros rtogs dang chos shes snang //
analyzed: dran dang blo gros rtogs dang chos shes snang //
translated: Has mindfulness, understanding, realization, and the light of Dharma knowledge.

original: bden pa yi ni snang ba mtha' yas te //
analyzed: bden pa yi ni snang ba mtha' yas te //
translated: The light of the truths is infinite

original: mngon par shes pa'i snang bar gyur pa yin //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i snang bar gyur pa yin //
translated: And becomes the light of superknowledge.🔽Through practice, knowledge, wisdom,

original: sgrub pas ye shes dang ni shes rab dang // rgya chen blo dang @201a *//
analyzed: sgrub pas ye shes dang ni shes rab dang // rgya chen blo dang @201a *//
translated: Vast mind,🔽Infinite eloquence,🔽Right view, insight,

original: spobs pa mtha' yas dang // yang dag lta ba dang ni lhag mthong dang // shin tu 'khrugs pa med pa mthar thug gyur //
analyzed: spobs pa mtha' yas dang // yang dag lta ba dang ni lhag mthong dang // shin tu 'khrugs pa med pa mthar thug gyur //
translated: And complete non-disturbance are perfected.

original: snang ba shin tu rnam par dag pa brgyad //
analyzed: snang ba shin tu rnam par dag pa brgyad //
translated: The eight lights are very pure.

original: 'di dag mthu chen gang la yod pa ni //
analyzed: 'di dag mthu chen gang la yod pa ni //
translated: Whoever has these great powers

original: re zhig byang chub thob par ma gyur kyang //
analyzed: re zhig byang chub thob par ma gyur kyang //
translated: will, for the time being, not attain enlightenment,

original: de ni sangs rgyas mdzad pa byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas mdzad pa byed par 'gyur //
translated: but will perform the deeds of a Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po la bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po la bka' stsal pa //
translated: The Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Dhāraṇīśvara­rāja:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family!

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bcu drug gis sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa bcu drug gis sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ great compassion for sentient beings arises in sixteen ways.

original: bcu drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the sixteen?

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du kyi ma sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du kyi ma sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: 'jig tshogs la lta bas bcings pa /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta bas bcings pa /
translated: In this regard, bodhisattvas think as follows: ‘Alas, these sentient beings are bound by the view of the transitory collection.

original: lta ba sna tshogs dang 'dres pa dag ste /
analyzed: lta ba sna tshogs dang 'dres pa dag ste /
translated: They are entangled in various views.

original: lta ba thams cad spang pa'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: lta ba thams cad spang pa'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: “Alas! These sentient beings,

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyin ci log tu gyur nas mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyin ci log tu gyur nas mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes /
translated: having become mistaken about what does not exist, have the notion of permanence with regard to what is impermanent,

original: sdug bsngal ba la bde bar 'du shes /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba la bde bar 'du shes /
translated: the notion of happiness with regard to what is suffering,

original: bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes /
analyzed: bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes /
translated: the notion of self with regard to what is selfless,

original: mi sdug pa la sdug @201b par 'du shes pa dag ste /
analyzed: mi sdug pa la sdug @201b par 'du shes pa dag ste /
translated: and the notion of beauty with regard to what is ugly.🔽The great compassion of the bodhisattva arises for sentient beings with the thought, “I will teach them the Dharma so that they will abandon all errors.”

original: phyin ci log thams cad spang ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: phyin ci log thams cad spang ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: “Alas! These sentient beings,

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa la gnas pa /
translated: dwelling in the grasping of ‘I’ and ‘mine,’

original: dngos po med pa la dngos por 'du shes pa dag ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la dngos por 'du shes pa dag ste /
translated: have the notion of an existent thing with regard to what is not an existent thing.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa spang ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa spang ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: I will teach them the Dharma so that they will abandon grasping at ‘I’ and grasping at ‘mine.’

original: sgrib pa lngas bsgribs te 'dod pa'i zug rdus zug pa /
analyzed: sgrib pa lngas bsgribs te 'dod pa'i zug rdus zug pa /
translated: “ ‘Alas! These sentient beings are obscured by the five obscurations. They are afflicted by the pain of desire.

original: khong khro ba mang ba /
analyzed: khong khro ba mang ba /
translated: They are full of anger.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid la chags pa /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid la chags pa /
translated: They are attached to torpor and sleep.

original: dam pa ma yin pa la 'gyod pa kun nas langs pa /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa la 'gyod pa kun nas langs pa /
translated: They are full of regret about what is not sacred.

original: zab mo'i chos la nges pa ma thob pa dag ste /🔽sgrib pa thams cad spang ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di ni /
analyzed: zab mo'i chos la nges pa ma thob pa dag ste / sgrib pa thams cad spang ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di ni /
translated: They have not attained certainty in the profound Dharma.🔽I will teach them the Dharma so that they will abandon all obscurations.’

original: skye mched drug gis chags pas chags te /
analyzed: skye mched drug gis chags pas chags te /
translated: “ ‘Alas! These sentient beings are attached to the six sense sources.

original: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas mtshan mar 'dzin cing mngon rtags su 'dzin pa yin /
analyzed: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong nas mtshan mar 'dzin cing mngon rtags su 'dzin pa yin /
translated: When they see forms with their eyes, they grasp at signs and grasp at characteristics.

original: rna bas sgra thos /🔽snas dri snams /
analyzed: rna bas sgra thos / snas dri snams /
translated: They hear sounds with their ears.🔽They smell scents with their noses.

original: lces ro myangs /
analyzed: lces ro myangs /
translated: They taste flavors with their tongues.

original: lus kyis reg bya rnams la reg /
analyzed: lus kyis reg bya rnams la reg /
translated: They touch touchables with their bodies.

original: yid @202a *// kyis chos rnams rnam par shes nas mtshan mar 'dzin cing mngon rtags su 'dzin pa dag yin te /
analyzed: yid @202a *// kyis chos rnams rnam par shes nas mtshan mar 'dzin cing mngon rtags su 'dzin pa dag yin te /
translated: They cognize dharmas with their minds, and then grasp at their signs and grasp at their characteristics.🔽The bodhisattva’s great compassion toward sentient beings arises with the thought, “I will teach the Dharma to those who are attached to the six sense bases and who are hateful.”

original: skye mched drug gis chags pa sdang ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: skye mched drug gis chags pa sdang ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: “Alas! These sentient beings are destroyed by pride,🔽by the pride of thinking ‘I am,’🔽by the pride of thinking ‘I am superior,’🔽by the pride of thinking ‘I am inferior,’🔽by the pride of thinking ‘I am just a little bit inferior,’

original: nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal gyis bcom pas chung du dag pas bdag cag che'o snyam du bdag la rlom sems su byed pa //🔽mtshungs pa dag pas ni /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal gyis bcom pas chung du dag pas bdag cag che'o snyam du bdag la rlom sems su byed pa //🔽mtshungs pa dag pas ni /
translated: and by the pride of thinking ‘I am completely inferior.’🔽They think, ‘I am great compared to those who are less than me.’🔽They think, ‘I am equal to those who are equal to me.’

original: bdag cag che'o snyam du bdag la rlom sems su byed pa dang / ches che ba dag pas kyang bdag cag ches che'o snyam du bdag la rlom sems su byed pa /
analyzed: bdag cag che'o snyam du bdag la rlom sems su byed pa dang / ches che ba dag pas kyang bdag cag ches che'o snyam du bdag la rlom sems su byed pa /
translated: They are conceited about themselves, thinking, “We are great!” and they are conceited about themselves, thinking, “We are greater than the greatest!”

original: gzugs la bdag tu khas len pa nas rnam par shes pa'i bar la bdag tu khas len pa /
analyzed: gzugs la bdag tu khas len pa nas rnam par shes pa'i bar la bdag tu khas len pa /
translated: They assert that form is the self, up to asserting that consciousness is the self.

original: ma thob par bdag la thob pa snyam du shes pa /🔽bdag cag ni /
analyzed: ma thob par bdag la thob pa snyam du shes pa / bdag cag ni /
translated: They think they have attained what they have not attained.🔽They think,

original: 'phags pa'o snyam du bdag la sems pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa'o snyam du bdag la sems pa /
translated: “We are noble!”

original: log pa'i lta ba la yang dag pa'i lta bar mos pa dag ste /
analyzed: log pa'i lta ba la yang dag pa'i lta bar mos pa dag ste /
translated: They are devoted to the wrong view as the right view.

original: nga rgyal gyi rnam pa thams cad spang pa'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la @202b byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /🔽lam ngan par zhugs pa /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi rnam pa thams cad spang pa'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la @202b byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni / lam ngan par zhugs pa /
translated: I will teach them the Dharma so that they will abandon all forms of pride.🔽They have entered bad paths.

original: 'phags pa'i lam dang bral ba dang ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam dang bral ba dang ste /
translated: They are devoid of the noble path.

original: lam ngan pa spang zhing 'phags pa'i lam thob par bya ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: lam ngan pa spang zhing 'phags pa'i lam thob par bya ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: The great compassion of the Bodhisattva arises toward beings with the thought, I will teach them the Dharma so that they will abandon the bad paths and obtain the noble path.

original: sred pa'i khol po chung ma dang / bu pho dang / bu mo la yongs su zhen pas spags pa /
analyzed: sred pa'i khol po chung ma dang / bu pho dang / bu mo la yongs su zhen pas spags pa /
translated: The great compassion of the Bodhisattva arises toward beings with the thought, I will teach them the Dharma so that they will be free from the slavery of craving, free from the bondage of wives, sons, and daughters,

original: rang dbang med pa /
analyzed: rang dbang med pa /
translated: free from lack of independence,

original: bdag la mi dpon ba dag ste /
analyzed: bdag la mi dpon ba dag ste /
translated: and free from being the servants of others,🔽so that they will have independence, so that they will be able to give to others, and so that they will be able to go wherever they wish.

original: rang dbang yod cing bdag la dbog par bya ba dang / gar dga' bar 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /🔽phan tshun mi 'phrod pa /
analyzed: rang dbang yod cing bdag la dbog par bya ba dang / gar dga' bar 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni / phan tshun mi 'phrod pa /
translated: The great compassion of the Bodhisattva arises toward beings with the thought, I will teach them the Dharma so that they will be free from mutual incompatibility,🔽free from anger, hatred, and malice,

original: khro ba dang / zhe sdang dang / gnod sems mang ba dag ste /
analyzed: khro ba dang / zhe sdang dang / gnod sems mang ba dag ste /
translated: and free from mutual conflict.

original: khro ba dang / zhe sdang dang / gnod sems spang bar bya ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni; sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su zin pa /
analyzed: khro ba dang / zhe sdang dang / gnod sems spang bar bya ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni; sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su zin pa /
translated: “Alas, these beings are under the influence of evil companions,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba /
translated: and they are separated from spiritual teachers.

original: sdig pa'i las byed pa dag ste /🔽dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su @203a *//
analyzed: sdig pa'i las byed pa dag ste / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su @203a *//
translated: They are committing evil actions.🔽I will teach them the Dharma so that they will be under the influence of spiritual teachers🔽and will abandon evil companions.”

original: zin pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: zin pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: “Alas, these beings are greedy,

original: brkam pa / chags pas zil gyis non pa /
analyzed: brkam pa / chags pas zil gyis non pa /
translated: overwhelmed by attachment,

original: chog mi shes shing 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi gnas pa dang bral ba dang ste /
analyzed: chog mi shes shing 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi gnas pa dang bral ba dang ste /
translated: and they are separated from the state of the wisdom of the noble ones.

original: chags pa spangs pa dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab bskyed pa'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /🔽las kyi rnam par smin pa med par lta zhing rtag pa dang chad pa la gnas pa dag ste /
analyzed: chags pa spangs pa dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab bskyed pa'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni / las kyi rnam par smin pa med par lta zhing rtag pa dang chad pa la gnas pa dag ste /
translated: The great compassion of the bodhisattva arises toward sentient beings with the thought I will teach them the Dharma so that they will abandon attachment and generate the wisdom of the noble ones.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab mo dang / las dang / bya ba la gzud pa'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / skye ma sems can 'di dag ni /🔽ma rig pa dang gti mug gis ldongs pa /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab mo dang / las dang / bya ba la gzud pa'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / skye ma sems can 'di dag ni / ma rig pa dang gti mug gis ldongs pa /
translated: The great compassion of the bodhisattva arises toward sentient beings with the thought I will teach them the Dharma so that they will enter into the profound dependent origination and the performance of actions, since these sentient beings have views of the nonexistence of the ripening of karma and abide in eternalism and nihilism.🔽The great compassion of the bodhisattva arises toward sentient beings with the thought I will teach them the Dharma so that they will abandon the view of the transitory collection, since these sentient beings are obscured by the darkness of ignorance and the darkness of delusion.

original: bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag la mngon par zhen pa dag ste /
analyzed: bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag la mngon par zhen pa dag ste /
translated: The great compassion of the bodhisattva arises toward sentient beings with the thought I will teach them the Dharma so that they will abandon the view of the transitory collection, since these sentient beings are blinded by the darkness of ignorance and the darkness of delusion and are attached to a self, a sentient being, a life-force, something that is nourished, a person, and an individual.

original: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig rnam par dag par bya ba dang / lta bar gyur pa @203b thams cad spang bar bya ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig rnam par dag par bya ba dang / lta bar gyur pa @203b thams cad spang bar bya ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang /
translated: They think, “I will teach them the Dharma so that they may attain the pure eye of the noble beings’ wisdom and so that they may abandon all views.”🔽

original: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni; 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba /
analyzed: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni; 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba /
translated: “ ‘Alas! These beings delight in saṃsāra,

original: phung po lnga'i gshed mas yongs su zin pa dag ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga'i gshed mas yongs su zin pa dag ste /
translated: and are caught by the executioners of the five aggregates.🔽I will teach them the Dharma so that they may be freed from the three realms.🔽’

original: khams gsum thams cad las dbyung ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad las dbyung ba'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: “ ‘Alas! These beings are bound by the fetters of Māra,

original: bdud kyi zhags pa'i bcing bas bcings pa; g-yo ba dang; rlom sems la gnas pa dag ste /
analyzed: bdud kyi zhags pa'i bcing bas bcings pa; g-yo ba dang; rlom sems la gnas pa dag ste /
translated: and they are caught in movement and conceit.

original: bdud kyi zhags pas bcings pa thams cad las rnam par dgrol ba dang / g-yo dang / rlom sems spang ba'i phyir de dge la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /🔽mya ngan las 'da' ba'i sgo bcad cing ngan 'gro'i sgo phye ba dag ste /
analyzed: bdud kyi zhags pas bcings pa thams cad las rnam par dgrol ba dang / g-yo dang / rlom sems spang ba'i phyir de dge la chos bstan par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba dang / kye ma sems can 'di dag ni / mya ngan las 'da' ba'i sgo bcad cing ngan 'gro'i sgo phye ba dag ste /
translated: The great compassion of the bodhisattva arises for sentient beings with the thought, “I will teach the Dharma to those who are bound by the snares of Mara in order to completely liberate them from all bonds.”

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i sgo dbye ba dang / ngan 'gro'i sgo gcad pa'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i sgo dbye ba dang / ngan 'gro'i sgo gcad pa'i phyir de dag la chos bstan par bya'o snyam snyam du sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po skye ba ste /
translated: The great compassion of the bodhisattva arises for sentient beings with the thought, “I will teach the Dharma to those who are closed off from the door to nirvana and have opened the door to the lower realms in order to open the door to nirvana and close the door to the lower realms.”🔽Noble sir, the great compassion of the bodhisattvas for sentient beings arises in sixteen ways.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽rnam pa bcu drug po de dag gis sems can rnams la byang chub sems @204a *//
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / rnam pa bcu drug po de dag gis sems can rnams la byang chub sems @204a *//
translated: Noble sir,🔽these are the sixteen ways

original: dpa'i snying rje chen po skye'o //🔽rigs kyi bu /🔽'di dag ni /
analyzed: dpa'i snying rje chen po skye'o //🔽rigs kyi bu /🔽'di dag ni /
translated: in which the great compassion of the bodhisattvas for sentient beings arises.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi las ma 'dres pa sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi las ma 'dres pa sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
translated: The bodhisattvas have thirty-two unmixed activities.

original: de dag la brtson na /
analyzed: de dag la brtson na /
translated: If they strive in these,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams legs par byed pa'i las byed pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams legs par byed pa'i las byed pa rnams yin no //
translated: the bodhisattvas are those who do good activities.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the thirty-two?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sems can dag gti mug gi gnyid kyis log pa dang / bdag shes rab kyis sad par mthong nas shes rab kyis sems can rnams sad par byed pa 'di ni /
analyzed: sems can dag gti mug gi gnyid kyis log pa dang / bdag shes rab kyis sad par mthong nas shes rab kyis sems can rnams sad par byed pa 'di ni /
translated: When sentient beings are asleep in the sleep of delusion, and the bodhisattvas see that they themselves are awake through wisdom, they awaken sentient beings with wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i las ma 'dres pa dang po'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i las ma 'dres pa dang po'o //
translated: This is the first unmixed activity of the bodhisattvas.

original: sems can dag chung du la mos pa dang / bdag rgya chen po la mos par mthong nas theg pa chen po la sems can rnams yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / sems can dag chos ma yin pa 'dod pa dang / bdag chos la gnas par mthong nas sems can rnams chos 'dod pa la rab tu 'god pa dang /
analyzed: sems can dag chung du la mos pa dang / bdag rgya chen po la mos par mthong nas theg pa chen po la sems can rnams yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / sems can dag chos ma yin pa 'dod pa dang / bdag chos la gnas par mthong nas sems can rnams chos 'dod pa la rab tu 'god pa dang /
translated: When sentient beings are devoted to the lesser vehicle, and the bodhisattvas see that they themselves are devoted to the great vehicle, they cause sentient beings to take up the Great Vehicle. When sentient beings desire what is not the Dharma, and the bodhisattvas see that they themselves abide in the Dharma, they establish sentient beings in the desire for the Dharma.

original: sems can dag 'tsho ba yongs su ma dag pa dang / bdag 'tsho ba yongs su dag par mthong nas sems can rnams 'tsho ba yongs su dag par sbyor ba dang / sems can dag lta bar gyur par bying ba dang / bdag yang dag pa'i lta bar zhugs par mthong nas sems can rnams 'phags @204b pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la rab tu 'god pa dang /
analyzed: sems can dag 'tsho ba yongs su ma dag pa dang / bdag 'tsho ba yongs su dag par mthong nas sems can rnams 'tsho ba yongs su dag par sbyor ba dang / sems can dag lta bar gyur par bying ba dang / bdag yang dag pa'i lta bar zhugs par mthong nas sems can rnams 'phags @204b pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la rab tu 'god pa dang /
translated: When they see that sentient beings’ livelihood is impure but their own livelihood is pure, they connect sentient beings to pure livelihood.🔽When they see that sentient beings are sunk in wrong views but they themselves have entered into the right view, they establish sentient beings in the noble right view.

original: sems can dag ma rig par gyur cing tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ba shags par mthong zhing bdag rig pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la gnas par rig nas sems can rnams rig pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i tshul bzhin
analyzed: sems can dag ma rig par gyur cing tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ba shags par mthong zhing bdag rig pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la gnas par rig nas sems can rnams rig pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i tshul bzhin
translated: When they see that sentient beings are in ignorance and are attached to incorrect mental activity, and they themselves are established in the correct mental activity that accords with knowledge, they establish sentient beings in the correct mental activity that accords with knowledge.

original: yid la byed pa la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag log pa'i chos la gnas pa dang / bdag yang dag pa'i chos la zhugs par mthong nas yang dag pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang /
analyzed: yid la byed pa la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag log pa'i chos la gnas pa dang / bdag yang dag pa'i chos la zhugs par mthong nas yang dag pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang /
translated: It is to establish them in mental activity.🔽It is to teach the Dharma to beings who are attached to wrong Dharma and who have not entered the right Dharma, in order to establish them in the right Dharma.🔽It is to give away all one’s possessions to beings who are stingy and have a grasping mind, in order to establish them in the renunciation of all possessions.

original: sems can dag ser sna can du gyur te kun tu 'dzin pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / bdag bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong bar mthong nas sems can rnams bdag pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba la sbyor ba dang / sems can dag ngang tshul ngan pa can du gyur te sdom pa la mi gnas pa dang /
analyzed: sems can dag ser sna can du gyur te kun tu 'dzin pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / bdag bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong bar mthong nas sems can rnams bdag pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba la sbyor ba dang / sems can dag ngang tshul ngan pa can du gyur te sdom pa la mi gnas pa dang /
translated: It is to establish beings who are immoral and do not keep vows in the practice of vows and correct conduct.

original: bdag tshul khrims yongs su dag par gnas nas sems can rnams tshul khrims kyi sdom pa la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag gnod sems mang zhing khro ba shas che ba dang / bdag bzod pa'i stobs dang / byams pa la gnas par mthong nas sems can rnams bzod pa'i stobs dang /🔽byams pa la gnas pa @205a *//
analyzed: bdag tshul khrims yongs su dag par gnas nas sems can rnams tshul khrims kyi sdom pa la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag gnod sems mang zhing khro ba shas che ba dang / bdag bzod pa'i stobs dang / byams pa la gnas par mthong nas sems can rnams bzod pa'i stobs dang / byams pa la gnas pa @205a *//
translated: “When they see that beings are very angry and have a lot of hatred and that they themselves are living with the power of patience and love, they cause beings to take up the power of patience and love.🔽“When they see that beings are lazy and have little perseverance and that they themselves are persevering and not lazy, they cause beings to take up perseverance.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / sems can dag le lo can du gyur te brtson 'grus chug nab dang / bdag le lo med cing brtson 'grus brtsams par mthong nas sems can rnams brtson 'grus rtsom pa la sbyor ba dang / sems can dag sems g-yengs shing dran pa nyams pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / sems can dag le lo can du gyur te brtson 'grus chug nab dang / bdag le lo med cing brtson 'grus brtsams par mthong nas sems can rnams brtson 'grus rtsom pa la sbyor ba dang / sems can dag sems g-yengs shing dran pa nyams pa dang /
translated: “When they see that beings are distracted and have lost their mindfulness and that they themselves are mindful and have one-pointed concentration, they cause beings to take up one-pointed concentration.

original: bdag mnyam par bzhag ste bsam gtan la bsam gtan byed par mthong nas sems can rnams sems mi g-yeng pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag shes rab 'chal bar gyur te dman zhing gti mug dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: bdag mnyam par bzhag ste bsam gtan la bsam gtan byed par mthong nas sems can rnams sems mi g-yeng pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag shes rab 'chal bar gyur te dman zhing gti mug dang ldan pa dang /
translated: When they see that they themselves are meditating on concentration while others are not meditating, they establish beings in the meditative concentration of undistracted mind, mindfulness, and vigilance.🔽When they see that they themselves are endowed with wisdom and free from delusion while others are of poor quality, have wrong views, and are confused, they establish beings in great wisdom and freedom from delusion.

original: bdag shes rab dang ldan zhing gti mug dang bral bar mthong nas sems can rnams shes rab chen po dang / gti mgu dang bral ba yang dag par shin tu 'jug pa dang / sems can dag rigs pa ma yin par lhung zhing yang ba'i byed pa brtsams pa dang /
analyzed: bdag shes rab dang ldan zhing gti mug dang bral bar mthong nas sems can rnams shes rab chen po dang / gti mgu dang bral ba yang dag par shin tu 'jug pa dang / sems can dag rigs pa ma yin par lhung zhing yang ba'i byed pa brtsams pa dang /
translated: When they see that they themselves are free from the faults of the bodhisattvas’ training while others are not free from them, they establish beings in the bodhisattvas’ training.

original: bdag thabs mkhas pa dang ldan zhing yang dag pa'i las brtsams par mthong nas sems can rnams thabs mkhas pa dang / yang dag pa'i las rtsom pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / sems can dag nyon mongs pas bcom zhing kun tu rtog pa dang /
analyzed: bdag thabs mkhas pa dang ldan zhing yang dag pa'i las brtsams par mthong nas sems can rnams thabs mkhas pa dang / yang dag pa'i las rtsom pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / sems can dag nyon mongs pas bcom zhing kun tu rtog pa dang /
translated: Seeing that they are skilled in means and that they have undertaken the right activity, they will encourage beings to be skilled in means and to undertake the right activity.🔽Seeing that they are overcome by afflictions and that they are in the domain of conceptualization,

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / @205b yongs su rtog pa'i spyod yul par gyur pa dang / bdag nyon mos pa thams cad las log par mthong nas sems can rnams nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i bcing pas bcings shing dmigs pa la rab tu gnas pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / @205b yongs su rtog pa'i spyod yul par gyur pa dang / bdag nyon mos pa thams cad las log par mthong nas sems can rnams nyon mongs pa thams cad spong ba la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i bcing pas bcings shing dmigs pa la rab tu gnas pa dang /
translated: thought, and imagination, they will establish beings in the relinquishment of all afflictions. Seeing that they are bound by the fetters of the view of the transitory collection and that they are fully engaged in observation, they will establish beings in the absence of observation.

original: bdag 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su mos pa dang ldan zhing dmigs pas bcings pa las yongs su grol bar mthong nas sems can rnams 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su shes pa dang / dmigs pa dang bral pa la sbyor ba dang / sems can dag ma dul zhing ma sbas te byang ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: bdag 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su mos pa dang ldan zhing dmigs pas bcings pa las yongs su grol bar mthong nas sems can rnams 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su shes pa dang / dmigs pa dang bral pa la sbyor ba dang / sems can dag ma dul zhing ma sbas te byang ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: Seeing that beings are undisciplined, unrestrained, and unrefined,🔽while they themselves are disciplined, restrained, and refined, they establish beings in discipline, restraint, and refinement.

original: bdag dul zhing sbas te byang bar mthong nas sems can rnams dul ba dang / spas pa dang / byang ba la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag byas pa mi gzo zhing byas pa mi shes te dge ba'i rtsa ba 'joms pa dang /
analyzed: bdag dul zhing sbas te byang bar mthong nas sems can rnams dul ba dang / spas pa dang / byang ba la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag byas pa mi gzo zhing byas pa mi shes te dge ba'i rtsa ba 'joms pa dang /
translated: Seeing that beings are ungrateful, do not understand what has been done for them, and destroy their roots of virtue,

original: bdag byas pa gzo zhing byas pa shes te dge ba'i rtsa ba srung bar gnas par mthong nas sems can rnams byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa shes pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba chud mi gzon pa la rab tu 'god pa dang /
analyzed: bdag byas pa gzo zhing byas pa shes te dge ba'i rtsa ba srung bar gnas par mthong nas sems can rnams byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa shes pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba chud mi gzon pa la rab tu 'god pa dang /
translated: while they themselves are grateful, understand what has been done for them, and protect their roots of virtue, they establish beings in gratitude, understanding what has been done for them, and in not wasting their roots of virtue.

original: sems can dag chu bor lhung zhing sdig pa 'dod pa'i dbang du song ba dang / bdag chu bo thams cad las yang dag @206a *//🔽par 'das par mthong nas sems can rnams chu bo thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba la spyor ba dang / sems can dag bka' blo mi bde zhing mthun par 'dzin pa ma yin pa dang / bdag bka' blo bde zhing mthun par 'dzin par mthong nas sems can rnams la bka' blo bde zhing mthun par 'dzin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: sems can dag chu bor lhung zhing sdig pa 'dod pa'i dbang du song ba dang / bdag chu bo thams cad las yang dag @206a *// par 'das par mthong nas sems can rnams chu bo thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba la spyor ba dang / sems can dag bka' blo mi bde zhing mthun par 'dzin pa ma yin pa dang / bdag bka' blo bde zhing mthun par 'dzin par mthong nas sems can rnams la bka' blo bde zhing mthun par 'dzin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang /
translated: “When they see that beings are drowning in the river of saṃsāra and are under the sway of the craving for evil, while they themselves have crossed all the rivers, they encourage beings to cross all the rivers.🔽“When they see that beings are disobedient and do not follow the teachings, while they themselves are obedient and follow the teachings, they encourage beings to be obedient and follow the teachings.

original: sems can dag phongs pa mang zhing dam pa ma yin pa la yongs su zhen pa dang / bdag ma phongs pa mang zhing dge ba bdud rtsi la gnas par mthong nas sems can rnams yongs su zhen pa dang bral zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba la gnas par sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: sems can dag phongs pa mang zhing dam pa ma yin pa la yongs su zhen pa dang / bdag ma phongs pa mang zhing dge ba bdud rtsi la gnas par mthong nas sems can rnams yongs su zhen pa dang bral zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba la gnas par sbyor ba dang /
translated: “When they see that beings are beset by many misfortunes and are attached to what is not good, while they themselves are not beset by many misfortunes and abide in the nectar of virtue, they encourage beings to be free from attachment and to abide in the roots of virtue.

original: sems can dag dbul zhing 'phags pa'i nor dang bral ba dang / bdag 'phags pa'i nor dang ma bral zhing nor bdun dang ldan par mthong nas sems can rnams 'phags pa'i nor thob par bya ba la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag rtag tu na zhing khams rnam pa bzhi po'i sbrul gdug pas zin pa dang /
analyzed: sems can dag dbul zhing 'phags pa'i nor dang bral ba dang / bdag 'phags pa'i nor dang ma bral zhing nor bdun dang ldan par mthong nas sems can rnams 'phags pa'i nor thob par bya ba la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag rtag tu na zhing khams rnam pa bzhi po'i sbrul gdug pas zin pa dang /
translated: Seeing that beings are poor and lack the wealth of the noble ones, while they themselves are not lacking in the wealth of the noble ones and possess the seven riches, they set beings to acquiring the wealth of the noble ones.🔽Seeing that beings are constantly ill, seized by the four hundred and four kinds of disease,🔽like poisonous snakes, while they themselves are free from illness, healthy, and unchanging, they encourage beings to give up all their illnesses.

original: bdag nad med cing bde la 'gyur ba med par mthong nas sems can rnams nad thams cad spong ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / sems can dag mi shes pa'i mun pas kun tu gtibs @206b shing ye shes kyi snang ba dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: bdag nad med cing bde la 'gyur ba med par mthong nas sems can rnams nad thams cad spong ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / sems can dag mi shes pa'i mun pas kun tu gtibs @206b shing ye shes kyi snang ba dang bral ba dang /
translated: Seeing that beings are shrouded in the darkness of ignorance and lack the light of wisdom,

original: bdag ye shes kyi snang ba thob par mthong nas sems can rnams ye shes kyi snang ba chen po la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag khams gsum la chags pas chags shing rgyud lnga'i 'gro ba'i 'khor ba'i 'khor lo'i rjes su 'jug pa mthong zhing /
analyzed: bdag ye shes kyi snang ba thob par mthong nas sems can rnams ye shes kyi snang ba chen po la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag khams gsum la chags pas chags shing rgyud lnga'i 'gro ba'i 'khor ba'i 'khor lo'i rjes su 'jug pa mthong zhing /
translated: They see that they have attained the light of wisdom and so they establish beings in the great light of wisdom. They see that beings are attached to the three realms and follow the wheel of samsara of the five classes of beings.

original: bdag khams gsum yongs su shes pa la mkhas par shes nas sems can rnams khams gsum yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / sems can dag g-yon phyogs kyi lam du zhugs shing g-yas phyogs kyi lam dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: bdag khams gsum yongs su shes pa la mkhas par shes nas sems can rnams khams gsum yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / sems can dag g-yon phyogs kyi lam du zhugs shing g-yas phyogs kyi lam dang bral ba dang /
translated: They see that they have become skilled in knowing the three realms and so they cause beings to adopt the skill in knowing the three realms. They see that beings have entered the path of the left and are without the path of the right.

original: bdag g-yos phyogs kyi lam la gnas par mthong nas sems can rnams g-yas phyogs kyi lam la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag lus dang srog la chags shing nyes pa ma mthong ba dang / bdag lus dang srog la mi lta zhing nyes pa mthong ba yin par mthong nas sems can rnams lus dang srog la mi lta ba dang /
analyzed: bdag g-yos phyogs kyi lam la gnas par mthong nas sems can rnams g-yas phyogs kyi lam la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag lus dang srog la chags shing nyes pa ma mthong ba dang / bdag lus dang srog la mi lta zhing nyes pa mthong ba yin par mthong nas sems can rnams lus dang srog la mi lta ba dang /
translated: Seeing that beings are established in the path of the right side, he establishes them in the path of the left side;🔽seeing that beings are attached to body and life and do not see faults, and that he himself does not see faults and does not look at body and life, he establishes beings in not looking at body and life and in seeing faults;

original: nyes pa mthong ba la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang bral ba dang / bdag dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs rgyun mi gcod par gnas par mthong nas sems can rnams dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs rgyun mi @207a *//
analyzed: nyes pa mthong ba la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang bral ba dang / bdag dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs rgyun mi gcod par gnas par mthong nas sems can rnams dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs rgyun mi @207a *//
translated: seeing that beings are separated from the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha, and that he himself is established in the lineage of the Three Jewels, he establishes beings in the lineage of the Three Jewels, in the lineage of the Dharma, and in the lineage of the Saṅgha.
