original: rjes su dran pa drug dang bral ba dang / bdag rjes su dran pa drug ma btang bar mthong nas sems can rnams rjes su dran pa drug sgom pa la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag las dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pas bsgribs pa dang /
analyzed: rjes su dran pa drug dang bral ba dang / bdag rjes su dran pa drug ma btang bar mthong nas sems can rnams rjes su dran pa drug sgom pa la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag las dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pas bsgribs pa dang /
translated: They see that sentient beings are not interested in the Great Vehicle, whereas they themselves are interested in the Great Vehicle, and so they set them on the Great Vehicle.🔽They see

original: bdag las dang nyon mongs pa dang bral bar mthong nas sems can rnams las dang nyon mongs pa dang bral ba la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag mi dge ba'i chos thams cad dang ldan zhing dge ba'i chos thams cad spangs pa dang /
analyzed: bdag las dang nyon mongs pa dang bral bar mthong nas sems can rnams las dang nyon mongs pa dang bral ba la rab tu 'god pa dang / sems can dag mi dge ba'i chos thams cad dang ldan zhing dge ba'i chos thams cad spangs pa dang /
translated: Seeing that they are free from karma and afflictions, they establish beings in freedom from karma and afflictions.🔽Seeing that beings possess all nonvirtuous qualities and are devoid of all virtuous qualities,

original: bdag mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spangs shing dge ba'i chos thams cad dang ldan par mthong nas sems can rnams mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa la rab tu 'god pa ste /
analyzed: bdag mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spangs shing dge ba'i chos thams cad dang ldan par mthong nas sems can rnams mi dge ba'i chos thams cad spong ba dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa la rab tu 'god pa ste /
translated: they establish beings in the abandonment of all nonvirtuous qualities and the perfection of all virtuous qualities.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i las sum cu rtsa gnyis po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i las sum cu rtsa gnyis po 'di dag ni /
translated: these thirty-two activities of the bodhisattvas

original: byang @207b chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang dag phul yin te /
analyzed: byang @207b chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang dag phul yin te /
translated: are the bodhisattvas’ supreme practice.

original: de dag la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams legs par byed pa'i las byed pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: de dag la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams legs par byed pa'i las byed pa rnams yin no //
translated: Abiding in them, the bodhisattvas perform virtuous actions.”

original: rigs kyi bu; yang byang chub sems dpa'i las ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; yang byang chub sems dpa'i las ni /
translated: “Son of noble family, the activity of the bodhisattvas is as follows:

original: tshad med do //
analyzed: tshad med do //
translated: “Son of noble family, the activities of the bodhisattvas are immeasurable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sgo ji snyed par byang chub sems dpas rnam par byang ba'i sgo yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba'ang de snyed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sgo ji snyed par byang chub sems dpas rnam par byang ba'i sgo yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba'ang de snyed do //
translated: the bodhisattvas must accomplish as many gateways to complete purification as there are gateways to the afflictions of sentient beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽gal te gang dag gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / gal te gang dag gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can de dag thams cad nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la rab tu gnas par gyur kyang sems can de dag thams cad kyi las gang yin pa de sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i las kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la rab tu gnas par gyur kyang sems can de dag thams cad kyi las gang yin pa de sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i las kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: if all the sentient beings of world systems as numerous as the grains of sand in the river Ganges were to enter the vehicle of the hearers or the vehicle of the solitary buddhas, the karmic actions of all those sentient beings would not come close to even a hundredth of the karmic actions of a bodhisattva who has generated the first thought of awakening.

original: stong gi cha dang / brgya stong gi cha dang / bye ba'i cha dang / bye ba brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / brgya stong gi cha dang / bye ba'i cha dang / bye ba brgya phrag stong gi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It is not even a fraction, a hundredth, a thousandth, a hundred thousandth of a koṭi of a fraction, a hundred thousand koṭis of a fraction, a count, a part, a comparison, or an example.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ni /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang ni /
translated: Śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas

original: rang gi rgyud kyi nyon mongs pa spong bar nye bar gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud kyi nyon mongs pa spong bar nye bar gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: are established in the elimination of their own mental afflictions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dag ni /
translated: But bodhisattvas

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa spong bar nye bar gnas pa @208a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa spong bar nye bar gnas pa @208a *//
translated: are established in the elimination of the mental afflictions of all sentient beings.

original: yin no; ;rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: yin no; ;rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: in that way

original: sems can thams cad kyi las gang yin pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi las gang yin pa bas 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i las nyid mchog ces brjod do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi las gang yin pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi las gang yin pa bas 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i las nyid mchog ces brjod do //
translated: the activity of bodhisattvas is said to be supreme compared to the activity of all sentient beings and the activity of all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi las ni /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi las ni /
translated: The activity of ordinary, foolish beings

original: phyin ci log dang ldan pa /
analyzed: phyin ci log dang ldan pa /
translated: It is not mistaken.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi las ni /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi las ni /
translated: The actions of all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas

original: nyi tshe ba dang ldan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nyi tshe ba dang ldan pa yin gyi /
translated: are limited.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i las ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i las ni /
translated: The actions of bodhisattvas

original: phyin ci log med cing tshad med pa'i rnam pa'i yon tan rtsom pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log med cing tshad med pa'i rnam pa'i yon tan rtsom pa ste /
translated: are not mistaken and are the composition of immeasurable qualities.🔽For this reason, bodhisattvas surpass all sentient beings, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rgyu 'dis sems can thams cad dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis non to; ;de nas byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po tshim zhing mgu la yid rang sa shing rab tu dga' ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rgyu 'dis sems can thams cad dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis non to; ;de nas byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po tshim zhing mgu la yid rang sa shing rab tu dga' ste /
translated: Then the bodhisattva Dhāraṇīśvara­rāja, satisfied, delighted, elated, and joyful,

original: dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skyes nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' ste rjes su yi rang nas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: dga' ba dang / yid bde ba skyes nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' ste rjes su yi rang nas yang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: having rejoiced in and praised what the Bhagavat had said, said to the Bhagavat,🔽“Bhagavat, how many qualities does a bodhisattva possess🔽in order to attain this dhāraṇī?”

original: bcom ldan 'das; ji tsam du de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub sems dpa'i rgyan dang / byang chub sems dpa'i snang pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po dang / @208b byang chub sems dpa'i las legs par gsungs pa de dag ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das; ji tsam du de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub sems dpa'i rgyan dang / byang chub sems dpa'i snang pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po dang / @208b byang chub sems dpa'i las legs par gsungs pa de dag ni /
translated: “Blessed One, the Thus-Gone One has excellently explained the ornaments of the bodhisattvas, the radiance of the bodhisattvas, the great compassion of the bodhisattvas, and the activities of the bodhisattvas.🔽

original: ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: ngo mtshar to //
translated: Blessed One, the Thus-Gone One’s excellent explanations of the ornaments of the bodhisattvas, the radiance of the bodhisattvas, the great compassion of the bodhisattvas, and the activities of the bodhisattvas are truly amazing.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,🔽please explain further

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis yang bshad du gsol /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis yang bshad du gsol /
translated: the great compassion of the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar sems can dag la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen po /
analyzed: ji ltar sems can dag la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen po /
translated: how do the blessed buddhas engage with sentient beings through their great compassion?

original: 'jug / de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po ni /🔽ji tsam / rnam pa ni /
analyzed: 'jug / de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po ni / ji tsam / rnam pa ni /
translated: What is the thus-gone one’s great compassion like?🔽What are its aspects?

original: gang lags / rtags ni /🔽gang lags / mtshan ma ni /
analyzed: gang lags / rtags ni / gang lags / mtshan ma ni /
translated: What are its signs?🔽What are its marks?

original: gang lags / gnas ni; gang lags /
analyzed: gang lags / gnas ni; gang lags /
translated: What is its basis?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'phrin las ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'phrin las ni /
translated: What is the activity of the blessed buddhas?

original: ji ltar mdzad /
analyzed: ji ltar mdzad /
translated: How do they act?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'phrin las ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'phrin las ni /
translated: What is the activity of the thus-gone one?

original: ji tsam / rnam pa ni /🔽gang lags; rtags ni /
analyzed: ji tsam / rnam pa ni / gang lags; rtags ni /
translated: What is its extent?🔽What are its aspects?🔽What are its signs?

original: gang lags / mtshan ma ni /
analyzed: gang lags / mtshan ma ni /
translated: What are its marks?

original: gang lags / gnas ni /
analyzed: gang lags / gnas ni /
translated: What is its location?

original: gang lags pa de bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa /
analyzed: gang lags pa de bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa /
translated: The Blessed One is omniscient,

original: thams cad gzigs pa /
analyzed: thams cad gzigs pa /
translated: all-seeing,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'phrin las rnams mngon sum du gyur pas mngon sum du bdag cag la legs par yang dag par bshad du gsol /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'phrin las rnams mngon sum du gyur pas mngon sum du bdag cag la legs par yang dag par bshad du gsol /
translated: and directly perceives the activities of the Thus-Gone One. Please explain this to us directly and correctly.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Dhāraṇīśvara­rāja,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: @209a *// khyod de'i phyir legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'phrin las la 'jug pa tsam cung zad cig khyod la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: @209a *// khyod de'i phyir legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'phrin las la 'jug pa tsam cung zad cig khyod la bshad par bya'o //
translated: for that reason, listen well and keep this in mind. I will explain to you a mere fraction of the Thus-Gone One's great compassion and the activities of the Thus-Gone One.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: sems can rnams la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen po ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen po ni /
translated: The great compassion of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, toward sentient beings

original: skye ba'ang med /
analyzed: skye ba'ang med /
translated: is not produced

original: 'jug pa'ang med do //🔽zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'ang med do // zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: and does not engage.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen po ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen po ni /
translated: The great compassion of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

original: rtag tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is always engaged.

original: de ni / bskal pa grangs med par yongs su sbyang ba byas pas yang dag par bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: de ni / bskal pa grangs med par yongs su sbyang ba byas pas yang dag par bskyed pa ste /
translated: It is generated by thorough training for countless eons,

original: 'jug pa'ang med /
analyzed: 'jug pa'ang med /
translated: and it does not engage🔽or disengage.

original: log pa'ang med do; ;sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen po ni /
analyzed: log pa'ang med do; ;sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs rje chen po ni /
translated: The great compassion of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

original: ma btang ba /
analyzed: ma btang ba /
translated: is not abandoned

original: sems can thams cad la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la gnas pa'o //
translated: and abides in all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po de ni /
translated: That great compassion of the Tathāgatas

original: ji tsam du las yongs su thob par bya bar sla ba ma yin pa de tsam du tshad med /
analyzed: ji tsam du las yongs su thob par bya bar sla ba ma yin pa de tsam du tshad med /
translated: is immeasurable to the extent that the activity to be accomplished is not easy to attain,

original: de tsam du bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: de tsam du bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: it is inconceivable to that extent,

original: de tsam du mi zad cing /
analyzed: de tsam du mi zad cing /
translated: it is inexhaustible to that extent,

original: de tsam du ring du song ba'o //
analyzed: de tsam du ring du song ba'o //
translated: and it goes far to that extent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ji ltar byang chub thob pa de ltar sems can rnams la thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ji ltar byang chub thob pa de ltar sems can rnams la thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: the Thus-Gone One’s great compassion for sentient beings is just like his attainment of awakening.

original: byang @209b chub ji 'dra ba thugs rje chen po'ang de 'dra'o //
analyzed: byang @209b chub ji 'dra ba thugs rje chen po'ang de 'dra'o //
translated: Just as awakening is, so is great compassion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub ji ltar thob ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub ji ltar thob ce na /
translated: How did the Thus-Gone One attain awakening?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rtsa ba med pa dang / gnas med par byang chub thob bo //🔽de la rtsa ba ni /🔽gang / gnas ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rtsa ba med pa dang / gnas med par byang chub thob bo // de la rtsa ba ni / gang / gnas ni /
translated: The Thus-Gone One attained awakening without a root and without a basis.🔽What is the root?

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is the basis?

original: 'jig tshogs ni /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs ni /
translated: The root is the perishable collection view,

original: rtsa ba'o // yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ni /🔽gnas so // de gnyis ni /
analyzed: rtsa ba'o // yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa ni / gnas so // de gnyis ni /
translated: and the basis is the imagination of what is unreal.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub dang mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam par yongs su shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub dang mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam par yongs su shes te /
translated: The Thus-Gone One knows these two to be the same as awakening,

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas rtsa ba med pa dang / gnas med par byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas rtsa ba med pa dang / gnas med par byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: and therefore he is said to have fully awakened to unsurpassed and perfect awakening without a root and without a basis.

original: sems can 'di dag gis ni /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gis ni /
translated: These sentient beings

original: rtsa ba med pa dang / gnas med pa'i chos 'di dag khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: rtsa ba med pa dang / gnas med pa'i chos 'di dag khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: The great compassion of the Tathāgata extends to sentient beings, thinking, ‘They have not understood that phenomena are without root or basis, so I will help them understand it.’

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: byang chub ni /🔽zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba'o; ;de la zhi ba ni /🔽gang / nye bar zhi ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni / zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba'o; ;de la zhi ba ni / gang / nye bar zhi ba ni /
translated: awakening🔽is peace and complete peace. In this regard, what is peace?

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is complete peace?

original: nang ni / zhi ba'o //
analyzed: nang ni / zhi ba'o //
translated: The inner is peace.

original: phyi ni / nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: phyi ni / nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: The outer is complete peace.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mig ni / bdag dang / bdag gis stong ste; de ni /
analyzed: mig ni / bdag dang / bdag gis stong ste; de ni /
translated: The eyes are empty of self and what belongs to self;

original: de'i rang bzhin no /🔽rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin no / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni /
translated: that is their nature.

original: bdag dang / bdag gis stong ste /
analyzed: bdag dang / bdag gis stong ste /
translated: The ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are empty of self and what belongs to self;

original: de ni / de'i rang bzhin no //🔽mig stong par @210a *//
analyzed: de ni / de'i rang bzhin no // mig stong par @210a *//
translated: that is their nature.🔽The eyes,

original: yongs su shes nas gzugs rnams la mi rgyug ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes nas gzugs rnams la mi rgyug ste /
translated: having understood them to be empty, do not run toward forms;

original: de'i phyir nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: therefore, they are called completely pacified.

original: rna ba stong par yongs su shes nas sgra rnams la mi rgyug ste /
analyzed: rna ba stong par yongs su shes nas sgra rnams la mi rgyug ste /
translated: Having understood that the ear is empty, one does not pursue sounds.

original: de'i phyir nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “peace.”

original: sna stong par yongs su shes nas dri rnams la mi rgyug ste /
analyzed: sna stong par yongs su shes nas dri rnams la mi rgyug ste /
translated: Having understood that the nose is empty, one does not pursue smells.

original: de'i phyir nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “peace.”

original: lce stong par yongs su shes nas ro rnams la mi rgyug ste /
analyzed: lce stong par yongs su shes nas ro rnams la mi rgyug ste /
translated: Having understood that the tongue is empty, one does not pursue tastes.

original: de'i phyir nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “peace.”

original: lus stong par yongs su shes nas reg bya rnams la mi rgyug ste /
analyzed: lus stong par yongs su shes nas reg bya rnams la mi rgyug ste /
translated: Having understood that the body is empty, one does not pursue touchable things.

original: de'i phyir nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o; ;yid stong par yongs su shes nas chos rnams la mi rgyug ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o; ;yid stong par yongs su shes nas chos rnams la mi rgyug ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called “peace.” Having understood that the mind is empty, one does not pursue dharmas.

original: de'i phyir nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o //🔽sems can 'di dag gis ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o // sems can 'di dag gis ni /
translated: Therefore, it is called “peace.”🔽“These sentient beings have not understood peace and have not understood peacefulness. I will cause them to understand it.”

original: zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /🔽rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /🔽rigs kyi bu /
translated: Thus, noble sir, the great compassion of the Tathāgata extends to sentient beings.

original: sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir byang chub rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir byang chub rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Because the mind is luminous by nature, awakening is luminous by nature.

original: ci'i phyir rang bzhin 'od gsal ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rang bzhin 'od gsal ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called “luminous by nature”?

original: rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is the nature

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa /🔽nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa / nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa /
translated: is free from afflictive emotions,🔽is like space,

original: nam mkha'i rang bzhin /🔽nam mkha' dang mnyam par gzhol ba /
analyzed: nam mkha'i rang bzhin / nam mkha' dang mnyam par gzhol ba /
translated: has the nature of space,🔽is directed toward the sameness of space,🔽and is the same as space.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pas mnyam @210b pa ste; rang bzhin de ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pas mnyam @210b pa ste; rang bzhin de ni /
translated: That nature

original: shin tu 'od gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu 'od gsal ba nyid do //
translated: is extremely luminous.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis ni /
translated: Because childish ordinary beings

original: rang bzhin 'od gsal ba 'di khong du ma chud pas glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'od gsal ba 'di khong du ma chud pas glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs te /
translated: have not understood this luminous nature, they are afflicted by adventitious afflictive emotions.

original: rang bzhin 'od gsal ba de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'od gsal ba de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: The Thus-Gone One’s great compassion extends to sentient beings with the thought, ‘They should understand this luminous nature.’

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: awakening

original: blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa'o //🔽de la blang ba med pa ni /🔽gang / dor ba med pa ni /
analyzed: blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa'o // de la blang ba med pa ni / gang / dor ba med pa ni /
translated: non-appropriation and non-rejection.🔽What is non-appropriation?

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is non-rejection?

original: blang ba med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: blang ba med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Non-appropriation means

original: chos thams cad mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: not grasping at any phenomena.

original: dor ba med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dor ba med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Non-rejection means

original: chos thams cad mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: not rejecting any phenomena.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med par chu bor 'jug pa na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med par chu bor 'jug pa na /
translated: When the Tathāgata enters the river of appropriation and rejection,

original: ji ltar de bzhin nyid la pha rol med pa dang / pha rol med pa ma yin par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba de ltar rgal to //
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin nyid la pha rol med pa dang / pha rol med pa ma yin par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba de ltar rgal to //
translated: he sees that suchness is neither a far shore nor not a far shore. In this way, he crosses over.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad pha rol med pa dang / pha rol dang bral bar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad pha rol med pa dang / pha rol dang bral bar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: In this way, the Tathāgata fully awakens to all phenomena as being without a far shore and free from a far shore.🔽Therefore, he is called the Tathāgata.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o; ;byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gis ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o; ;byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gis ni /
translated: Childish ordinary beings,

original: blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa 'di khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams @211a *//
analyzed: blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa 'di khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams @211a *//
translated: They have not understood non-acceptance and non-rejection, so I will help them understand it.”

original: la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: Not understanding non-acceptance and non-rejection, the Thus-Gone One’s great compassion extends to sentient beings, thinking, ‘They should understand this.’

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: awakening

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'o //🔽de la mtshan ma med pa ni /🔽gang / dmigs pa med pa ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'o // de la mtshan ma med pa ni / gang / dmigs pa med pa ni /
translated: is signless and reference-free.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is signless and what is reference-free?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa ni /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa ni /
translated: The non-apprehension of visual consciousness

original: mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: is signless.

original: gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni /

analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: is reference-free.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa ni /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa ni /
translated: The non-apprehension of auditory consciousness

original: mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: is signless.

original: sgra mnyan du med pa ni /
analyzed: sgra mnyan du med pa ni /
translated: The non-hearing of sound

original: dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: is reference-free.

original: sna'i rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa ni /
analyzed: sna'i rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa ni /
translated: The non-apprehension of olfactory consciousness

original: mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: is signless.

original: dri bsnam du med pa ni /
analyzed: dri bsnam du med pa ni /
translated: The non-smelling of smell

original: dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: is reference-free.

original: lce'i rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa ni /
analyzed: lce'i rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa ni /
translated: The tongue consciousness is non-apprehensible.🔽

original: mtshan ma med pa'o //🔽ro myang du med pa ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'o // ro myang du med pa ni /
translated: The non-apprehension of the tongue consciousness is signlessness.

original: dmigs pa med pa'o //🔽lus kyi rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'o // lus kyi rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa ni /
translated: The non-experience of taste is baselessness.

original: mtshan ma med pa'o //🔽reg bya reg par byar med pa ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'o // reg bya reg par byar med pa ni /
translated: The non-apprehension of the body consciousness is signlessness.

original: dmigs pa med pa'o //🔽yid kyi rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'o // yid kyi rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa ni /
translated: The non-experience of touch is baselessness.

original: mtshan ma med pa'o //🔽chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'o // chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni /
translated: The non-apprehension of the mind consciousness is signlessness.

original: dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: The non-perception of mental objects is baselessness.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa ni /
translated: signlessness and baselessness

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: are the domain of the noble ones.

original: @211b 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang zhe na /
analyzed: @211b 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang zhe na /
translated: What is the domain of the noble ones?

original: gang khams gsum pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa de ni /
analyzed: gang khams gsum pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is not the domain of the three realms

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: is the domain of the noble ones.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: gang spyod yul ma yin pa de ni /
analyzed: gang spyod yul ma yin pa de ni /
translated: that which is not a domain

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul te /
translated: is the domain of the noble ones.

original: 'phags pa'i spyod yul 'di byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i spyod yul 'di byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: The great compassion of the Tathagata extends to all sentient beings, thinking, “These childish ordinary beings have not understood this sphere of activity of the noble ones. I must cause them to understand it.”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: Awakening

original: 'das pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'das pa ma yin /
translated: is not past,

original: ma 'das pa ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'das pa ma yin /
translated: not future,

original: da ltar byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ma yin te /
translated: and not present.

original: dus gsum mnyam pa 'khor gsum yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa 'khor gsum yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: It is the equality of the three times, the complete cessation of the three spheres.

original: de la 'khor gsum yongs su chad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'khor gsum yongs su chad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the complete cessation of the three spheres?

original: gang 'das pa la sems mi 'jug pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la rnam par shes pa mi rgyug pa dang / da ltar byung ba la yid la byed pa mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'das pa la sems mi 'jug pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la rnam par shes pa mi rgyug pa dang / da ltar byung ba la yid la byed pa mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the non-engagement of the mind in the past, the non-running of consciousness in the future, and the non-engagement of mental activity in the present.

original: de sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa mi gnas pas 'das pa la rtog par mi byed /
analyzed: de sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa mi gnas pas 'das pa la rtog par mi byed /
translated: Since the mind, thought, and consciousness do not abide, one does not conceptualize the past.

original: ma 'ongs pa la mi sems /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la mi sems /
translated: One does not think about the future.

original: da ltar byung ba spros par mi byed do //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba spros par mi byed do //
translated: One does not proliferate about the present.

original: de ltar dus gsum mnyam pa nyid dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa 'di sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: de ltar dus gsum mnyam pa nyid dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa 'di sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: Thus, the Thus-Gone One’s great compassion extends to sentient beings with the thought, ‘Sentient beings do not understand the equality of the three times and the complete purity of the three spheres, so I will help them understand this.’

original: @212a *// rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: @212a *// rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: awakening

original: lus med cing 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: lus med cing 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: is without a body and unconditioned.

original: de la lus med pa ni /
analyzed: de la lus med pa ni /
translated: As for being without a body,

original: gang mig gi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: gang mig gi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin /
translated: it is not cognizable by the eye consciousness,

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: nor is it cognizable by the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind consciousness.

original: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni; gang la skye ba med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa dang / gnas med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni; gang la skye ba med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa dang / gnas med pa ste /
translated: As for being unconditioned, it is not born, does not cease, and does not remain.

original: de ni / mtshan nyid gsum dang bral ba'i 'dus ma byas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni / mtshan nyid gsum dang bral ba'i 'dus ma byas zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the unconditioned, which is free from the three characteristics.

original: 'dus ma byas ji lta bar 'dus byas kyang de bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ji lta bar 'dus byas kyang de bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Just as unconditioned phenomena are, so too are conditioned phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The nature of all phenomena is

original: med pa'o // med pa gang yin pa de la ni; gnyis med do //
analyzed: med pa'o // med pa gang yin pa de la ni; gnyis med do //
translated: nonexistent. What is nonexistent is nondual.

original: lus med pa dang / 'dus ma byas 'di byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gis khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: lus med pa dang / 'dus ma byas 'di byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gis khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: The Tathāgata’s great compassion extends to beings with the thought, ‘Those who are childish do not understand the nonexistence, nonarising, noncessation, nondefilement, and nonpurification of phenomena. They do not understand the body, which is like an illusion, or the unconditioned, which is like a dream. I will make them understand.’

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub ces bya ba de ni /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba de ni /
translated: awakening is

original: dbyer med pa dang / gnas so //🔽de la gnas ni /🔽gang / dbyer med pa ni /
analyzed: dbyer med pa dang / gnas so // de la gnas ni / gang / dbyer med pa ni /
translated: indivisible and is the basis.🔽What is the basis?

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is indivisible?

original: de bzhin nyid ni /🔽gnas so // gnas med pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni / gnas so // gnas med pa ni /
translated: The suchness of phenomena is the basis.

original: dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The absence of a basis is indivisible.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni /
translated: The realm of phenomena is the basis.

original: gnas so // tha dad pa ma yin pa @212b ni; dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: gnas so // tha dad pa ma yin pa @212b ni; dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The absence of differentiation is indivisible.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni /
translated: The limit of reality is the basis.

original: gnas so // g-yo ba med pa ni /
analyzed: gnas so // g-yo ba med pa ni /
translated: They abide.🔽🔽They are unmoving.

original: dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: dbyer med pa'o //
translated: It is the same for the other perfections, up to and including wisdom.

original: stong pa nyid ni /🔽gnas so // dmigs su med pa ni /🔽dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni / gnas so // dmigs su med pa ni / dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The perfection of giving is the same as the perfection of wisdom, and the perfection of wisdom is the same as the perfection of giving.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni /🔽gnas so // rnam par rtog pa med pa ni /🔽dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni / gnas so // rnam par rtog pa med pa ni / dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality is the same as the perfection of wisdom, and the perfection of wisdom is the same as the perfection of morality.🔽The perfection of patience is the same as the perfection of wisdom, and the perfection of wisdom is the same as the perfection of patience.

original: smon pa med pa ni /🔽gnas so // smon lam 'debs pa med pa ni /🔽dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa ni / gnas so // smon lam 'debs pa med pa ni / dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The perfection of diligence is the same as the perfection of wisdom, and the perfection of wisdom is the same as the perfection of diligence.

original: sems can med pa nyid ni /🔽gnas so // sems can ngo bo nyid med pa ni /🔽dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: sems can med pa nyid ni / gnas so // sems can ngo bo nyid med pa ni / dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The perfection of concentration is the same as the perfection of wisdom, and the perfection of wisdom is the same as the perfection of concentration.

original: nam mkha' ni /🔽gnas so // dmigs su med pa ni /🔽dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni / gnas so // dmigs su med pa ni / dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the same as the perfection of wisdom, and the perfection of wisdom is the same as the perfection of wisdom.

original: skye ba med pa ni /
analyzed: skye ba med pa ni /
translated: The perfection of giving is the same as the perfection of giving, and the perfection of giving is the same as the perfection of giving.🔽The perfection of morality is the same as the perfection of morality, and the perfection of morality is the same as the perfection of morality.

original: gnas so // 'gog pa med pa ni /🔽dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: gnas so // 'gog pa med pa ni / dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The perfection of patience is the same as the perfection of patience, and the perfection of patience is the same as the perfection of patience.🔽The perfection of diligence is the same as the perfection of diligence, and the perfection of diligence is the same as the perfection of diligence.

original: 'dus ma byas ni /🔽gnas so // rgyu ba med pa ni /🔽dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni / gnas so // rgyu ba med pa ni / dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The perfection of concentration is the same as the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of concentration is the same as the perfection of concentration.

original: byang chub ni /🔽gnas so // nye bar zhi ba ni; dbyer med pa'o //🔽mya ngan las 'das pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni / gnas so // nye bar zhi ba ni; dbyer med pa'o // mya ngan las 'das pa ni /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the same as the perfection of wisdom, and the perfection of wisdom is the same as the perfection of wisdom.🔽The perfection of giving is the same as the perfection of morality, and the perfection of morality is the same as the perfection of giving.🔽The perfection of giving is the same as the perfection of patience, and the perfection of patience is the same as the perfection of giving.🔽The perfection of giving is the same as the perfection of diligence, and the perfection of diligence is the same as the perfection of giving.

original: gnas so // mngon par grub pa med pa ni /
analyzed: gnas so // mngon par grub pa med pa ni /
translated: The perfection of giving is the same as the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of concentration is the same as the perfection of giving.

original: dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The perfection of giving is the same as the perfection of wisdom, and the perfection of wisdom is the same as the perfection of giving.🔽The perfection of morality is the same as the perfection of patience, and the perfection of patience is

original: de ltar dbyer med pa dang / gnas 'di sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: de ltar dbyer med pa dang / gnas 'di sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: The Thus-Gone One’s great compassion extends to all beings with the thought, ‘This is indivisible, but beings do not understand this, so I will help them understand it.’

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: enlightenment

original: lus kyis kyang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya /
analyzed: lus kyis kyang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya /
translated: is not fully awakened to by the body,

original: sems kyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it by the mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lus ni / bem po'o //
analyzed: lus ni / bem po'o //
translated: The body is matter,

original: sems ni / sgyu ma lta bu'o /
analyzed: sems ni / sgyu ma lta bu'o /
translated: and the mind is like an illusion.

original: @213a *// gang lus dang sems 'di lta bur khong du chud pa de ni /
analyzed: @213a *// gang lus dang sems 'di lta bur khong du chud pa de ni /
translated: One who understands the body and mind in this way

original: tha snyad btags nas byang chub ces bya'o /
analyzed: tha snyad btags nas byang chub ces bya'o /
translated: is said to have attained enlightenment through conventional designation.

original: byang chub ni /🔽lus sam / sems sam; chos sam /
analyzed: byang chub ni / lus sam / sems sam; chos sam /
translated: Enlightenment

original: chos ma yin pa'am /🔽yang dag pa'am /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'am / yang dag pa'am /
translated: cannot be expressed by the body, the mind, phenomena,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'am /
translated: non-phenomena,🔽the real,🔽the unreal,

original: bden pa'am / rdzun pa gang gis kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bden pa'am / rdzun pa gang gis kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: the true, or the false.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: Enlightenment

original: chos thams cad kyis brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyis brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: All phenomena are inexpressible.

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: Awakening

original: gang gis tshig tu tha snyad gdags par 'gyur ba'i dbyibs ci'ang med de /
analyzed: gang gis tshig tu tha snyad gdags par 'gyur ba'i dbyibs ci'ang med de /
translated: has no shape whatsoever that could be described in words.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' dbyibs med cing brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du byang chub kyang dbyibs med cing brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' dbyibs med cing brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du byang chub kyang dbyibs med cing brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Just as space has no shape and is inexpressible, so too awakening has no shape and is inexpressible.

original: de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su btsal na /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su btsal na /
translated: When you search for it in this way, just as it is,

original: chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni /
translated: all phenomena

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ste /🔽chos la tshig med do //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ste / chos la tshig med do //
translated: are inexpressible.🔽Dharma is not words.

original: tshig la'ang chos med do //
analyzed: tshig la'ang chos med do //
translated: Words are not dharma.

original: chos kyi tshul kyi rnam pa 'di sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: chos kyi tshul kyi rnam pa 'di sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: The Thus-Gone One’s great compassion extends to beings with the thought, ‘Sentient beings do not understand this aspect of the way of phenomena, so I will help them understand it.’

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: awakening

original: gzung du med pa dang / gzhi med pa'o //
analyzed: gzung du med pa dang / gzhi med pa'o //
translated: is ungraspable and groundless.

original: de la gzung du med pa ni /🔽gang / gzhi med pa ni /
analyzed: de la gzung du med pa ni / gang / gzhi med pa ni /

original: gang zhe na /🔽mig yongs @213b su shes pa ni /
analyzed: gang zhe na / mig yongs @213b su shes pa ni /

original: gzung du med pa'o //🔽gzugs dmigs su med pa ni /
analyzed: gzung du med pa'o // gzugs dmigs su med pa ni /

original: gzhi med pa'o //🔽rna ba yongs su shes pa ni /
analyzed: gzhi med pa'o // rna ba yongs su shes pa ni /

original: gzung du med pa'o //🔽sgra dmigs su med pa ni /
analyzed: gzung du med pa'o // sgra dmigs su med pa ni /

original: gzhi med pa'o //🔽sna yongs su shes pa ni /
analyzed: gzhi med pa'o // sna yongs su shes pa ni /

original: gzung du med pa'o //🔽dri dmigs su med pa ni /
analyzed: gzung du med pa'o // dri dmigs su med pa ni /
translated: The complete understanding of the nose is not apprehended.

original: gzhi med pa'o //🔽lce yongs su shes pa ni /
analyzed: gzhi med pa'o // lce yongs su shes pa ni /
translated: The non-apprehension of smell is baseless.

original: gzung du med pa'o //🔽ro dmigs su med pa ni /
analyzed: gzung du med pa'o // ro dmigs su med pa ni /
translated: The complete understanding of the tongue is not apprehended.

original: gzhi med pa'o //🔽lus yongs su shes pa ni /
analyzed: gzhi med pa'o // lus yongs su shes pa ni /
translated: The non-apprehension of taste is baseless.

original: gzung du med pa'o //🔽reg bya dmigs su med pa ni //
analyzed: gzung du med pa'o // reg bya dmigs su med pa ni //
translated: The complete understanding of the body is not apprehended.

original: gzhi med pa'o //🔽yid yongs su shes pa ni /
analyzed: gzhi med pa'o // yid yongs su shes pa ni /
translated: The non-apprehension of touch is baseless.

original: gzung du med pa'o //🔽chos dmigs su med pa ni /
analyzed: gzung du med pa'o // chos dmigs su med pa ni /
translated: The complete understanding of the mind is not apprehended.

original: gzhi med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi med pa'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of dharmas is baseless.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub gzung du med pa dang / gzhi med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub gzung du med pa dang / gzhi med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata has fully and perfectly realized awakening, which is not apprehended and is baseless.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang mig gzung du med /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang mig gzung du med /
translated: Having fully awakened to perfect buddhahood, the eye is ungraspable.

original: gzugs gzhi ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs gzhi ma yin /
translated: Form is not a basis.

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa med do //
translated: Consciousness has no abode.

original: rna ba gzung du med /
analyzed: rna ba gzung du med /
translated: The ear is ungraspable.

original: sgra gzhi ma yin /
analyzed: sgra gzhi ma yin /
translated: Sound is not a basis.

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa med do //🔽sna gzung du med /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa med do // sna gzung du med /
translated: Consciousness has no abode.🔽The nose is ungraspable.

original: dri gzhi ma yin /
analyzed: dri gzhi ma yin /
translated: Smell is not a basis.

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa med do //
translated: Consciousness has no abode.

original: lce gzung du med /
analyzed: lce gzung du med /
translated: The tongue is ungraspable.

original: ro gzhi ma yin /
analyzed: ro gzhi ma yin /
translated: Taste is not a basis.

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa med do //
translated: Consciousness has no abode.

original: lus gzung du med /
analyzed: lus gzung du med /
translated: The body is ungraspable.

original: reg bya gzhi ma yin /
analyzed: reg bya gzhi ma yin /
translated: Touch is not a basis.

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa med do //
translated: Consciousness has no abode.

original: yid gzung du med /
analyzed: yid gzung du med /
translated: The mind is ungraspable.

original: chos gzhi ma yin /
analyzed: chos gzhi ma yin /
translated: Phenomena are not a basis.

original: @214a *// rnam par shes pa gnas pa med do //
analyzed: @214a *// rnam par shes pa gnas pa med do //
translated: Consciousness has no abode.🔽Since consciousness has no abode, he knows the abodes of the minds of all beings.

original: de rnam par shes pa gnas pa med pas sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi gnas rnams rab tu shes so; ;sems can dag gi sems kyi gnas rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de rnam par shes pa gnas pa med pas sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi gnas rnams rab tu shes so; ;sems can dag gi sems kyi gnas rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the abodes of the minds of beings?

original: sems can rnams kyi sems kyi gnas ni /🔽bzhi po 'di dag go /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems kyi gnas ni / bzhi po 'di dag go /
translated: The abodes of the minds of beings🔽are these four.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gzugs sems can rnams kyi sems kyi gnas dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dag sems can rnams kyi sems kyi gnas te /
analyzed: gzugs sems can rnams kyi sems kyi gnas dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dag sems can rnams kyi sems kyi gnas te /
translated: Form is the basis of the mind of sentient beings, and feeling, perception, and formation are the basis of the mind of sentient beings.

original: sems kyi gnas de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas gnas med par mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems kyi gnas de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas gnas med par mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows those bases of the mind to be baseless.

original: gnas med pa'i mtha' 'di sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: gnas med pa'i mtha' 'di sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: The Tathāgata’s great compassion for sentient beings arises from thinking, ‘Sentient beings are not aware of this baseless limit, and so I must make them understand it.’

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽byang chub ces bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / byang chub ces bya ba 'di ni /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: stong pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags so //
translated: awakening is a term for emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid gang gis byang chub stong pa'i stong pa nyid des chos thams cad stong ngo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gang gis byang chub stong pa'i stong pa nyid des chos thams cad stong ngo //
translated: The emptiness that is the emptiness of awakening is the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: stong pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin du chos de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin du chos de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: The Tathāgata has fully and perfectly realized all those phenomena to be just like emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ma yin no //
translated: Emptiness does not fully awaken to emptiness.

original: de ni / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: stong pa nyid dang / byang chub ces @214b bya ba tshul gcig par shes pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / byang chub ces @214b bya ba tshul gcig par shes pa ste /
translated: Emptiness and awakening are understood to be of the same principle.

original: de la gnyis gang gis stong pa nyid dang / byang chub gnyis su dbye ba'i gnyis cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de la gnyis gang gis stong pa nyid dang / byang chub gnyis su dbye ba'i gnyis cung zad kyang med do //
translated: In that regard, there is not even the slightest duality by which emptiness and awakening are divided into two.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad ni; gnyis su med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni; gnyis su med pa /
translated: All phenomena are nondual.

original: gnyis su dbyer med pa /
analyzed: gnyis su dbyer med pa /
translated: They are not divided into two.

original: mtshan nyid med pa /🔽ming med pa /🔽mtshan ma med pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa / ming med pa / mtshan ma med pa /
translated: They are without defining characteristics.🔽They are without names.

original: rgyu ba med pa /🔽rab tu rgyu ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ba med pa / rab tu rgyu ba med pa'o //
translated: They are without signs.🔽They are without movement.🔽They are without activity.

original: kun tu 'byung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu 'byung ba med pa'o //
translated: They are without origination.

original: gang stong pa zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: gang stong pa zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: That which is called “emptiness”

original: mngon par zhen pa med cing 'dzin pa med pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med cing 'dzin pa med pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: is a term for non-attachment and non-grasping.

original: 'di la don dam par gang stong pa zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang dmigs su med kyang stong pa zhes kyang brjod do //
analyzed: 'di la don dam par gang stong pa zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang dmigs su med kyang stong pa zhes kyang brjod do //
translated: In this regard, ultimately, although no phenomenon whatsoever that is called “emptiness” is apprehended, it is also said to be “empty.”

original: ji ltar nam mkha' la nam mkha' zhes brjod kyang nam mkha' ni /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' la nam mkha' zhes brjod kyang nam mkha' ni /
translated: Just as space is called “space,”🔽but space is not something that can be expressed,

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du stong pa la stong pa zhes brjod kyang stong pa ni /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du stong pa la stong pa zhes brjod kyang stong pa ni /
translated: in the same way, emptiness is called “emptiness,” but emptiness

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: is not something that can be expressed.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: ming med pa la ming du tha snyad 'dogs pa de ni /
analyzed: ming med pa la ming du tha snyad 'dogs pa de ni /
translated: The designation of a name for what is nameless

original: chos thams cad la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la 'jug pa'o //
translated: is the entry into all phenomena.

original: ming de yang yul na gnas pa ma yin /
analyzed: ming de yang yul na gnas pa ma yin /
translated: That name does not exist in a place

original: phyogs na gnas pa ma yin no //🔽ji ltar ming yul na gnas pa ma yin /
analyzed: phyogs na gnas pa ma yin no // ji ltar ming yul na gnas pa ma yin /
translated: or in a direction.🔽Just as that name does not exist in a place

original: phyogs na gnas pa ma yin pa de bzhin du ming gang gis chos gang brjod pa'i chos de'ang yul na gnas pa ma yin /
analyzed: phyogs na gnas pa ma yin pa de bzhin du ming gang gis chos gang brjod pa'i chos de'ang yul na gnas pa ma yin /
translated: or in a direction, in the same way, the phenomenon that is expressed by that name does not exist in a place

original: phyogs na gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs na gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: or in a direction.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos de dag thams cad mkhyen te /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos de dag thams cad mkhyen te /
translated: Thus the Tathāgata knows all those phenomena.

original: gzod @215a *// ma nas ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gag pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa dang / sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral ba dang / yi ge med pa dang / sgra med par shes so //
analyzed: gzod @215a *// ma nas ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gag pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa dang / sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa dang bral ba dang / yi ge med pa dang / sgra med par shes so //
translated: It is unborn and unceasing, without characteristics, and free from mind, mentality, and consciousness. It is without syllables and without sound.

original: ji ltar shes pa de bzhin du rnam par grol te /
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa de bzhin du rnam par grol te /
translated: Just as it is known, it is liberated.

original: bcings pa'ang med /
analyzed: bcings pa'ang med /
translated: There is no bondage,

original: grol ba'ang med do //
analyzed: grol ba'ang med do //
translated: and there is no liberation.

original: mnyam pa nyid 'di'ang byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gis khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid 'di'ang byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gis khong du ma chud pas de dag gis khong du chud par bya'o snyam du sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: Since this equality is not understood by foolish ordinary beings, the Thus-Gone One’s great compassion extends to sentient beings with the thought, ‘I will help them understand this.’

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: awakening

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam ste /
translated: is equal to space.

original: nam mkha' ni /🔽mnyam pa'ang ma yin /🔽mi mnyam pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni / mnyam pa'ang ma yin / mi mnyam pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Space🔽is neither equal nor unequal.

original: byang chub kyang mnyam pa'ang ma yin; mi mnyam pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyang mnyam pa'ang ma yin; mi mnyam pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Awakening is also neither equal nor unequal.

original: chos gang la yang dag par yongs su grub pa med pa de mnyam pa'am mi mnyam par brjod pa ma yin no //🔽de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mnyam pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: chos gang la yang dag par yongs su grub pa med pa de mnyam pa'am mi mnyam par brjod pa ma yin no // de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mnyam pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Any phenomenon that is not truly established is not described as being either the same or different.

original: mi mnyam pa'ang ma yin par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /🔽ji ltar chos cung zad tsam yin yang mnyam par yang mi byed /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'ang ma yin par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te / ji ltar chos cung zad tsam yin yang mnyam par yang mi byed /
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata has fully awakened to all phenomena as neither the same nor different.

original: mi mnyam par yang mi byed pa de ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: mi mnyam par yang mi byed pa de ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: He has fully awakened to the fact that not even the slightest phenomenon is made the same or made different.

original: chos 'di dag ji 'dra ba de 'dra bar yang dag pa'i @215b ye shes kyis mkhyen to //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ji 'dra ba de 'dra bar yang dag pa'i @215b ye shes kyis mkhyen to //
translated: He knows with his perfect wisdom exactly what these phenomena are like.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What is perfect wisdom?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni /
translated: All phenomena

original: rtsa ba med pa /
analyzed: rtsa ba med pa /
translated: are rootless,

original: ma skyes pa /
